story:
NOTRE PROJET (English below)

Fondé en 2013, le projet universitaire MUN Club ULB est une délégation d’étudiants de l’ULB participant à des simulations des Nations Unies en taille réelle. Lors de ces conférences, chaque étudiant se voit assigner un pays, dont il défendra la position sur un sujet prédéfini avec les règles de procédure de l’ONU, comme un vrai diplomate

Six mois après sa fondation, le MUN Club ULB s’est distingué au niveau international en remportant son premier Diplomacy Award au Harvard World MUN 2014 à Bruxelles, qui a rassemblé 2000 étudiants de par le monde. L’année suivante, notre participation au London International MUN nous a valu une autre distinction.

Forts de ce succès, nous avons décidé de continuer cette année et de participer à la prochaine édition du Harvard World MUN, qui se déroulera du 14 au 18 mars 2016. Il faudra d’ici là entraîner cette jeune équipe et se déplacer jusqu'à Rome, où se dérouleront ces « JO de la diplomatie étudiante ». L’effort financier pour les étudiants que nous sommes sera important, raison pour laquelle votre soutien nous est précieux.

En sus, représentant une université belge, nous serons honorés de faire connaître la culture et le patrimoine/savoir-faire belges dans le milieu international de ces conférences, comme nous l’avons déjà fait lors du World MUN à Bruxelles.

Pour en savoir plus, n'hésitez pas à nous rejoindre ou nous contacter via Facebook, mail, Instagram ou Twitter (@munclubulb) :-)

Aidez-nous à devenir le futur de la diplomatie!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

OUR PROJECT 

Founded in 2013, the university project MUN Club ULB is a student delegation from the ULB participating in full-size Models of the United Nations. At these conferences, each student is assigned a country, and will have to defend its position on a specific subject with the procedural rules of the UN, just like a real diplomat would do.

Six months after its foundation, the MUN Club ULB distinguished itself internationally by winning its first Diplomacy Award at the Harvard MUN World 2014 in Brussels, attended by 2000 students from around the world. The following year, our participation in the London International MUN has earned us another distinction.

Building on this success, we decided to continue this year and participate in the next edition of the Harvard World MUN, which will run from 14 to 18 March 2016. Our young team will have to travel to Rome, which will host the "Olympics of student diplomacy." The financial effort for students is important, that is why your support is very valuable to us.

In addition, while representing a Belgian university, we will be honored to share the Belgian culture and heritage in these international conferences, as we have already done at the World MUN in Brussels.

For more information, please feel free to join or contact us via Facebook, email, Twitter or Instagram (@munclubulb) :-)

Help us become the future of diplomacy!

story:
"In the year 2006, I took a trip to India and throughout my time there I not only learned that the culture is beautiful but the colors, prints and textures caught my eye everywhere I turned. It was with the purchase of one pair of handmade leather shoes from a hard working street vendor that was the inspiration for me to start this business."
~Emily Vanderberg (Founder of E & co.)

Our Story

 
E & co. is designed to help spread awareness about the dangers of street vending in third world countries as well as the effects the recession is still pouring out on our small businesses here in America. It is a voice for the hard working from one nation to another and bands them together in an effort to make a difference in both worlds. 

 
India:
 
FACT: Indian Street Vendors make less and sometimes more than 1 American Dollar a day. (National Policy of Urban Street Vendors- 2009)
United States:

FACT: Contributing to the growth of small businesses here in America will lower the unemployment rate.("Poised for Growth, But Not Hiring" by Emily Maltby)

 


The Impact

 

What if, 1 consumer can help the growth of 3 businesses?

Business #1:
We will be scouring the streets of India for talented artisans who work hard to handcraft their own well made products (specifically, Men’s and Women’s Fashion and Travel accessories) using the rich, vibrant textiles India is most commonly known for.
Business #2
The products will then be brought back to the United States where we will be working with small businesses who have the tools/skills necessary to refine the products and test their durability.
Business #3:
The line of products will then be available for purchase at my online store, www.eandcompany.com, coming soon (with your help)!
 
 
With each purchase from E & co. ...

The street vendors will receive a percentage of the profit and get the validation and resources they need to further their business or their education, small American businesses get the revenue they’ve been missing and through my online store, the consumer gets beautifully handcrafted, imported Indian items.  

 

Why I'm Qualified for the Job


After receiving my BS in Business Administration and Concentration in Finance, I had the privilege of working hand in hand with women’s fashion designer ” Christina Lehr” for 3 years, managing her wholesale business and helping to open her first retail location in NYC! It was an amazing experience and I feel as though it’s time to express my creative eye, while giving back.

 

What We Need

 

We need to raise funds for 3 major aspects of this start-up: airfare, the E & co. website (eandcompany.com) and some start up capital to purchase our first round of goods!

  

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Once the website is up and running there will be a “Donations” page for the street vendors I will be working with in India to whom you can donate to. 100% of all donations made on eandcompany.com will go directly to the street vendor.


I leave you with this...
If you believe in the future of “E & co.” and don’t have the means to support, I ask that you spread the awareness about the dangers of street vending in India, the struggles small businesses face in America and spread the word to your friends and family about “E & co.” as a way to help... oh yeah... and like us on Facebook! :) Thank you so much!!!
 
 
 A Big Thank You to Eve Burris for the making of the video!!!!! I couldn't have done it without you!!

~Emily Vanderberg (Founder of E & co.)
Our Story
 
E & co. is designed to help spread awareness about the dangers of street vending in third world countries as well as the effects the recession is still pouring out on our small businesses here in America. It is a voice for the hard working from one nation to another and bands them together in an effort to make a difference in both worlds. 

 
India:
 

FACT: Indian Street Vendors make less and sometimes more than 1 American Dollar a day. (National Policy of Urban Street Vendors- 2009)

United States:


FACT:  Contributing to the growth of small businesses here in America will lower the unemployment rate.("Poised for Growth, But Not Hiring" by Emily Maltby)

 



The Impact
 


What if, 1 consumer can help the growth of 3 businesses?
Business #1: We will be scouring the streets of India for talented artisans who work hard to handcraft their own well made products (specifically, Men’s and Women’s Fashion and Travel accessories) using the rich, vibrant textiles India is most commonly known for. 
Business #2
The products will then be brought back to the United States where we will be working with small businesses who have the tools/skills necessary to refine the products and test their durability. 
Business #3:
The line of products will then be available for purchase at my online store, www.eandcompany.com, coming soon (with your help)!
 
 
With each purchase from E & co. ...

The street vendors will receive a percentage of the profit and get the validation and resources they need to further their business or their education, small American businesses get the revenue they’ve been missing and through my online store, the consumer gets beautifully handcrafted, imported Indian items.  


 
Why I'm Qualified for the Job

After receiving my BS in Business Administration and Concentration in Finance, I had the privilege of working hand in hand with women’s fashion designer ” Christina Lehr” for 3 years, managing her wholesale business and helping to open her first retail location in NYC! It was an amazing experience and I feel as though it’s time to express my creative eye, while giving back. 

 


What We Need
 




We need to raise funds for 3 major aspects of this start-up: airfare, the E & co. website (eandcompany.com) and some start up capital to purchase our first round of goods! 




  


Other Ways You Can Help
 


Once the website is up and running there will be a “Donations” page for the street vendors I will be working with in India to whom you can donate to. 100% of all donations made on eandcompany.com will go directly to the street vendor.



I leave you with this...
If you believe in the future of “E & co.” and don’t have the means to support, I ask that you spread the awareness about the dangers of street vending in India, the struggles small businesses face in America and spread the word to your friends and family about “E & co.” as a way to help... oh yeah... and like us on Facebook! :) Thank you so much!!!
 
 
 A Big Thank You to Eve Burris for the making of the video!!!!! I couldn't have done it without you!!

story:
What is Double Bucks?

The Double Bucks Program is great way to improve access to fresh and local foods for low-income residents in Durham and to support our local farmers and food producers.

Let us tell you how:

For any amount up to $10, Double Bucks matches whatever SNAP (Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, formerly known as Food Stamps) shoppers swipe their EBT (Electronic Benefits Transfer) card for at the Durham Farmers' Market (DFM). 

So, if someone swipes their card for $10, they receive $20 worth of wooden tokens to spend at the DFM. This encourages shoppers to try out the market for their veggies, breads, eggs, cheeses, meats, and more. It is a win-win for shoppers and DFM producers alike...it helps to fill fridges with healthy, local food while supporting small food producers by keeping federal assistance dollars in the community.


What We Need & What You Get

By the end of this campaign, we hope to raise $7,500. This will complete our total fundraising goal of $15,000 to sustain the program through the 2015 season.  

The exciting news is: we are already half way there! With the help of our fiscal sponsor, the Rural Advancement Foundation International (RAFI-USA), we have applied for and received two grants, reached out to individuals and local business for sponsorships, and also held the 1st Annual DFM Costume Contest that raised about $1,000 for the Double Bucks Program.
We have $7,500 already raised, and we need your help to get us the rest of the way there. Seventy-five percent of these funds will go straight towards the matching dollars – aka straight into the hands of SNAP shoppers and spent entirely in at the booths of DFM vendors. Other costs include: staff time to run the program; supplies like wooden tokens and receipt books; outreach and marketing materials to let the community know about the program.

In return, we are offering many unique (and delicious!) rewards! We want to deck you out in our lovely Durham Farmers' Market t-shirts, tote bags, and hats. We also want to fill your bellies with produce and products from our farmers, bakers, and more. And if those prizes are not tempting enough, we also want to give you tickets to our 1st Annual Spring Picnic Dinner in April 2015, featuring food and drink from your favorite local farmers, chefs, and breweries!



The Impact

Research has now shown that a monetary incentives can cause a permanent shift in purchasing patterns for customers using food assistance benefits – and this shift directly benefits food producers. Evaluation of similar incentive programs show: 

· An increase in new market customers, repeat customers, revenue, and sales of fruits and vegetables 

· About 27% of market revenue comes from federal SNAP benefits and incentive funds.

· 90% of SNAP customers increase or greatly increase their consumption of fruits and vegetables, thus reducing their risk of many diet related chronic diseases.

In other words, the Double Bucks Program has the potential to make positive and lasting impacts in the health of the SNAP/EBT recipients in Durham-- especially for the 5,800 recipients living within a 3 mile radius of the Durham Farmers' Market. Additionally, it will keep federal food dollars in the community among the local producers instead of big chains.


Risks & Challenges


A challenge for the Double Bucks Program is to conduct successful and effective outreach to ensure that SNAP/EBT customers know about the program and that the market is an appealing, accessible place to shop. 

To help us in this area we are working closely with the Durham County Department of Public Health to produce and distribute informational materials to organizations with close ties to the community, health clinics, churches, and schools. With the DcDPH's help, we have also been able to promote the program through bus and radio advertisements. We also plan to conduct a SNAP customer survey to gauge the experience at the market. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are excited about helping us achieve our goal but cannot contribute monetarily, here are other awesome ways to be a part of this program:

1. Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Spread the word by emailing this to friends and family, sharing it on social media, or sending it out on network listservs. 

2. Love interacting with people? Become a volunteer at the Durham Farmers' Market! We are always looking for more friendly faces join our team and help us strengthen our program during market hours.


THANK YOU!!

story:
Join us for a night of masquerade fun!

For a couple years, I have had the desire to throw a New Year's Eve masquerade where people could dress in costume and have fun with others while ringing in the New Year. This year, 2013, I decided it was time to stop thinking about throwing a masquerade and actually *do* it. But it requires money to do just that, and to make it as phenomenal as possible.

The goal is to make this an annual event that everyone can look forward to and that can expand for more to enjoy. 

The first thing that was most important was getting a hotel secured for the event, and to find a DJ. Mission accomplished on both counts!

The masquerade will be hosted at the Lancaster Host Resort & Conference Center in Lancaster, PA.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to help offset the costs, there will be a $20 cover charge, but I am also giving the option for people to donate more if they wish to help out with other costs, including decorations and the DJ:

  • If you are paying for more than one person as you donate, choose the higher "perk" and make a private comment saying that you are paying for the cover charge for more than one person- please include your name and their name(s) so that I can make a note in my spreadsheet.
    • All funding raised goes directly into the event by paying for:
      • Catering at the hotel
      • The DJ services of C.F. Star Entertainment
      • Decor
      • An additional tip for the bartender since it is a cash bar
    • A $15 supporting donation has been added. This is for people that may want to attend this year but can not, but still want to help. They will receive the following:
      • An engraved champagne flute
      • Special recognition at the masquerade 
    • $20 cover charge covers your cost to attend. This includes your buffet dinner, entertainment for the evening, and a champagne toast at midnight.
    • Any donations of $25-30, you will receive the following in addition to the buffet, entertainment for the evening, and a champagne toast at midnight:
      • Special recognition at the masquerade
    • Any donations of $35 or more, you will receive the following in addition to the buffet, entertainment for the evening, and a champagne toast at midnight:
      • An engraved champagne flute
      • Special recognition at the masquerade 

    The Future

    I hope that this is just the first year of this event. When I intially decided to go for it while planning, it has always been with the intent of creating a fun and inspiring event that could lead to an annual event people look forward to that just keeps growing each year- both in attendance, costumes, and the level of creativity.

story:
About #HereForFarmers 

Agriculture industry is facing a really big challenge: to produce 70 percent more food in order to feed the World’s 10 billion population by the year 2050. It is not an easy task; farmers from all corners of the Earth are doing their very best to ensure we all have enough food on our table. 

However, most of us might not be aware that farming is a stressful occupation. The Newsweek reported that "farmers are a dying breed" and suicide rates among farmers are the highest in comparison to other professions. 

We are running #HereForFarmers campaign to raise funds and awareness for farmers mental health. Help us support those who provide us with our daily sustenance! 

Read more about why we are doing this on our blog!

Let's Show Support For Farmers! 

There is a disconnect between farmers and the general population; the majority of us know very little how our food is produced and what it takes to produce them. Here's a sneak peek about what farmers do to produce the food we consume:  

video courtesy of Jay Schultz, fourth generation farmer in Alberta.  

How You Can Contribute

As you can see, farmers work hard to produce food that we consume. If you eat bread, drink beer or enjoy the occasional steak, you should consider buying these t-shirts to support our farmers.  

Select one of the three t-shirt designs below on the right hand side >>>

Proceeds from the t-shirt sale will be donated to Farm Stress Line, which is managed by Mobile Crisis, a non-profit agency providing crisis intervention services since 1974. They provide confidential telephone counseling, support, information and referral services that respond to the needs of farmers. 

Donation and Cost Break Down

We aim to sell at least 300 t-shirt for #HereForFarmers campaign. Help us get there! 

Buy a t-shirt, or two (your craft beer enthusiast friend would thank you for it!)

We want to raise a minimum of $6,600 dollars (roughly equal to $1,500 dollars donation to the Farm Stress Line). Our estimated donation per t-shirt is $5.46. Here is the estimated cost breakdown:

T-shirt production: $10.40
Shipping: $5
Indiegogo fee per t-shirt: $0.88
Credit card processing fee per t-shirt: $0.66
Total cost per t-shirt $16.54
Donation per t-shirt $5.46

We will post the cost breakdown and receipts at the end of this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help 

Get the word out! Share this on social media and/or ask your friends or family to support this cause. Use the #HereForFarmers!

FAQ:

  1. What's the t-shirt material and fit?
    It's a semi-fitted, polyester-cotton blend t-shirt. 
  2. Do you have other colours?
    Unfortunately no, only heather gray. 
  3. Can I order multiple t-shirts/select different perks all at once?
    At the moment, Indiegogo does not have that option. However, we added 3 t-shirts and 6 t-shirts options if you would like to order multiple items. We'll follow up with you to get the details. 
  4. When will you start shipping the t-shirts?
    After the campaign ends, we will begin processing orders received after March 12th and ship them to you asap! If you have any questions about your order, feel free to email anastasia@farmathand.com.

story:
$3 for $1! Return on Investment!

We are super excited to have contributors earn triple their investment with us.

For each $1 invested we will offer $3 in store credits ready to use immediately.

  • Guy and Gallard is a successful chain of gourmet food and coffee located in New York City.
  • We are serving 1000's of locals daily in our 6 locations.
  • We have gourmet coffee and food and we want to expand our locations to serve more people.
  • We are adding all new exciting menu items and all of it is top-notch prepared by our chefs.
  • New Location will be a new concept in lounge and workspace for busy travelers and locals.

We are raising $500K to launch a new location, the money will go to build out and initial inventory. Each contribution will instantly be rewarded with a gift card to any of the current locations and can be redeemed for any items available.

What We Need & What You Get

Construction and Inventory

  • We are experts in running restaurants and we will use the funds to build out a new location.
  • each person who contributes will get an instant gift card loaded with 3x their contribution.
  • If you invest $10 you will get $30 back instantly that you can spend in any current location.

The Impact

Locals and Travelers need a place where then Eat, Drink and Relax but also get work done when needed. 

  • Our new locations will have state of the art seating arrangements
  • Every patron will be able to Work, Eat and Relax with Free Wifi and Power
  • All of our Contributors will have V.I.P. access to special events and more

Risks & Challenges

We are a successful business already operating with millions in revenue.

  • We have been operating in this space for more than 20 years

Other Ways You Can Help

We value all of our customers and visitors, 

  • if you refer people to our campaign, we are open to showing gratitude with a free coffee
  • Please share our campaign and feel free to help contribute ideas and suggestions

We appreciate your time

story:
Although Polish kosher products are of high quality and in competitive prices, the producers still lack knowledge of how to make kosher, how to make contacts with companies that grant kosher certificates, as well as, they lack business relations with international dealers. The dealers could help Polish kosher companies to represent them at different fairs all around the world.

Because such firms which do not cooperate with international dealers do not maximize their profits and also the Jewish community cannot buy these local products so easily.
Not only will this two-day fair be a good platform for developing an international networking system between Poles and Jews from all around the world, but also it will be an interesting place for attendees. We will offer a range of lectures on Jewish food tradition and culture –mainly connected with preparation and consumption of meals, presentation of Israeli and Jewish cuisines (traditional food preparation and cooking workshops), and Polish Jewish organizations market, which will help to promote them and find new sponsors for their products.

Mission and aim of the project


Our mission is:

  • To organize the first kosher food fair in Poland and create a platform for polish and Israeli companies to make new business relations.
  • To promote both Polish and Jewish companies, their products, as well as to promote some Polish and world restaurants.
  • To organize workshops concerning a broadly defined Jewish cuisine.
  • To promote Jewish organizations in Poland and to help in establishing new business relations with prospective sponsors.

The beneficiary of the program is a group of Polish companies which produces and supplies the Jewish community in Poland with kosher products. Furthermore, all the Jewish companies from all around the world that are currently looking for an inexpensive, good-quality produce to export or to process will benefit greatly form this program.

The secondary beneficiary is both a group of Jewish organizations in Poland that will be able to promote themselves and to establish new contacts; and some Jewish companies that produce or provide their services in Poland.
The need On the basis of conversations which I have conducted with both representatives of some national and local Polish companies, and with some international Jewish organization which specialize in kosher food , I have collected information and opinions that this kind of initiative would be of great interest. Polish products, especially fruit and vegetables, are competitive to other products available on the international kosher food market. Thus, introducing and cooperating with Polish brands is highly desirable.

Achievements

This project will be the first of its kind in Poland. For last six months it has been in its organizational phase. This means that we have already booked an appropriate venue for this event (Holiday Inn Hotel in Kraków). We have also created: a stand distribution plan, information materials for Polish companies, a website(kosherpoland.pl) ; we have started collaboration with a stand organization company and a catering company (the latter will prepare and wait kosher lunches during the fair).
We have finished an initial talk with some Polish institutions and representatives of the Polish government. Also, we have concluded our initial talks with Polish companies that specialize in kosher food. All parties of the conversations expressed their interest in this project.

When we will call it a success?
The project will end successfully if about 70 Polish companies will take part in it. Furthermore, it will be successful to us if the amount of attendees reaches 300 guests from all around the world.
After finishing the project, we intend to conduct a survey among Polish companies and attendees. The survey will help us to establish a broader picture of newly established business relations, the amount of signed contracts, and post Kosher Expos meetings and business conversations.
Our project is innovative, because it is the first project of this kind in Poland. Never before has there been any kosher show in Poland! While organizing this particular venture, we have established plenty of contacts with representatives of the Polish government, such as: Embassy of Israel in Poland, Polish-Israeli Chamber of Commerce, and Polish-Israeli Parliamentary Group.
Moreover, we have started a cooperation with representatives of some organization and people in the worldwide kosher food industry.
Such a fair is a great opportunity to promote a local Jewish community. It’s a chance to show that the Jewish Kraków is not only revolving around abandoned synagogues or a touristic stopping and sleeping point on the road to Auschwitz, but it is also a place of international Jewish business.

In my opinion, I think that this project is a good depiction of a Jewish start-up, which is not only about broad business aspects, but also about social aspects. Our project is rather innovative in relation to local conditions, but that is not all – it gains from many good practices of fairs that were organized in the USA, Europe or China. It is both a business and a social platform for international relations. By its business factor, this project should be able to self-maintain financially and develop immensily in the future.

Funds:

The project will cost around: 35 500 $
Venue: 20 000 $
Booths system: 8 000$
Promotion: 5000$
Expo Guide: 2500$
Most of the costs will be covered by companies who will show their products on our expo.
Funding that we will collect here will be spent on a first
prepayment for the venue and promotion in order to have more time to get clients

 

The Charles and Lynn Schusterman Family Foundation (Schusterman) was pleased to back this campaign as part of its crowdfunding matching initiative. Thanks to your backing, we are one step closer to earning their total pledge! Schusterman is a global organization that seeks to ignite the passion and unleash the power in young people to create positive change for themselves, the Jewish community and the broader world. Looking to hear about more Schusterman Opportunities? Click here.

The dealers could help Polish kosher companies to represent them at different fairs all around the world.
Because such firms which do not cooperate with international dealers do not maximize their profits and also the Jewish community cannot buy these local products so easily.Not only will this two-day fair be a good platform for developing an international networking system between Poles and Jews from all around the world, but also it will be an interesting place for attendees. We will offer a range of lectures on Jewish food tradition and culture –mainly connected with preparation and consumption of meals, presentation of Israeli and Jewish cuisines (traditional food preparation and cooking workshops), and Polish Jewish organizations market, which will help to promote them and find new sponsors for their products.
Mission and aim of the project
Our mission is:

To organize the first kosher food fair in Poland and create a platform for polish and Israeli companies to make new business relations.
To promote both Polish and Jewish companies, their products, as well as to promote some Polish and world restaurants.
To organize workshops concerning a broadly defined Jewish cuisine.
To promote Jewish organizations in Poland and to help in establishing new business relations with prospective sponsors.

The beneficiary of the program is a group of Polish companies which produces and supplies the Jewish community in Poland with kosher products. Furthermore, all the Jewish companies from all around the world that are currently looking for an inexpensive, good-quality produce to export or to process will benefit greatly form this program.
The secondary beneficiary is both a group of Jewish organizations in Poland that will be able to promote themselves and to establish new contacts; and some Jewish companies that produce or provide their services in Poland.The need On the basis of conversations which I have conducted with both representatives of some national and local Polish companies, and with some international Jewish organization which specialize in kosher food , I have collected information and opinions that this kind of initiative would be of great interest. Polish products, especially fruit and vegetables, are competitive to other products available on the international kosher food market. Thus, introducing and cooperating with Polish brands is highly desirable.
Achievements
This project will be the first of its kind in Poland. For last six months it has been in its organizational phase. This means that we have already booked an appropriate venue for this event (Holiday Inn Hotel in Kraków). We have also created: a stand distribution plan, information materials for Polish companies, a website(kosherpoland.pl) ; we have started collaboration with a stand organization company and a catering company (the latter will prepare and wait kosher lunches during the fair).We have finished an initial talk with some Polish institutions and representatives of the Polish government. Also, we have concluded our initial talks with Polish companies that specialize in kosher food. All parties of the conversations expressed their interest in this project.
When we will call it a success?The project will end successfully if about 70 Polish companies will take part in it. Furthermore, it will be successful to us if the amount of attendees reaches 300 guests from all around the world.After finishing the project, we intend to conduct a survey among Polish companies and attendees. The survey will help us to establish a broader picture of newly established business relations, the amount of signed contracts, and post Kosher Expos meetings and business conversations.Our project is innovative, because it is the first project of this kind in Poland. Never before has there been any kosher show in Poland! While organizing this particular venture, we have established plenty of contacts with representatives of the Polish government, such as: Embassy of Israel in Poland, Polish-Israeli Chamber of Commerce, and Polish-Israeli Parliamentary Group.Moreover, we have started a cooperation with representatives of some organization and people in the worldwide kosher food industry.Such a fair is a great opportunity to promote a local Jewish community. It’s a chance to show that the Jewish Kraków is not only revolving around abandoned synagogues or a touristic stopping and sleeping point on the road to Auschwitz, but it is also a place of international Jewish business.
In my opinion, I think that this project is a good depiction of a Jewish start-up, which is not only about broad business aspects, but also about social aspects. Our project is rather innovative in relation to local conditions, but that is not all – it gains from many good practices of fairs that were organized in the USA, Europe or China. It is both a business and a social platform for international relations. By its business factor, this project should be able to self-maintain financially and develop immensily in the future.
Funds:
The project will cost around: 35 500 $Venue: 20 000 $Booths system: 8 000$Promotion: 5000$Expo Guide: 2500$Most of the costs will be covered by companies who will show their products on our expo.Funding that we will collect here will be spent on a firstprepayment for the venue and promotion in order to have more time to get clients
 

The Charles and Lynn Schusterman Family Foundation (Schusterman) was pleased to back this campaign as part of its crowdfunding matching initiative. Thanks to your backing, we are one step closer to earning their total pledge! Schusterman is a global organization that seeks to ignite the passion and unleash the power in young people to create positive change for themselves, the Jewish community and the broader world. Looking to hear about more Schusterman Opportunities? Click here.

story:
We've curated some incredible pledge perks for cider lovers with help from our craft cider community friends. 

FEATURE PERK 1 – TRY OUR CIDER: This is the most important offer for us because it means people are out there trying our cider. Your pledge gives you a chance to grab yourself a gift card for a round of Sulker's Cider from Toronto's best cider bar, Her Father’s Cider Bar & Kitchen on Harbord Street.

 

 

FEATURE PERK 2 – GRAB SOME SULKER'S SWAG: We've designed custom Sulker's Swag for our backers. Have a look at what's in store!

 

 

– Scroll down for more Pledge Perks – 

 

Our cider is crafted to provide an alternative to an Ontario market dominated by over-sweetened, mainstream import cider.  

Made with 100% Ontario apples, Sulker's is focused on pushing the boundaries of what cider can be with quality local ingredients and a creative approach. 

 

If you've ever tried a hard cider and thought it was way too syrupy and sweet, we invite you to try Sulker's Cider.  Here's the deal: the majority of  import brands add large amounts of sugar and flavourings to their finished product with little care for the actual apples they make their cider from. In fact, one of the more popular imports is made from low quality grape juice and is flavoured with apple flavouring. Can you guess which one?

 

 

 
 
 
 
Every drop of Sulker's is made from a carefully perfected blend of freshly pressed Ontario apple juice.  We work with some incredible growers in the region and spent a year experimenting until we found the perfect varieties of delicious apples to go into our cider blend. That means when you order a pint of Sulker's, you're ordering the best this region has to offer. 
 
 
 
 

As much as we are focused on making a true-to-fruit cider – we are also focused on experimenting with different ingredients and techniques in our recipes.  Whether it’s the addition of other fruits like cherries or pineapple, or carefully infusing our ciders with unexpected flavours like charred American oak, we are constantly looking to offer unique cider experiences for all seasons. 

 

 

 

 

It all started with a tasting club. To refine our offering, we created a members-only club of food & beverage writers, restaurant owners, brewers & craft influencers. Every month a new batch of cider was delivered, shared online and reviewed.

 

 

This important feedback has allowed us to meticulously perfect our recipes, try some radically new flavour combinations and most importantly, build a community of loyal Sulker’s Cider supporters, without whom, we wouldn’t be where we are today.

 

 

 

 

Our process of making cider is essentially no different than when cider was made by farmers 100 years ago.  In-season apples are selected, stored for a period of time in a cool environment, pressed into juice, and slowly fermented with yeast.

 

 

We worked with a local Ontario orchard on selecting the specific apple varieties that go into our cider.  The benefit of this approach is that your cider is ultimately only as good as the apples that go into making it.  To create a flavourful cider we purposefully selected a mix of Cortland, Idared and Northern Spy apples as our base.  To help with some of the aromatics we also included a small portion of McIntosh and Empire apples.

 

 

 

For our first year of operation, we’ve pressed 15,000 litres of juice for cider production, which is housed in 3 large fermenters at our production space. With our newly purchased 1000L totes, we’re able to pull off smaller amounts of our cider base and experiment with different infusions to produce some creative offerings that you won’t find on tap anywhere else in Ontario.

 

 

 

 

Join us at our Official Sulker's Cider Launch Party during Ontario Craft Cider Week and take advantage of some great Early Bird savings! We'll be taking over a sunny Toronto patio on Sunday May 28th and ringing in our launch Sulker's Cider style. Hope to see you there- tickets are limited!

 

 

Or immortalize yourself in cider-form with these limited offers!

 

 

 

 

I’ve been a home brewer for over 8 years and started making cider simply because I couldn’t find what I was looking for. Cider is a beverage that’s rich in history and tradition- it predates beer and wine.  It’s about farming, it’s about an orchard and honouring the region where it’s grown. I started the Sulker’s Cider journey a year ago and along the way, I got to know some incredible cider makers in Ontario like: Chris from West Avenue, Tariq at Revel, Nick at Pommies and Matt at Applewoods.  They’re forging a path for what cider can be in Ontario, and I want to join this burgeoning movement. My goal is to help realize Ontario’s potential for becoming a region that’s recognized for having incredible cider. Our land makes some of the best apples in the world, there’s no reason why we shouldn’t be known for making some of the most acclaimed ciders out there.

Getting to this place has not been an easy path and I know that running a cidery in Ontario is by no means a get-rich-quick scheme. I hope you share in my vision and will support this campaign. From the bottom of my heart, I appreciate it.

Let’s make some cider!

-Matt

 

 

As the old saying goes – it takes a village to start a cidery.

We’d like to thank everyone that has been there since we started this adventure over a year ago. We could not have made it this far without you:

 

 

  • Toronto Beer Club @TorontoBeerClub
  • Ontario Craft Cider @ontariocraftcider
  • Patrick Turbide @craft_connoisseur
  • Joel Solish @foodie411
  • Chris Chryer, Toronto Beer Blog, @chrischryer
  • Daniel Demsky
  • Patrick Weir
  • Evan Bonsell
  • Shane Martin
  • Mark Verok
  • Justin B Stein
  • Matt Gibson 
  • Alaistair Sinclair
  • Our Tasting Club Members
  • Everyone who supports us!

Joel Solish @foodie411
Chris Chryer, Toronto Beer Blog, @chrischryer

Patrick Weir
Evan Bonsell
Shane Martin
Mark Verok
Justin B Stein
Matt Gibson 
Alaistair Sinclair
Our Tasting Club Members
Everyone who supports us!

story:
Short Summary

I come from humble beginnings and spent a lot of time in Laundromats growing up. They were dirty, boring and sometimes unsafe spaces then, and unfortunately, they still are today.

Everyone deserves to be treated with dignity and respect.

It's time that we invest in these underperforming community assets, transforming them into vibrant social hubs that celebrate arts, culture, and community.

It's time that we give opportunity youth an empowering on-the-job training experience to learn and grow from.

Your investment in Social Spin will have a big impact on the people who depend on our Laundromats, and the opportunity youth who work there.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We plan on opening five Social Spin Laundromat locations in 5 years and need your help to kick-start this movement.

We're raising $75,000.

  • $50,000 will be used to help us purchase our first location - an existing Laundromat in need of TLC.
  • $10,000 would be used for utility deposits.
  • $15,000 would be used for renovating our first Laundromat, and operational expenses.

 
We've created amAZing Social Spin swag for contributors, partnered with local artists to create unique gifts and professionals to offer their services, and are ready to wash & fold your laundry in exchange for your contribution.  
 
We'll invest any funds raised into opening our first Laundromat. If we do not achieve our goal, we'll reassess our expansion timeline. If we overachieve our goal, we'll accelerate it! 
 

The Impact

We all love feeling love. We all love being treated with dignity and respect. We have an opportunity to turn a service that people depend on into a space that creates memories. And, while we're at it, we'll empower our next generation.
 

Risks and Challenges

Our biggest risk is the decline of the Laundromat industry. The industry is declining not because the need is, but because Laundromats are being pushed out of communities to make way for development.

Our biggest challenge is capital. Purchasing an established Laundromat is expensive. Building a Laundromat from the ground up is very expensive!

We will find a way to launch these laundromats because they are essential for so many in our community and we have a way we can do it better.

We're committed to being a resource for people who depend on Laundromats. Our pie in the sky dream is to purchase land so that we can stay in communities that need us most.

We're committed to making wise capital investments, focused maximizing our resources for the betterment of our customers, our team members, and our community.

As an Arizona-based benefit corporation, we're committed to people over profit.

Your cash contribution is very appreciated.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways to join our movement include

  • Using our wash & fold service. The more customers we have, the more opportunity youth we can train. 
  • Share your time and talent with us, especially as we work to transform our first Laundromat.
  • Consider serving as a drop-off location for our wash & fold services.
  • Share this campaign with people you think would be interested in transforming Laundromats and supporting opportunity youth.
  • Follow us on social media:  Facebook. Instagram. Twitter. LinkedIn.

story:
In our area of small town Texas, more and more people are becoming aware of their health and wanting to become healthier everyday! It's also somewhat difficult, at times, to BE healthy, when it's hard to find the goods and foods you're looking for! Many shopping trips take two-three stops before the health conscious person can find all the things they need to live a more nourishing lifestyle. Trust me, we are those people! 

Our Mission: We hunt, you gather! 

Let us take the guesswork out of your hunt. We've hunted down all the purest ingredient items we could find. Things we know, use in our daily lives, and love. Things that are real, organic, sustainably raised and grown, free of added junk! You won't find a meal we serve or an item we sell that has things like gluten, GMOs,  grains, corn, soy, MSG, peanuts, or other additives. The products we love are as unadulterated and close to the source as possible, and you can trust that the ingredients will feed your lifestyle well.  

We've worked very hard, for well over a year,  to find the perfect place for our venture to help you! And we've found it! Hip hip hooray!! 

 Even though we strive to get you the most nutrient dense and delicious foods, we also will be using predominantly recycled goods in our cafe and market! From the furniture and fixtures, to the kitchen equipment, everything will be given a second life here. Every dime spent is one spent on something that had a past! We believe strongly in reusing, repurposing, and recycling; and even our take out containers can be recycled and/or composted to better help our environment. We believe in creating as very little waste as humanly possible, lessening our carbon footprint on the world. We love the earth and what it provides us, so we treat her with kindness, always! 

The master plans lie in this new awesome trapper keeper!

So, now, the good part! The nitty gritty! The dollars and cents of it all! We would love YOUR support! If you've been screaming for an easier way to shop and eat truly quality meals, this is a project you'll love. If you've wanted to start a healthier lifestyle for yourself and your family, but just don't know where to start, this is a project worth backing!! If you just want to be able to walk into a place and ask a million questions about food and lifestyle, well then, pull up a seat and we'll chat all day, because this is a place for YOU! We'd be thrilled to have our community's and friends' support on our venture; one that's a one of a kind and unique to Southeast Texas, and particularly, Port Neches. We want to be your paleo or real food headquarters! Come "Gather", we'd love to feed you, mind, body, and soul! 

Where is my money going?

ANY donation to our new adventure is GREATLY appreciated and humbly received. Know that your dollars are going straight into things that will get the doors open to you quickly and efficiently! This means, construction costs to move a few things around in the space (plumbing in new gas lines, new drain and water lines, electrical work, sheetrock work, etc.), cost of some equipment (we have most of the kitchen equipment, but need a few things like fridges and freezers, a vent hood, stainless steel prep tables) and permitting, and money to getting you the very best deals possible on the things you're tired of hunting for all over town!  If you'd like to be a part of something so special, something that'll be the first of it's kind locally, please think about investing in us! And check out our perks for donating!! Include warm hugs!! 

Our Impact Hopes & Dreams

Jodi and I have lots of dreams with regard to this business, but the most important one is to help YOU succeed! We know that living a real food lifestyle can have its challenges, and one of the biggest difficulties is finding all of the compliant ingredients you'd want or need! So we've compiled a grand list of things we are going to be putting in one place, so you can have access to those hard to find goods that you're tired of driving all over town for! Plus, we love to cook good food that is flavorful as well as nutrient dense! Our ingredients are of the highest quality, ensuring you're getting all your body needs in every bite! We vow to never sacrifice quality!! Feeding you delicious meals is our passion, and we hope that you leave Gather full, fueled, and knowing you can live this lifestyle every day too!! We will gladly pass on every ounce of knowledge we have to you! 

Why We Will Succeed

We will succeed because of all of you! Not just those who donate to our cause here, but those of you who have purchased our goods in the past, continue to, and will in the future. You've bought our roux, our spice mixes, our granola, our mayo, dressings and bone broths! You have made it so we can continue to do what we love, and you've made it so we are able to provide you with Gather. If you build it, they will come....well, you came, so we're building so you'll continue coming! :) 

Thank you all! For supporting us, loving us, and helping us along the way! Thank  you for making this possible!!

You have made it so we can continue to do what we love, and you've made it so we are able to provide you with Gather. If you build it, they will come....well, you came, so we're building so you'll continue coming! :) Thank you all! For supporting us, loving us, and helping us along the way! Thank  you for making this possible!!

story:
Housed in funky old church in the Bayou Treme neighborhood, The Church of Yoga is currently being re-built for it's second coming aka REBIRTH!  

IMAGINE THIS: A SPACE WHERE YOU CAN PARTY AND PRAY.  

Make your entrance into Celebration Hall for epic live music classes, Zydeco dancing, gospel, vinyasa, weddings and more. On the other side, enter Contemplation Hall where mantra, meditation, restorative yoga and the study of philosophy awaits. Together this creates a powerful experience of awakening both physically and spiritually.

This is Laughing Lotus' fourth location, alongside New York City, Brooklyn and San Francisco. Laughing Lotus has over 100,000 yogis from all around the world visit the centers year. We have Continually been voted #1 Yoga Center in NYC by TimeOut Magazine and are so excited to expand our centers to New Orleans.

Cosmic Director Dana Trixie Flynn, has been practicing yoga for as long as she’s been going down to New Orleans...for 25 years. Her passion for celebration, music and togetherness are embodied by the spirit and people of New Orleans. The mood of service is alive within the community. Dana shares, "I know my body was born in SF but my Soul is born right here in New Orleans."

Check out her instagram @danatrixieflynn to see LOTUS LOVE in action!

Dana was named “One of the 10 Influential Teachers Who Have Shaped Yoga in America” by Yoga Journal in 2016.

The Church requires a MAJOR reconstruction. The last renovation was completed by volunteers  11 years ago, after Hurricane Katrina.  In order to provide a SAFE and UPLIFTING space, it is necessary to build an entire new structure within the existing brick facade. We are beyond grateful for our expert team that includes beloved NOLA architect, Joel Ross (concordia.com) who focuses on community projects.

THIS IS WHERE YOU ALL COME IN...

Help us fund the key construction items, including:

  • New Foundation
  • New Roofs & Gutters
  • New Flooring & Molding
  • New Walls & Ceiling
  • New HVAC & Ductwork
  • Architect & Permit Fees

Other Expenses include:

  • Tech Equipment (Security & Sound system)
  • Supplies (Mats & Props)
  • Shelving & Storage Units
  • Utilities & Water


The Church of Yoga will be a self-supporting center through:

  • Teacher Trainings (200 hour, Advanced Training, Bridge to Lotus, Mindfulness Programs)
  • Yoga Retreats
  • Online Class Memberships
  • Individual and Corporate Donations
  • Weddings & Church Rentals
  • Lotus Merchandise

Peep our PERKS! We have some amazing limited edition items available with your donation. Thank YOU for helping us grow our community and spread the Lotus Love!

story:
The main idea of the project is to create the first house in Kyrgyzstan where travelers can stay for rest for free, deepen to the local life, know more about the local culture and people. We have chosen a special place for such home – it will be created on the southern coast of Issyk-Kul, the second largest mountain lake in the world, in a small village among Kyrgyz mountains.

The Home for Travelers is a non-commercial project. It's main goal is to draw the travelers’ interest to Kyrgyzstan and to give them an opportunity to stay free in one of the most beautiful places of Central Asia. We want this place to become a new sightseeing and attract more travelers to visit our small but amazing country. We want the travelers to know that Kyrgyzstan is a country open for new discoveries; a country with friendly people and unique culture; a country offering many ways for travelling by hitch-hiking, by bicycle, motocycle or car, by horse or by foot, and in the Tien-Shan mountains there are hundreds of amazing routes for hiking, skiing and snowboarding.


The Home for Travelers will also play an important role for local people (we will tell about this later). We want to welcome new people in this house, talk with them about adventures and other countries, sing songs near an open fire, cook breakfasts together and celebrate holidays… The Home for Travelers will be the place with kind atmosphere and spirit of adventures and journeys. This place will not be a "free hotel" for everyone desiring to stay at Issyk-Kul for free, the house doors will be open for those people only whose life is full of journeys and adventures. That is why the Home for Travelers project will not be a competitor to local guest houses and will not have an adverse impact on operation of the guest houses, as their main clients are the residents of Kyrgyzstan and guests from Kazakhstan and Russia, who arrive to Issyk-Kul for holidays on the lake shore.

Our family will implement the project. We have many friends who are ready to help us with rearranging and finishing of the house and the adjacent territory. There are travelers, designers and artists among them, and common people loving to create something new. We are experienced in construction and finishing works, therefore we do not expect any difficulties with creation of the Home for Travelers, if you support our project.

If someone of you wants to be a volunteer and help us with the initial works (prior to official opening of the Home for Travelers) – we will be glad to see you here and cooperate with you to establish this wonderful place.

The Home for Travelers will have own web-site, where any traveler can file an order for accommodation in the house within certain dates. Within 24 hours we will send our reply to the order received. We will also tell about the project at TripAdvisor, Couchsurfing and other web-resources being popular among travelers.

When we are absent, the local family or our friends living there will manage the house and welcome guests. The Home for Travelers will be not the place where any vacationer at Issyk-Kul can receive free accommodation and other bonuses. This will be the place for people who are fond of adventures and travelling and the house’s doors will always be open for such people.



Kyrgyzstan provides visa-free regime for 62 countries. This facilitates significantly the access to the country.


One can find here a unique culture and amazing nature. For example, one can still meet nomads in the mountains here, and the wild nature is more than meets the eye.


Travelling here is cheap! Public transport here is really cheap, hitch-hiking in the country is practiced, there are cheap eco-friendly products here… These are ideal conditions.

It is safe here. For many years of contacts with travelers from various countries, we have not heard of any case of somebody’s assaulting on them.



The project will be implemented in several stages. The first and the most important step is holding a fundraising campaign to implement the project at Indiegogo. This is the condition for the project existence. If you can support our project at this stage, we will appreciate this.

The second stage is awareness-raising. After successful completion of the campaign at Indiegogo we are going to provide the opportunity for our supporters to watch easily all the news on the project promotion through social networks and the project web-site.

The third stage includes purchasing of a convenient house in Kadji-Sai and execution of all necessary formalities. We have three appropriate houses in view. All of them locate at the same street and are for sale


The forth stage is creative. We will rearrange the house and its yard, make it to be a real Home for Travelers. Purchase, delivery and installation of the furniture required will be performed at this stage too. If you want to visit Kyrgyzstan and help us with this matter – we will be glad!

The fifth stage is the official opening of the Home for Travelers! We plan to complete all the works by the end of May 2016, and on the 1st of June 2016 to hold an official meeting.




Our goal is to create a place where people from various countries will live together in comfort conditions. And it doesn’t matter whether you will stay here overnight or for three months – you need to feel comfortable and cozy here. We tried to include into the Must Be List not only the necessary things, but also several additional pleasant bonuses. If you think that our house will miss something, please, inform us, and we will consider an opportunity to add something new to our list.

The list of things available for travelers in the house:

  • Bedrooms
  • Kitchen
  • Big room with sofas and books
  • Places for reading or for making notes
  • Parking for bicycles (with lockers)
  • Car parking
  • Luggage room for big rucksacks
  • Equipment rental
  • Outdoor shower
  • Russian bath
  • WC (of course)
  • Orchard in the adjacent territory
  • Arbors for rest in the yard
  • Hammocks
  • Wi-Fi and PCs with Internet access


Our project will help travelers to become closer to the local community. It doesn’t matter, how much time you will spend here – one day, one week or one month – you can spend this time profitably for you and others.

Familiarize with the life of local community: you can learn to bake national bread (lepeshka – flatbread) in a tandoor or to operate Soviet cars; learn to dry ecologically-safe fruits or to cook Kyrgyz ethnic foods; you can take part in national holidays!

Share your knowledge: you can teach the villagers something new – speak your language, cook new foods, create the things of household use; you can tell your stories to children living here, and may be once someone of them will become a traveler like you!

You can also help the elderly people. Many of them have small gardens. Every summer they pick fresh fruits and sell them in a small market in the village center. The money they gain from selling their products, help them to live till the next summer. You can assist them in picking fruits and they will very thankful for this!


We are sure that establishment of the Home for Travelers will favorably affect the life of the whole village. Owners of small shops and elderly people selling fresh fruits will have more customers; taxi drivers transferring people from the village center to the beach for 40 cents per person will be more demanded; horse breeders arranging non-expensive riding trips to the adjacent mountains will find more clients amongst travelers.

While we are absent, one local family will keep the Home for Travelers clean, welcome and accommodate guests in it. They will do this for fixed monthly fee (included into the project budget). Thus, while creating the Home for Travelers, we will also provide several job places for people from Kadji-Sai.

The summer tourist season is very important for many people living in Issyk-Kul region, because this is the main period of earning money during the year.


An important part of our project is aimed at support of children residing in the village. We have been visiting Kadji-Sai over 15 years, and we should note that the village returns to life: more and more children can be met in its streets today. This summer the village school was repaired and this is good news!

We are going to build good playgrounds in various districts of the village because nowadays there is no really good playground for children here. We also plan to restore the football ground and purchase new sports equipment for schoolchildren. If we raise more funds than expected, we will buy for them new textbooks, drawing books, reading books in Russian and Kyrgyz languages.



We will care of the environment of Kadji-Sai. Why? Because we love this locality and would like to preserve it for the future generations. Nowadays the most urgent environmental issue can be recycling of waste. And by means of our project we will be able to affect significantly the settlement of this issue.

We will set waste containers in the village! This will help to keep wastes in one place till local municipal services arrange its removal to special waste deposit. Currently there are no such containers in the village, and used plastic bags and other wastes are easily wafted away with a big wind. Unfortunately.

We will arrange collecting and recycling of waste! Generally, this relates to plastic wastes – bottles and bags, which are wafted away with the wind and accumulated along the village perimeter. We are also planning to remove the waste in the “Eastern Canyon” passing along the village on the East.

We will give lectures in the local school concerning the importance of preserving the environment. We would like to tell the children why it is important to throw wastes to special waste cans for subsequent recycling. And also why it is necessary to keep the native village clean and maintain (and even raise vegetation in its territory. We have friends who can give such lectures excellently and they will assist us!


Do you use social network services frequently? You can follow up the progress of our project in Facebook, Twitter and Instagram! We are going to register special accounts in these social network services so that you will be able to watch how the first travelers house in Central Asia is created with your assistance.

Do you prefer to be aware of the most important things and events? We will send to your e-mail personalized messages with news and pictures on implementation of the project and success jointly achieved! Personal involvement.

Would you like to visit us and help personally? That’s great! Since March 2016 you will get a chance to be personally involved in transformation of a standard rural house into a real house for travelers! We will be glad to everyone who wants to come and help to make repairs in the house or to build new facilities. We promise you unforgettable sunsets in Issyk-Kul and friendly atmosphere!


This project is from travelers and for travelers. The ultimate goal of this fundraising campaign at Indiegogo is to create something unique in Central Asia. To create a place where every traveler will feel at home. As to the perks I offer you only the things I will manage to provide as the organizer. The main part of the perks does not suppose receiving material values, these are generally about new experience. I believe sincerely that this is the real need for the people who used to take their rucksacks and travel to new countries and new places. I will be glad to provide you with accommodation in my home in Bishkek, help you to get the Home for Travelers from Bishkek. I greatly appreciate your support and hope for a meeting with you someday!

Perks for you are the special cards for travelers, which will provide you with various bonuses when traveling to Kyrgyzstan. Choose any of the cards and you will receive it to e-mail within 24 hours from the date of your contribution! All cards are sent in both soft and printable copies. Therefore, you can use the card yourself or grant it to a close person who loves traveling!

Attention! You can activate your card and receive a bonus till 2021, so that you have enough time for traveling to Kyrgyzstan!




How to get the Home for Travelers (Kadji-Sai village) from Bishkek?
You can get it by public transport or by taxi. The cost of public transport ticket is about 6 dollars; a taxi trip will cost from 8 dollars per seat or 50 dollars per car.

How much time can one live in the Home for Travelers?
It depends on you. If you are a true traveler, you can stay here for one hour or for three months – as you like.

Will be any restrictions in the Home for Travelers?
Some rules are to be observed in the Home, generally relating to the standards of behavior, ban on smoking inside the house, ban on drugs abuse, etc. We will also adhere to the project idea and try not to allow the project being used by common vacationers desiring to save their money and stay for free accommodation at Issyk-Kul. This house will have a special spirit – the spirit of adventures, travelling, new discoveries, and we will do our best to keep it.

How much money do one need to stay in the Home for Travelers?
Accommodation in the house will be absolutely free for all travelers. The rest is up to you. The kitchen in the house will be available for everyone, and if you cook yourself, the food costs will amount to 3-4 dollars per day.

Why is it worth to support the Home for Travelers project?
Because it is cool. Because it is kind. Because it is sincere. This project is dedicated to the people who love life; dreamers and travelers. Irrespectively of their social status, nationality or religion. We would like this project to come true. We would like you or your friends or friends of your friends or even the people unknown to you to discover the beautiful country of Kyrgyzstan by virtue of the idea which you can support now.

story:
What is MakerBay?

MakerBay is the first large Makerspace in Hong Kong, established with the mission of creating positive social and environmental impact. At MakerBay, we provide Makers with the space, tools and community to turn their ideas into tangible reality.


Who needs MakerBay?

We believe everyone is a Maker and we welcome you to join the MakerBay community of talented artists, designers, engineers, inventors and scientists. While MakerBay is open to all Makers making a diverse range of innovative products, we strongly encourage our community members to think about how they can apply their creativity, skills and resources to making our world a better place. Whether you are a full time inventor working on the next generation of energy efficient electric cars, a weekend hobbyist developing drones for wildlife protection or a seasoned carpenter passing on knowledge and skills to the next generation, we are here to support you!


Individual Inventors / Designers / Engineers


Each year  thousands of Makers graduate from Hong Kong universities but they have nowhere to 'make' their dreams come true. Hong Kong has dozens of co-working spaces but you cannot make much noise, create any dust or work on 'smelly' projects. Hong Kong Science & Technology Parks and local universities are well-equipped but only a lucky few can access these facilities. Let's not even mention the unlikelihood of setting up a home workshop in Hong Kong's micro apartments. MakerBay offers Makers the flexibility of a co-making space and Hong Kong's best public tool set, available 24/7. 


Hardware Startups

Your hardware startup needs a place to prototype your ideas. Whether you are a local or international company, you will likely be interested to work in the world's freest economy  just a few minutes away from one of the world's largest manufacturing centres (Pearl River Delta region - Shenzhen and Guangzhou). This is the ideal place to turn your invention into reality at high speed, high quality and low cost. Beyond the basic monthly membership which gives you access to our tools and equipment, you also can rent a dedicated workbench or studio and find collaborators within the MakerBay community.


Students and Lifelong Learners

Regardless of age and experience, many people in Hong Kong want to learn new skills, experiment with new technologies and invent the jobs of tomorrow.

MakerBay offers a range of classes including:

  • Skills-based : introduction to woodworking, metalworking, rapid prototyping (3D printing, laser cutting, CNC milling), sewing and textiles, screen printing, leather working, jewelry making, bicycle building and repair, electronics, robotics, CAD, plaster casting and injection molding
  • Subject-based : citizen science, renewable energy, advanced materials, wearable tech
  • Theory-based : critical design, appropriate and affordable technology, sustainable design, design for developing countries


Hobbyists

You may work 9-5, but you're much more than an office robot. Away from your cubicle, you are working on a secret masterpiece invention,  customizing your radio-controlled cars, working on home improvement projects that will impress your spouse or experimenting with innovative media art. Who knows, your side passion may turn into a full-time occupation. If this sounds familiar, MakerBay is the place for you!

Corporations

You are looking for interactive team-building activities to facilitate employee engagement, boost productivity and improve long term retention. We can help your human resources and CSR needs by partnering with local communities to develop meaningful products and experiences they need.

OR you want to make your business more innovative and/or more green? You need expert consultation from our team of Innovation and Sustainability consultants.

Why join MakerBay?


Convenient Location

Central MTR Station ==> Yau Tong MTR Station:  21 minutes (8 stations away)
Mongkok MTR Station ==> Yau Tong MTR Station:  25 minutes (12 stations away)
Yau Tong MTR Station ==> MakerBay:  5 minutes walk [map]


All the Tools You Need and MORE

Our tool list is too long to put here, but we most likely have what you need to experiment with wood, metal, electronics, fabric, 3D printing, laser cutting, CNC milling, chemistry, basic biology and optics. The complete tool list will be available on our website soon. 

GIANT Space

You enter Makerbay through the Cafe (Green Zone) - a social space to discuss new ideas. Kids are warmly invited to play with Legos and many other educational toys. Then you pass a little shop on the right where you can buy all the essential gear for Makers - and in the future, sell your masterpieces! This is the "Hot Bench" area (Yellow Zone) where you can fix your bike, build some furniture, hack boat parts, anything you want. On your left is the "Fixed Bench" area (Orange Zone) where you can rent a large dedicated workbench where you can leave your tools and inventions in creative chaos every day. The Red Zone is the heavy duty workshop for wood, composite materials, electronics, metal work, 3D printers, lasers and more. The Blue Zone consists of customizable studios available for longer periods of time. Studios are 75 square feet; larger studios are available upon request. 


Awesome Community

Where do ideas come from? Oftentimes, they come from creative discussions or hybridizing disparate disciplines. Forget about DIY (aka Do It Alone). Let's DIT (Do It Together!!!). Make things = Make friends <3

Affordable Membership Rates

[Enlarge image]
We are doing a campaign on Indiegogo so that you can be one of the very first people to join MakerBay. Be an early adopter and help shape the culture of our community aaaaand.....at a discounted rate!!! Oh la la! Not only would you be amongst first to join, but as soon as the campaign ends, regular pricing will kick in. Don't miss this chance!  -wink-

Still not convinced?

Here's the kicker:
Save Hong Kong!
Hong Kong is much more than financial services and luxury shopping malls. Be a part of Hong Kong's transformation into a dynamic hub for the creative and innovative technology industries. Shape Hong Kong's culture and redefine what it means to be "Made in Hong Kong."

Save the kids! Save the polar bears!
Humans are creative animals. We will always be making new stuff. Unfortunately, most of the stuff we have invented over the past few centuries does more harm than good for our planet. It is time to invent things that are good for both people AND planet.

Join MakerBay. :D

story:
We are a small, local gym in southeast London, which caters for all members of the community. We have tried to provide a range of facilities to our local community and desperately wish to have showers installed for the benefit of every age range that attends the gym.

We wish to have as much of the local community involved in weightlifting, kickboxing, powerlifting, general fitness and boxing, as possible. We wish to get the local youth population involved to prevent them from embracing gang culture.
story_txt: We are a small, local gym in southeast London, which caters for all members of the community. We have tried to provide a range of facilities to our local community and desperately wish to have showers installed for the benefit of every age range that attends the gym. We wish to have as much of the local community involved in weightlifting, kickboxing, powerlifting, general fitness and boxing, as possible. We wish to get the local youth population involved to prevent them from embracing gang culture.

story:
The Cause

Hello! I'm Sarah AKA "LifeOfCosplay", and I've been an enthusiastic cosplayer for the last 6 years. I live in DC and have started doing volunteer costume work with children around the area. Some of my greatest passions are cosplay, volunteering, and children... so I've put them all together and started lending my talent to shelters and hospitals for children.

I've come in Disney Princess and hero costumes for themed events, but I've hit a snag: kids don't know who my superheros are (I have Rogue and Invisible Woman). This has led to some awkward conversations, and a lot less enthusiasm from them. Unlike the well-known hero volunteers, it's hard to reach these children, play with them, and teach them valuable lessons when they don't respond excitedly to you.

That's why I've started this campaign:

  • Raise enough to afford a quality Supergirl costume


As you might know, buying a  costume can be quite expensive, and that's why I need help with this. I've already found a reasonably priced commissioner. I will purchase the wig from the same store I purchased Rogue's wig from.

  • Helping me with this project will allow me to visit underprivileged children as their favorite superhero.

Please note: I cannot give you the name of the locations I volunteer at, nor the names of the children. All images of these children have been approved through proper channels.

What We Need & What You Get

What I need

  • $850 will cover the  cost of the wig, shipping, the commission estimate price, and a little bit of wiggle room (because final costs are usually higher than estimates)


What you get out of it
  • $5 = My personal thanks! I will post a list of names for everyone who donated on my cosplay page: www.facebook.com/lifeofcosplay. I can also send you a personal email with my gratitude!
  • $35 = A medium, signed print of the final costume. As a cosplayer, I know several talented and compassionate photographers who would be willing to do a photo shoot for the purpose of sending out prints to donators. Prints will be ready in:  August (making a costume takes time)

If I over the goal

  • It will go towards the second hero costume: Batgirl! That way we can offer these shelters and hospitals some variety in the cosplayers and their costumes.


The Impact

The caretakers have told our volunteer group that the children act more respectful when our princess or hero squad is there. I have seen little girls run across the room to give me a hug. I have held the hands of children who don't want to let go. I have seen a glimpse into their lives and I want to make more of an impact by visiting more often as characters they look up to.

  • Most of the places we visit are areas where children don't have a safe environment to call home. We provide them with a sense of security and give them undivided attention.
  • I consider myself a convincing superhero when I put the costume on, and I'd like to bring that talent to a younger audience by convincing them I am the real Supergirl (you should see how excited they get over Batman or Spiderman!!)

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you don't want to contribute, or if you don't agree with how I'm going about this crowdfunding. But you can still do something!

  • Please share this page with people who share a passion for changing the lives of our youth, or with those who love volunteering.
  • Don't agree with what I'm doing? Hold on to your money and find a shelter, orphanage, or hospital  to volunteer at. Children who have not grown up in privilege need to feel loved, too. Please give them your time; they will appreciate your attention.

Future Plans

I want to raise funds for Batgirl! She would be a great addition to our Catwoman and Batman, and we could team up and talk about preventing crime. I really hope this project gets off the ground so I can spend more time with children who need some extra happiness in their life!


Want to know more about me? You can check out my social media at:
https://www.facebook.com/LifeOfCosplay/
http://lifeofcosplay.com/
Instagram & Twitter: @lifeofcosplay

story:
Short Summary

Knuckle Up Cuts, Piercing and Tattoos is an entirely unique studio, one that has been created by the crew and for the crew. Our clear passion for body art and mods ensures that visitors and patrons feel right at home. Whether you are dropping in for a piercing, a tattoo, a cut, a consultation, or just to hang out, our staff will make you feel as though you’re one of the crew.

If you've ever walked into a tattoo studio and felt intimidated, if you’ve ever had butterflies in your stomach before or during a tattoo or piercing consultation, we know what that feels like. Knuckle Up isn’t like other shops. We’re not here to impress or intimidate; we want you to feel like you’re in good hands. We’ll meet you at the door with a handshake and a smile, and you’ll know that you’ve got nothing to worry about.

What We Need & What You Get

All funds go to renovation, furniture, devices, and a lot more you can't even imagine. Everything that helps the coolest tattoo studio in Budapest open the soonest.

You can just say hello, get merchandise or even buy your LIFETIME services in advance.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! We're thankful for all the shares!


PRIZES!

T-shirt


Stickers


Meet our tattoo artists:
