story:
Meet Home Based Chefs



We are Home Based Chefs, a private member association that helps foodies connect with great homemade food. Home Based Chefs is building a platform that allows talented chefs to start a business right from their kitchen at home. Many people love cooking but are not able to afford the costly venture of opening restaurant. Our goal is to help these people start a business right from home without the capital investment required to start a restaurant.


   

The easiest way to find homemade food around you.


The Impact

There are too many family recipes that are passed down generations but never shared with food lovers. One of the biggest challenges a home based chef faces is not having a network of people to share the food with and make a profit. Our mobile app will change that. We will connect chefs with a private membership based, thus allowing these chefs to grow their business. Customers will rate their chefs on a scale of 1 to 5 stars ensuring only highly rated chefs are available on the platform. Making sure we create an ecosystem of health healthy food offerings.


How It Works

The only way to provide a platform for people to share home cooked food is to become a private member association. This means that customers and chefs will have to pay a one-time membership fee of $55 for life. After becoming a member, customers pay chefs directly for the food they purchase.

Chefs pay a $10/month fee to sell their food using the Home Based Chefs app. We don’t take a percentage of the money chefs make, you keep it all. Our app provides chefs with an opportunity to setup a food business for much less than it would cost to setup a restaurant. Chefs may reduce their monthly fee by accepting free dinner coupons and by referring new chef members. 


   

Chefs see and fulfill orders right on their iPhones.


Timeline

We're working hard to get the Home Based Chefs iPhone app into your hands by November 2016. Here's what our timeline looks like. We promise to deliver on time!

April 2016 - We had an epiphany
May 2016 - We began looking for the right vendors/began design work
June 2016 - Created and launched Indiegogo campain/completed design
July  2016 - Kick off development for HBC iPhone app
August 2016 - Continue development for HBC app
September 2016 - Continue development for HBC app
October 2016 - Continue development for HBC app
November 2016 - Complete testing HBC app and LAUNCH

Funding

Our team has spent countless hours with our design, engineering and legal vendors to make sure Home Based Chefs can become a reality. We promise to deliver on time, and bring you a platform that will work.

We’ve invested a lot of our saving in this project but software development isn’t cheap (especially when it’s done right). Please help us close the gap by requesting your membership today!


Risks & Challenges

We have always been committed to creating a great product that will change the way people consume homemade food and allow great chefs to sell food right from home. 

Designing and developing a fully functional app is a complex process. That’s why we chose to work with InfiniOne, a well known mobile development company in Los Angeles. They have helped guide us on how to create a high quality product.

Our biggest challenge was to find a way that legally allowed people to sell food from home. It’s a highly regulated industry, making it very difficult to sell homemade food. After countless hours of research and discussion with our attorneys, we found that the only way to do this was by becoming a private member association. 

Now we have everything needed to launch Home Based Chefs by November 2016.


Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for your support! Please tell all your friends about Home Based Chefs. Any support can go a long way. Help us spread the word by sharing our Indiegogo campain on Facebook and Twitter :)

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Ernest Pakers. I live in Riga, Latvia. I am trying to help my friend, Alex Lee, with treatment for he's illness.

It all started 5 years ago. My friend, 17 yo boy was a promising dancer, reaching he's goals, living a normal life, like every other person does. He was a break-dancer, until the moment he was diagnosed with "damage to the nervous system" illness. It means that all tissues in your body gradually stop functioning. He was forced to quit he's studies at collage, quit he's dancing career and proceed with heavy antibiotics treatment. Unfortunately, the treatment did not have any effect, and 2 years ago he could not walk by him self. At the moment he's not even able to type that message, that's why i'm doing it for him. He lives with he's parents, who take care of him.

The money is needed to start a new treatment, not any kind of operation or anything like that. The money is needed for therapeutic drugs, witch we hope, will help him to recover.

I wish i could give him money my self, but unfortunately i do not have that kind of money.

That's why a am asking for your help.

What We Need & What You Get

We need only 1000€ to start the treatment.

Any help is invaluable contribution to he's recovery.
All of this money will go for treatment. I do not keep anything to my self.

The Impact

This new treatment promises that in 3 to 6 months time he will get better.
I can only imagine how devastating it is for a young man who was used to active life, to be struggling in a wheel chair, not even able to take care of him self.
If we could let him know, that society has not abandoned him and is trying to help, that would be really inspiring for him.

Risks & Challenges

The risks are that he will never recover and be forced to spend the rest of he's life in a wheelchair, that the treatment will have no effect on him.

Unfortunately, i do not know how it will turn out for him, but i'm doing all i can to bring attention to he's situation.

Other Ways You Can Help

He has a personal Facebook page.
https://www.facebook.com/aleksandrs.li
If you don't trust me, you can always give him a call and ask how he feels. I am sure he will tell you all about he's situation.

He also has a personal bank account:

Aleksandrs Li , p.k.031092-10647, Swedbank, LV28HABA0551028448449.

You can help him dirrectly.

He was forced to quit he's studies at collage, quit he's dancing career and proceed with heavy antibiotics treatment. Unfortunately, the treatment did not have any effect, and 2 years ago he could not walk by him self. At the moment he's not even able to type that message, that's why i'm doing it for him. He lives with he's parents, who take care of him.
The money is needed to start a new treatment, not any kind of operation or anything like that. The money is needed for therapeutic drugs, witch we hope, will help him to recover.
I wish i could give him money my self, but unfortunately i do not have that kind of money.
That's why a am asking for your help.
What We Need & What You Get
 We need only 1000€ to start the treatment.
Any help is invaluable contribution to he's recovery.All of this money will go for treatment. I do not keep anything to my self.   The Impact This new treatment promises that in 3 to 6 months time he will get better.I can only imagine how devastating it is for a young man who was used to active life, to be struggling in a wheel chair, not even able to take care of him self.If we could let him know, that society has not abandoned him and is trying to help, that would be really inspiring for him.
    Risks & Challenges The risks are that he will never recover and be forced to spend the rest of he's life in a wheelchair, that the treatment will have no effect on him.
Unfortunately, i do not know how it will turn out for him, but i'm doing all i can to bring attention to he's situation.
    Other Ways You Can Help He has a personal Facebook page.https://www.facebook.com/aleksandrs.liIf you don't trust me, you can always give him a call and ask how he feels. I am sure he will tell you all about he's situation.He also has a personal bank account:Aleksandrs Li , p.k.031092-10647, Swedbank, LV28HABA0551028448449.You can help him dirrectly.

story:
wristSOS

Thank you for your interest in wristSOS. The idea of wristSOS came to life while watching the news long ago; a story about a kidnapped boy who was just 6 years old was found murdered and as a new father as well as a father to be, this had a heart wrenching effect on both my business partner and I.

A sad but simple news story had us thinking about things we can do to help another family not have to deal with the heartbreak of losing their child or loved one to such a horrible crime. After a long night of beating our brains I looked at my apple watch to see what time it was and a light turned on! SOS alerts with the Apple Watch. The search was on to see if this had been done and much to our surprise, every other solution out there is trying to include their own hardware which is inflating their overhead and making their goals just about unattainable.

You have an iPhone, you have an apple watch... why not use these devices to save your life? No clipping a button on your pants or buying a special wristband, protection for you using the items you already own. We have tons of fantastic features in the wristSOS lineup that will make it unlike anything on the market, we hope you can help us bring this feature packed life saving app to market in the very near future.

wristSOS Founder
Jason Nichols

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We have the app idea and functions laid out but we need to fund the development.
  • We want to make this app for you and we want you to be able to enjoy it! With that said, we are going to give away items that help you enjoy the app when it is done. iPhones and Apple watches are offered as perks BUT not just ANY iPhone or Apple watch, fully customized phones and watches that are serialized to be one of a kind items that will NEVER be reproduced. Can't pledge enough for these perks? Not a problem, every little bit helps. We will say thanks to you on our site or in our app and EVERYONE who donates will get the app for free at time of release!
  • Every penny earned will go toward the final goal of development and public release of the app on the apple app store. Anything over our goal will go toward porting the app to android based devices.

The Impact

wristSOS can impact every day life and help track down a lost child or even save a loved ones life:

  • If your child is grabbed, a simple apple watch press can track their location and help you find them faster. Future features will make tracking possible without your child or loved one pressing a button.
  • Do you have an elderly family member who is home alone? What if they take a fall? Press the watch button and they start to broadcast an SOS to you and your family.
  • Future updates which will be included for free will always put your family at the forefront of safety and technology and our product will never be dependent on extra hardware, the items you already own (watch and phone) will be all you need to stay safe.

Risks & Challenges

wristSOS is an iphone/Apple watch application that works with basic features in an advanced way, pushing these basic features to their limits can cause unforeseen delays in programming. wristSOS is committed to its release date of December 2015 before the holidays and we will bring on extra programmers if we see the need in order to avoid any delays.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Our goal at D20printing is to bring high quality custom made shirts to the masses.  Small bands, indie artists, and anyone else that can’t afford to buy a 500 print run from a major company will benefit from our services.  We want to create a company and culture for independent creatives to not only put their brand/work on to top quality shirts and posters but also creates another avenue of income. We plan to offer freelance programs to have these creatives work in collaboration with us to expand what is possible in the realm of print and art of all mediums. In addition to this we have a few ideas of our own we think you’ll enjoy.

UPDATE:


The Team

Mike


Thomas


Why we will succeed

We have an army of talented artists behind us as well as connections to both the indie comic and local artist scenes.  

This is what Tom has done already.

Done with stencil and spray paint.

Done with a low quality printing press.

If he can do this with such low quality supplies, it's easy to imagine what we can do with the proper equipment.


What We Need & What You Get

The short answer is we need startup funds.  There is a lot that goes into printing a high quality shirt.  There is art to be ordered, equipment and materials to be purchased, rent, and shipping costs. Money, though, is not the only way that you can help us. By just helping to spread the word about this campaign through the various social media platforms will be invaluable. Support will be the most needed commodity in the mad dash to hit our goals.


A few of our designs

Artwork from Hail Odin

Concept design from wOlly

Q & A

How many designs do you currently have for various printing mediums?

We have our Logo and Odin's feather with two more being worked on. Most designs though will be specific to the client.

story:
About Me:

I am a very fortunate person. Life offered me much more then I could ever imagine, I got my freedom, education, opportunities and power of decision making that no other girl in my family or community could get. In a way I lived my life distributed between two very distinct realities: one my original inheritance, the second my gained identity. 

My original inheritance is that I belong to a tribal community in the Balochistan province of Pakistan, to a society where traditions fix the fate of each girl. But luck turned out that I became the first girl in my community who could get her education in Karachi, and I was provided every opportunity to grow and learn and encouraged to speak my mind. 

My freedom every second became the nagging influence on my choosing to step forward and try my hardest to change the lives of other girls in my community who still live the life of a slave to the negative tribal traditions like exchange marriages, early marriages, arranged marriages, gender discrimination, exchange of girls to solve conflicts and even honor killings. Thus at the age of 16 I started my real journey and it’s been a tremendous success in the form of Sughar!

About Sughar Women Program:

From centuries women in tribal communities around the world have been facing injustice the form of tradition by being exchanged for marriages, to be married off in childhood, to be given off in solving tribal disputes and even to be killed in the name of honor. 

Sughar (in local language means skilled and confident woman) is an initiative aimed at ending the negative customs like honor killings, exchanges marriages, child marriages by promoting and magnifying the beautiful traditions and providing socio-economic empowerment to women n tribal areas of Pakistan. 

Sughar Program establishes Women Learning and Skill Development Centers in selected rural communities where each Center offers a 6 month course to tribal rural women on value-adding and renovating the traditional embroidery and also provide basic education and literacy skills and raise awareness of rural women which builds their capacities towards decision making and contribution in their households and lives. 

The embroidery is later marketed via various means including Marketplaces of PDI and various exhibitions and stalls around Pakistan. While each course offers a minimum loan to each woman after graduating to initiate Primary Production Units at their homes thus promoting women entrepreneurship.

Why SOCAP Matters?

Because SOCAP is the first ever opportunity for Sughar and our team to enter into a Market where the value of service comes first, SOCAP 2011 is going to be the gathering of investors and entrepreneurs who are willing to share, learn and understand about money+meaning. This would be a really great  opportunity for Sughar to grow as an organization and take back support in the form of networks, connections and even capital to scale our work in Pakistan!


What and How much we need?

SOCAP have already provided me an entrepreneur scholarship to the event, which allows me a total free entry into the four day event, I also have my USA visa. What I only need support in is air tickets and accommodation in San Francisco. Your support in even the smallest amount would be a step further in my making it to SOCAP and enabling Sughar to find supporters in our cause at this great event!


My return ticket to and from San Francisco would cost: 1,039 $ (This is the half of the total amount as half of the support is coming from Oxfam!)

My per night room payment needs for 4 nights are: 240 $


Other Ways You Can Help:

Share this campaign with three other people who you think would be willing to help!

Or let us know if you are coming to SOCAP and we can meet up to discuss some really cool strategies to help further improve our work!

story:
The Goal: Give a Veteran a brand new home!!!

Brendan Haas, The Armed Forces Foundation (AFF) and The Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) are raising money to move and reassemble a solar house donated by MIT students, to the AFF.  Brendan, is an awesome 9-year-old from Kingston, MA, began trading one of his toy soldiers in an effort to "trade up" to land, the home could eventually be placed.  After the house has been moved and reassembled, the Armed Forces Foundation will donate the house and land to a well deserving Veteran of our Armed Forces!!!

Here is a link to the house and the solar decathlon which inspired this house to be built http://mit.edu/solardecathlon/ 

 

Check out this message from The Haas family and please like their facebook site - https://www.facebook.com/asoldierforasoldier

We understand that this is a huge undertaking, one that may whiles one time to accomplish but we are willing to give it a try. We believe in Brendan and although we were surprised he had reached his goal so quickly the last time, we have no doubt that with his determination he will be able to accomplish his new goal of trading for some land. We're thrilled to partner with the Armed Forces Foundation, which has agreed to help us check out the military service ofthe people who would like to be a recipient of the home. We will post information on how to apply for the house soon. Thanks so much to MIT and the Armed Forces Foundation for this unbelievable opportunity! Also, thanks to everyone who has supported Brendan's and, most importantly, to those who have served! -The Haas Family

If you have questions, please contact:

Erica Anderson at (202) 547-4713 or eanderson@armedforcesfoundation.org 

www.armedforcesfoundation.org

The Armed Forces Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing solace to members of the Armed Forces community during their time of greatest need. Listed as an "America Supports You" - Homefront Group resources by the Department of Defense, we provide direct financial support to Service Members and their families for:

  • Essential living expenses
  • Bereavement assistance
  • Psychological Health and Traumatic Brain Injury outreach
  • Morale boosting recreation events
  • Military children’s events
  • Hospital outreach, assisting military families during their most trying times …

96% of All Donations Go Directly to Military Members and Their Families.

 

The Armed Forces Foundation is a 501(C)(3) non-profit recognized by the IRS

16 North Carolina Ave. SE —Washington, DC 20003 Tel: (202) 547-4713

Tax ID. No.: 75-3070368 —CFC # 12247

story:
Welcome to the Kids In the Woods Initiative -- K.I.W.I. !  

 K.I.W.I. is dedicated to reconnecting children & youth to nature through adventure-play and mentoring in wild and natural outdoor spaces! Through year-round programming in Toronto's Rouge Valley Park, K.I.W.I., will take participants on a journey of "discovery from the outside in."

 

As a former lawyer, writer, and long-time volunteer with organizations concerned with the health and welfare of children, building and leading K.I.W.I. is a project that combines all of my passions and skills. I am also an outdoor athlete and have been hiking regularly in the beauty and wonder of Toronto's Rouge Valley for over a decade.  

 

Why support K.I.W.I. ? 

There is a growing body of scholarly research that has linked a lack of play in natural spaces within child and youth populations to increases in diabetes, depression, obesity, poor academic performance, attention difficulties, as well as aggression and stress.  Collectively, these negative outcomes have been referred to by the best-selling author Richard Louv, in his book Last Child in the Woods, as "Nature-Deficit Disorder".  The research calls for one prescription: regular time spent playing in nature! 

 

In addition to the physical benefits of exercise, nature-play can help increase self-esteem, self-discipline, and provide benefits for psychological, emotional and spiritual well-being.

 

With your support, together we can make the Kids In the Woods Initiative a resounding success for children & youth in Toronto as they go on a journey fulfilling our motto of  "Discovery From the Outside In"!  

 

How Can You Help?

K.I.W.I.  is seeking $5000.00 in order to launch and fund our innovative programming.  In recognition of your financial support, your name will be listed on our website in our "Tree of Discovery" at one of three levels.  Your entry-level donation of $25 will make you one of our "Budding" donors, while a donation of $100 will make you a "Spring Leaf" donor, and a donation of $1000 will make you a "Founding Branch" donor.

 

If financial support is not something you can offer right now, please help us spread the word about K.I.W.I. by telling everyone you know about this project.  Don't forget to share this campaign using your social network and Indiegogo share tools.

 

Thank you for your time, consideration and support!

story:
We now have a Corporate Sponsor that is now matching all the contributions dollar for dollar as of 11 October 2012..WOW how amazing this was to get a huge helping hand for these men and women. Now we need some help with donations, if we can reach any amount in the remaining days they will match our donations! Please spread the word!!

Even if after you've listen to our video's or read about this cause and you're still not able to help. Will you please take 30 seconds to "Like" this campaign, tweet, email or tell someone about this campaign? You can use the tools listed above this text to make it easier for you-PLEASE HELP THESE MEN AND WOMEN!.

The Veterans Affairs (VA) won’t cover the cost of service dogs assigned to our returning service members for PTSD treatment. The Department of Veterans Affairs will cover the costs of service dogs to help veterans with impaired vision, hearing or mobility, but will not cover canines assigned for mental disabilities.

 The costs for training, as well as travel expenses, veterinary bills, and equipment are all funded by private donations. The costs of providing custom-trained dogs are about $20,000 each. The costs are so great only one of six veterans get assigned a PTSD dogs because of funding.

Trainers say that for veterans suffering mental disabilities such as PTSD or Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI), dogs can be trained to help avert panic attacks and wake them up as they enter a nightmare. The animals can be taught to remind veterans to take medications and alert them if they have left a burner lit on the stove.

One of the Veterans that had gotten assigned with a PTSD dog from the private donations indicated that "At the VA, what they tend to do is pump you with medicine,"  he also said "That’s not a solution to any issue like PTSD or anxiety. "They just kind of numb you. I knew that wasn’t the right choice for me. I was looking for an alternative."

Because he has been awarded the opportunity to have this life changing friend, this Veteran is regaining his ability to get out of the house and do things like go to the shopping mall, that he has avoided because of the anxiety and hyper vigilance that is common to combat-related PTSD. He sleeps more, functions better in the day, and interacts with more with other people rather than choosing to isolate himself. He’s lost 15 pounds because he is more active. That was progress he had not seen despite years of visiting VA psychiatrists and doctors who prescribed medications for his PTSD symptoms.

I don't understand how we can ask these young men and women to do the things that they are being asked to do and then when their job or task is completed and they have returned just tell them: "Hey thanks for what you did, now you figure out how to deal with the aftermath of that request."

What We Need

We need your help in getting the word out there to everyone you may know for this COLOSSAL opportunity to give back to these men and women in a very small financial contribution on your part ($1 or more) but a priceless lifetime gift for a chance to reintegrate into the mainstream life that people take for granted each and every day.

The Impact

We asked them to do a job that most wouldn't be able to do. Now let’s give them the support they really need after they've returned. Help to give back to those who have already served and to those whom are already serving for the protection of our great nation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute and we understand, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help in this way:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools if you can or need help spreading the word.
  • Contact your Congress Representative and ask them to support providing canines for the treatment of PTSD and TBI related service members.

Now we need some help with donations, if we can reach any amount in the remaining days they will match our donations! Please spread the word!!
Even if after you've listen to our video's or read about this cause and you're still not able to help. Will you please take 30 seconds to "Like" this campaign, tweet, email or tell someone about this campaign? You can use the tools listed above this text to make it easier for you-PLEASE HELP THESE MEN AND WOMEN!.
The Veterans Affairs (VA) won’t cover the cost of service dogs assigned to our returning service members for PTSD treatment. The Department of Veterans Affairs will cover the costs of service dogs to help veterans with impaired vision, hearing or mobility, but will not cover canines assigned for mental disabilities.
 The costs for training, as well as travel expenses, veterinary bills, and equipment are all funded by private donations. The costs of providing custom-trained dogs are about $20,000 each. The costs are so great only one of six veterans get assigned a PTSD dogs because of funding.
Trainers say that for veterans suffering mental disabilities such as PTSD or Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI), dogs can be trained to help avert panic attacks and wake them up as they enter a nightmare. The animals can be taught to remind veterans to take medications and alert them if they have left a burner lit on the stove.
One of the Veterans that had gotten assigned with a PTSD dog from the private donations indicated that "At the VA, what they tend to do is pump you with medicine,"  he also said "That’s not a solution to any issue like PTSD or anxiety. "They just kind of numb you. I knew that wasn’t the right choice for me. I was looking for an alternative."
Because he has been awarded the opportunity to have this life changing friend, this Veteran is regaining his ability to get out of the house and do things like go to the shopping mall, that he has avoided because of the anxiety and hyper vigilance that is common to combat-related PTSD. He sleeps more, functions better in the day, and interacts with more with other people rather than choosing to isolate himself. He’s lost 15 pounds because he is more active. That was progress he had not seen despite years of visiting VA psychiatrists and doctors who prescribed medications for his PTSD symptoms.
I don't understand how we can ask these young men and women to do the things that they are being asked to do and then when their job or task is completed and they have returned just tell them: "Hey thanks for what you did, now you figure out how to deal with the aftermath of that request."


What We Need
We need your help in getting the word out there to everyone you may know for this COLOSSAL opportunity to give back to these men and women in a very small financial contribution on your part ($1 or more) but a priceless lifetime gift for a chance to reintegrate into the mainstream life that people take for granted each and every day.


The Impact
We asked them to do a job that most wouldn't be able to do. Now let’s give them the support they really need after they've returned. Help to give back to those who have already served and to those whom are already serving for the protection of our great nation.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute and we understand, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help in this way:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools if you can or need help spreading the word.
Contact your Congress Representative and ask them to support providing canines for the treatment of PTSD and TBI related service members.

story:
Imagine getting 30-50% off everything you bought for Halloween without having to wait till "the day after Halloween sale."

I was lucky enough to buyout a costume store's inventory at a cost that allows me to pass on huge savings to Halloween lovers everywhere!


Hey! My name is Jon. It's safe to say I LOVE Halloween. I have worked on many haunted houses of the years with my friends as well as building custom props and decorations.


For the last few years I have even helped deocate a couple local clubs for their Halloween parties. It has been a dream of mine for a long time to own my own Halloween shop.


Recently I was presented an opportunity that would make that dream closer to a reality. I have been shopping at the same family owned Halloween store for almost 10 years. As the years went on I got to know the owners and become friends. When they told me they were retiring they asked if I would be interested in buying out their left over inventory.

I jumped at the chance and pulled together every penny nickel and dime I could find to get the down payment together.



I know that I can make this a successful business venture, all I need is a little help getting over the final hurdle :)


How Does Your Contribution Help?

  • All the funds raised from this campaign will go back into covering my overhead: The lease, fixtures, and any equipment needed.
  • Currently I have been offered a great deal on location inside our local Mall in one of the highest trafficed sections.
  • The majority of funds collected will be going to pay that lease which comes to about $4,000.
  • The remaining $1,000 will be used for fixtures and covering any unforseen costs that may arise.




Originally I intended to only sell the inventory online and have spent nearly every waking moment in the last 4 months getting the online store up and running and cataloging the inventory.

Competing with other online shops with only a few months to prepare has been tough though. At this point every thing is coming out of my own pocket.
Opening a physical store with instore prices rivaling those found online is my goal right now.


Can't Contribute? 


If you can't contribute here are some other ways to help:
Share the online store with your friends online
http://deals.dreadcentral.com/

 

Or just Watch this video on Youtube

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ep-IjUZ7Mr0

story:
Why Gardens?
Because gardens produce healthier food. Only 2% of American children eat enough fruits and vegetables, and 1 in 3 American children born after 2000 is at risk for Type II diabetes. A garden is an introduction to the real, healthy food students and families need access to.

Because gardens can help fix America's nature deficit. With more than 80% of Americans living in cities and suburbs, we need to work harder than ever to teach the values of natural processes.

Because gardens are a living laboratory for education. Not just healthy food—a lesson on what producing healthy food requires. Not just exposure to nature—a way for children to literally harvest the fruits of their labor.

A True Seed Investment 
For as little as $10, you can help a community reap all the benefits a garden has to offer. In just 39 days, we plan to raise $2500 per garden; to feed,  teach, and inspire people in each of these 100 communities. Here are a few things our garden plans to do with your donations:

Our garden is an interactive place, the activities include our students,teachers and community.Our goal is to interact with new learning in the garden atmosphere this endeavour will provide. Burton Hill Elementary and Westworth Village with new learning style that is cutting edge.

CHECK OUT THE GALLERY FOR IMAGES & VIDEOS

Look Good, Do Good
With every contribution to our garden, donors will receive organic, ethical perks from PACT. Our socks, undies, and t-shirts are produced to high standards of sustainability, with the comfiest organic materials we can find. You'll be giving out of the goodness of your heart, and in return you'll get PACT goodies. It's a win-win situation.

story:
Hi Everyone.  I want to thank you for reading this.

I feel I owe an explanation as to why I'm pursuing this new venture called MainMeet... 

Please understand first, that MainMeet is in its infancy. That's why I'm appealing to you here for support and contributions. It's pretty easy.  If you like what I am saying here and want to give small businesses a way to stay in business, then just click the CONTRIBUTE NOW button below and follow the prompts.

MainMeet is a website that will help millions of small businesses everywhere effectively come together with their communities in a fun and engaging way that will help them stay in business.  www.mainmeet.com  Take a look and remember, it's in the baby step phase.  That's why I need your help.

The big picture is that I'm taking almost 20 years of experience putting on large events and turning that into a "MainMeet Movement" of sorts. At each of my events, the unanimous winners, those who got the most results and success, were always those who practically hosted their own "mini events" right within their own exhibits. 

What MainMeet is setting out to do is to encourage all small businesses to do something interactive and engaging AT their places of business, not unlike successful exhibitors at trade and consumer events (who are small businesses), in order to create an experience to elicit their true customers. This site will give them a simple and FREE platform to promote in-store gatherings and events, and invite communities out to support their own local businesses.

The BIG DIFFERENCE with this venture is that I want to use this business as a vehicle to make as many business owners lives better and more fruitful as possible.  That's why we give 50-100% of all transactions on the site to small businesses everywhere to help them stay in business. 

I think that the overall state of affairs would be very different if more successful companies went beyond token donations or charitable affiliations for the sake of publicity, and actually created programs that incentivized businesses to succeed.The impact would be huge. I could go on... 

However, for anyone who knows me, they know I am generous by nature. If you don't know me, then now you know this about me. I like to make people happy. It makes me happy. I just want to be able to help as many entrepreneurs and businesses as I can so that they do not have to go through the stress and heartache of going under. 
 
So in this extremely early stage, please know that my little team and I are working very hard to lay all the groundwork necessary so that in the future, MainMeet can help to change the course in a positive direction for businesses everywhere. 
 
We need to hire a few more very talented people to take MainMeet to a global stage to impact and help as many people as we can, so please give what you can so that we can take control over the destiny of businesses, and more importantly, help the people behind the businesses.
 
Thank you-
Stacy

PLEASE CONTRIBUTE--THIS IS A BIG DEAL

story:
Short Summary

Libra House is an emergency shelter for women, with or without children, who are experiencing relationship violence.  Libra House opened in December 1985.  We are located in Labrador, Canada.

- We strive to provide support and shelter to women and children who are experiencing violence or abuse. 

-We provide temporary crisis shelter and related services in a cooperative/communal living arrangement for women and children who are victims of violence. 

- We assist in the development and improvement of services and facilities to meet the needs of women and children. 

- We work to empower women to make their own decisions for themselves and their children.

This Project will see the building of a brand new shelter for us to provide our programs and services for women and children.  For 27 years we have been operating from a building that is far too small for us to be able to do our work effectively.  We need a space that is safe and secure, accessible, confidential and able to create an environment that is conducive to healing from abuse.  For the past 4 years we have been fund raising to make this project a reality and we are now ready to start building.

But we just have enough funds to get the building started.  We still need to raise $100,000 to help us make this an awesome place that includes paving, some storage sheds, landscaping, a playground for children and maybe even a garden for the residence. 

This is where we need YOUR help.  We hope to raise $10,000 through Indiegogo towards creating a wonderful outdoor space for our residents and their children.

What We Need & What You Get

This is what we hope to do:

Building a new shelter is important. But just as important is building a safe and beautiful outdoor area for the women and children who come to us for support.  We want to build a play area for the children, plant some trees and maybe even a flower or vegetable garden for the women.  The more funds we are able to raise the more beautiful we will be able to make our space.

We hope to be able to raise $10,000.00 for this part of the project.  But whatever we are able to raise no matter how much it is will go directly to the landscaping project.

Donors will receive a charitable receipt, some awesome Libra House swag as well a shout-out on our fund raising page: https://www.facebook.com/LibraHouseShelter

A local artist has written and recorded a song called "Be Strong Friend' for Libra House.  That song is available for download at http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/jacindabealsband  and it is also available on iTunes.  Some donors may receive a gift of a free download for their contribution.

We will also be adding some surprise perks thrroughout the campaign so keep checking in.

The Impact

For almost 27 years we have been offering services to women and children in our Community.  On average we provide emergency shelter to 82 families per year.  We also take hundreds of phone calls each year on our 24-hour crisis line.  Along with our partners in our Community and Region we take pride in the aniti-violence work we do in Labrador.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially at this time, we can still use your help. 
-  You can 'Like' and share our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/LibraHouseShelter 
-  You can forward this Indiegogo campaign page to your friends and social networking sites.
-  Download "Be Strong Friend" from iTunes or http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/jacindabealsband
-  Or you can check out our webpage for some other ways you can help: http://www.librahouse.ca/en/donations.html

 

We appreciate your support!

story:
The Summary

Dreyma means to Dream, in Icelandic and my goal with the line has always been about embracing the ritual of going to sleep, being asleep and waking up.  First I started by developing a bath and body product line, which focused on winding down from a stressful day with a great bath and a nice candle. The organic growth of the brand is in craft fairs and trunk shows. I have many special events planned for the upcoming holiday season and hope that you can help me make them happen!!

I draw  inspiration from the 60’s ye-ye girls and their ability to be both twee and sultry. I am eternally inspired by the beach and beach culture, girl groups, the flowers that grow on cacti,every phase of David Bowie, slow dances and Joan Didion novels.

If you want to see images that point to the inspirations behind the line click here! 

 

About Me…

My name is Oni and I am the Owner and Creative Director of Dreyma Studio. I am primarily self trained although I have been working in the fashion industry for most of my life, including a stint at Anthropologie, and internships for lifestyle boutique Ten over 6 and California based contemporary clothing line Wren. My style and the focus I bring to Dreyma Studio is on that is feminine, quirky and evocative of my California Lifestyle. Being born and raised in a coastal town has developed a love for bright and neon colors, laidback styling and the desire to really live in and embrace every moment. 

 

In this campaign I am hoping to raise at least $2500. Now, you may ask, where does this money go?

 

A Dynamic Booth Set Up: One of the most important parts of Craft Shows is the Booth Design. First impressions are EVERYTHING. The majority of the money raised will go towards creating a dynamic and unique booth set up that can easily break down and set up to work at multiple events and venue types. 

New Packaging.  I am very excited to introduce new products and new branding  designed by Eva Black Studios. I would like to integrate this new branding with updated packaging and promotional materials. This includes new labels, new containers and bottles.

Misc.: Hang tags and labels, packaging materials and a photo shoot to get the pieces online!

 

For $1- A shout out on our Webpage and many many thanks!

For $5 -A Handmade Screen Printed Thank You card. Put it on your freezer, on your desk at work, put it on a string and wear it around your neck! It’s a reminder that you are whole heartedly and sincerely appreciated!

For $20 Soap Set. You’ll get Three wool wrapped large soap bars from our Dreyma Studio B&B (that’s bath and body)line. The wool is softest merino type and this set also makes a really great gift +the card and the shout out

For $35- 2 Jasmine Filled Eye Mask Made from  Indian Sari Silk, and filled with organic jasmine and lavender. These will be screen printed with the phrase "bonne nuit" which means "Good Night" in French +the card and the shout out

For $50-Candle Set you’ll get a gift set of 2-7oz Dreyma Studio soy wax candles  + the card and the shout out

For $80-Pillow. A reversible pillow made from Indian Saris. Trimmed with pom poms. 100% Handmade + the eye masks, the card and the shout out

 

 

The Progress & Updates

You can follow the progress of the project which is schedule to be completed by December 2012 (Just is time for Valentines Day presents hint hint) on our facebook and twitter feeds. Also, you can always buy the B&B Line on Etsy!

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute, doesn’t mean you can't help in other ways. Please please please link to this campaign and spread the word. The goodies that you get in return are just TOO good to keep to yourself. 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Exciting News: We just found out that if we make our $15,000 dollar goal an anonymous donor will match it with an additional $15,000. 

We have to get there! Please help by donating and sharing our campaign with friends, family and colleagues.

Our Project

Hello! We are the Transplanting Traditions Community Farm, an educational farm project that is transforming the lives of refugee families struggling to overcome the challenges of adapting to new lives in Chapel Hill, North Carolina.  These refugee families were all farmers in their home countries and come to the United States with only the clothes on their back but with big dreams of becoming farmers in America!

Transplanting Traditions is a vocational agricultural program that works with over 150 refugee adults and children to build economically viable, environmentally sound, and socially sustainable local agricultural business opportunities for refugees living in North Carolina.  This project was started in 2007 by The Orange County Partnership for Young Children as a community garden project and expanded into a farm in 2010.The farm is a partnership project with Triangle Land Conservancy and  is located at their 269 acre Irvin Farm.  This unique partnership helps provide a permanently protected space for this program

Transplanting Traditions provides growing space for each family on its 4 acre farm.  In addition, farmers attend agricultural, business and marketing workshops.  We provide over 72 on-farm workshops and 32 hours of classroom training per year!  Farmers grow over 20 different crops native to their tropical home countries and each year the farm becomes a tropical paradise of turmeric, ginger, snake gourd, bitter melon, hibiscusand so much more.  Farmers participate in marketing their produce through local farmer's markets, CSA (Community Supported Agriculture) and restaurant sales.

In addition the farm is an important community space for refugees to learn, share ideas and preserve cultural agricultural heritage while simultaneously transitioning to their new lives in N.C.

 "I want to become a successful farmer one day. I want to own more land and farming machinery. I will not only grow vegetables but also rice, and raise chickens, cows, turkey and other farm animals. But right now I have nothing to start." --Transplanting Traditions Farmer

Transplanting Traditions Community Farm faces FUNDING LOSS in September of 2013.  Your contribution will help save this non-profit project!

How Your Contribution Helps

Your contribution will help keep this project rolling!  We are really hoping to go over our $15,000 goal so that we can:

  • xpand our refugee youth farm programming.
  • Improve our refugee-run farmer's market.
  • Allow families on our waiting list to begin growing at the farm and participating in Transplanting Traditions educational opportunities.

Check out our amazing perks that we offer as thanks for your contribution.  Everything from an intimate farm to fork dinner at Transplanting Traditions to a packet of unique seeds that you won't find anywhere else!

Also remember that any amount you give WILL help.  Indiegogo allows you to customize your giving amount.  Every dollar helps. 

 

Share This!

Please help us by sharing this link on your facebook, twitter or other media outlets.  Send to your friends and family through email. You can be an amabssador for this project. 

And thank you from the bottom of our hearts!
story_txt:
Exciting News: We just found out that if we make our $15,000 dollar goal an anonymous donor will match it with an additional $15,000. 
We have to get there! Please help by donating and sharing our campaign with friends, family and colleagues.
Our Project
Hello! We are the Transplanting Traditions Community Farm, an educational farm project that is transforming the lives of refugee families struggling to overcome the challenges of adapting to new lives in Chapel Hill, North Carolina.  These refugee families were all farmers in their home countries and come to the United States with only the clothes on their back but with big dreams of becoming farmers in America!
Transplanting Traditions is a vocational agricultural program that works with over 150 refugee adults and children to build economically viable, environmentally sound, and socially sustainable local agricultural business opportunities for refugees living in North Carolina.  This project was started in 2007 by The Orange County Partnership for Young Children as a community garden project and expanded into a farm in 2010.The farm is a partnership project with Triangle Land Conservancy and  is located at their 269 acre Irvin Farm.  This unique partnership helps provide a permanently protected space for this program
Transplanting Traditions provides growing space for each family on its 4 acre farm.  In addition, farmers attend agricultural, business and marketing workshops.  We provide over 72 on-farm workshops and 32 hours of classroom training per year!  Farmers grow over 20 different crops native to their tropical home countries and each year the farm becomes a tropical paradise of turmeric, ginger, snake gourd, bitter melon, hibiscusand so much more.  Farmers participate in marketing their produce through local farmer's markets, CSA (Community Supported Agriculture) and restaurant sales.
In addition the farm is an important community space for refugees to learn, share ideas and preserve cultural agricultural heritage while simultaneously transitioning to their new lives in N.C.
 "I want to become a successful farmer one day. I want to own more land and farming machinery. I will not only grow vegetables but also rice, and raise chickens, cows, turkey and other farm animals. But right now I have nothing to start." --Transplanting Traditions Farmer
Transplanting Traditions Community Farm faces FUNDING LOSS in September of 2013.  Your contribution will help save this non-profit project!
How Your Contribution Helps

Your contribution will help keep this project rolling!  We are really hoping to go over our $15,000 goal so that we can:

xpand our refugee youth farm programming.
Improve our refugee-run farmer's market.
Allow families on our waiting list to begin growing at the farm and participating in Transplanting Traditions educational opportunities.

Check out our amazing perks that we offer as thanks for your contribution.  Everything from an intimate farm to fork dinner at Transplanting Traditions to a packet of unique seeds that you won't find anywhere else!
Also remember that any amount you give WILL help.  Indiegogo allows you to customize your giving amount.  Every dollar helps. 
 
Share This!
Please help us by sharing this link on your facebook, twitter or other media outlets.  Send to your friends and family through email. You can be an amabssador for this project. 
And thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

story:
Summary

The reason our health care costs are through the ceiling is because of the nuclear fallout of the golden-era of the pharmaceutical empire. Now if we can peel that cold dead grip off our throats, you’ll find a preventative holistic, not for profit medical system, slowly surfacing for air. This campaign represents a butterfly effect towards meeting the federal efforts in the middle. Bureaucrats at least understand the crippling effect that our health care system has on the economy, but cannot possibly write any perfect form of legislation that will enact a cascading effect from the top down that will address all the intrinsic issues. If anything, the Patient Protection Act at best, is unknowingly a hallucinogenic last ditch effort before we yield to a universal health care system. For a full scope explanation of this visit: http://limetreeholisticadvocacy.com/full-scope/  

If you are new to the holistic healing realm, welcome; I hope you never have to find out the hard way that any combination of naturopathic, acupuncture & oriental medicine, and chiropractic is far less expensive and less invasive than a path of drugging, steroids, and an eventual path to surgery and some level of impairment (in non-emergency situations.) The newest fascinations in quantum physics prove on multiple levels the basis for the body’s innate genius to heal (Life Force: The Scientific Basis by Claude Swanson, Ph.D. http://youtu.be/DEqt8ZhMwJo )

Hence, we get to meet vicariously through Indiegogo, I’m Keirsten, the founder of Lime Tree Holistic Health Care Advocacy. I’m implementing Co-Op Advertising opportunities for holistic healers, building provider referral interchanges, and building annual calendar based community outreach programs. These strategies are designed to stretch the limited marketing budget of naturopaths, acupuncturists and chiropractors. Additionally, I teach these practitioners how to maintain the right perspective of a patient’s need to connect with them before their health is decimated. Based upon psychology and limited resources of the average patient, we are creating the groundwork of a not for profit system that is worth paying for because it keeps you well, as opposed to a current system which profits from us being sick. Backstory & Past Experience: http://www.linkedin.com/pub/keirsten-lindholm/61/a2a/49/

Currently

Since early November of 2012, I’ve worked full time developing this 80/20% social cause business model that strengthens small holistic healing businesses and works to reform insurance into holistic positive plans (which will save billions, build credibility nationally, and create more access for everyone.) I already have a handful of clients, am being asked to submit articles to the OAAOM’s (Oregon Association of Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine) newsletter, and am organizing bi-monthly workshops. I am currently fine tuning my business plan through Mercy Corps NW’s Business Foundations program and qualify for their Individual Development Account which will match my savings over the next year in a 4:1 ratio with a max of a $4,000 grant towards capital business goods. You can see details of these services at work: http://limetreeholisticadvocacy.com/services/

The magnitude of what you will help me to accomplish includes outfitting this effort with critically needed capital goods, a marketing campaign launch, intern stipends to triple my work output, and office space support. Additionally, you’ll expedite this model for franchising at a record pace and these tactics can be fully shared in other areas.

 

 

Cost Free Help:

*I'm looking for a partner and although I have excellent collaborators, cannot accomplish as much by myself. Spread the word.

*Like my Facebook page for educational updates on holistic health care: www.facebook.com/LimeTreeHolisticAdvocacy

*Do you know any talented holistic providers that need help stretching their marketing dollars? I have programs for established practices, and scholarships for start ups. Remote consulting can be done, or one-on-one in Portland, OR.

*Do you know anyone in holistic research at the universtity level? I need to share some strategy with them that will kill two birds with one stone: Quality applied research output = State Level Insurance Reforms.

 

Long Term Impact:

Imagine for a moment, that a near future community of healers, is well connected, there is no need for competition or division, everyone has an understanding of each other’s specialties, and when in your weakest moment, you will be urgently referred to the proper form of care that you need most!! Insurance prices can be brought back into ratio of what a living wage can afford, and digital protocols will guide you through a holistic approach that will not only save the most money but is also the least invasive, preventing permanent limitations left in the wake of surgical procedures. Mental health care protocols will include passive therapy brain retraining (side effect free,) and no one needs to live with permanent labels that further damage them socially. We can exponentially grow new sectors of our economy with a stronger and advanced mental awareness and actually be happy to pay for a system that works to keep us well! And with the money we save from a non-working system, as well as new tax revenues we create from a healthy thriving workforce, we can easily afford to create new programs to heal and assist the mentally ill that are forced to the streets. Imagine: No need to beg.

story:
The Community Splash

My name is Hannah Thomas; I am a senior member of The Ottawa Swim Club. I am currently organizing the first ever Ottawa Swim Club Community Splash. The Ottawa Swim Club Community Splash would expose community members of all ages to the health benefits, safety, and fun that swimming can build.  Everyday ten Americans die of accidental drowning. As member of a swim team, a lifeguard, and a swim lessons instructor this statistic scares me. This event will spread awareness about the seriousness of learning to swim and enjoying the water. If even one life is saved it would be an acomplishment.

What we Need

In order to fund this event we are hoping to raise $1000. This is the break down of where the funds will go.

$300- Rental Fee for City Pool

$200- Radio and Newspaper Ads

$500- Prizes for Swimming Events (Free Membership to Swim Team, Free Swim Pass, Free Swimming Lessons, Swimming Gear, t-shirts, and Ottawa Swag)

As part of the Event we are holding community races for swimmers of all ages as well as competitions including the best belly flop and cannon ball.

Sponsors would receive autographed pictures of the champion youth swimmers as well as their name or business name on the back of t-shirts.

If the financial goal is not met, we will charge a small admission to the event of $1. The donations would instead go to the prizes and not the rental fee.

 

The Impact

Your donation would directly affect the youth of my community. Can you think of an easier way to save so many lives?

Other Ways You Can Help

If you do not want to contribute financially, please help by spreading the word! Use the Ingiegogo share tools!

 

THANK YOU!

story:
I'm Andy Spillman, and I'm currently an "exploratory" major at UNCG in Greensboro, North Carolina.  I came to school here after completing an associate's in Mechanical Engineering to pursue music.  In the fall, I am auditioning for the Opera voice program at the school.


For the past couple of years I've had extremely frequent throat infections, and consistent problems resulting in dozens of Doctor's visits before they finally decided I should get my tonsils removed.  As of late the condition has gotten worse, and through my own methods (Selling baked goods to friends and accquaintances), I haven't reached my goal for the surgery.

 

I'd like to make it very clear that I HAVE HEALTH INSURANCE through UNCG.  However, with surgery comes anesthetic and patient financial responsibility.  There are many things (including recovery time, special foods and the part of surgery and anesthesia that University health insurance will not pay for), that I am struggling to raise enough money for.

Time has gone by, and since it has gotten more severe, I've been told that I need to get this done as quickly as possible, or the condition could cause serious problems.  I'm currently unemployed, but I have many skills, and I'd like to help you as much as I need help myself.

 

Please, give me a chance to make your life a little better, and maybe help me out in return.  Even if you're not interested in any of the things I'm offering in return for your donations, you can still help me spreading the word.  Once again, I'm not asking for charity, I am just looking for an alternative way to raise money to help cover some of the cost.

 

I started out offering guitar lessons, computer repair, and Baked goods.


Although the baked goods has gone very well so far, it has only extended to my close friends and family.  That is why I've made this campaign, to try and spread the word a little.  

Below is a list of things that I can bake and would be MORE THAN HAPPY to bake in exchange for a donation to my cause.  Please remember that I don't want anything for free, so even if you want to give, let me give YOU SOMETHING.  Whether you give it to a friend, family member, or another stranger who just needs a pick me up.

 

Peanut butter Chocolate Cheesecake with Reese's Peanut Butter Puff crust. 
Cheesecake cupcakes (Plain, chocolate, or Peanut butter) with Strawberry glaze. 
Cheesecake cupcakes (plain, chocolate, or peanut butter) with Rice Krispie treat crust. 
Chocolate chip cookie crust cheesecake cupcakes. (plain, chocolate, or peanut butter). 
Chocolate chip cookies. 
Chocolate chip cookies with - walnuts - or - macadamia nuts - or - cocnut 
Oatmeal Raisin cookies. 
Oatmeal Raisin cookies with chocolate ganache topping 
Baked cheese cookies (hard cheese, sharp cheddar, gouda, pepper jack, etc.). Varies by cost of cheese, 
Nestle Crunch Bar brownies (with white chocolate, peanut butter, or butterscotch shell topping). 9x9 (usually 16 brownies)
Triple layer carrot cake with Cream Cheese frosting
Godiva chocolate cupcakes stuffed with oreos and peanut butter, 
Chocolate chip cookie stuffed brownies. 
Classic Cheesecake with ganache topping, or with fruit and glaze topping.
Mini Reese's Peanut butter cup peanut butter "pop" cookies. 

Also available but not listed: - Cheesecakes of many varieties.
- Triple layer cakes of different varieties, with various frostings
- Gluten free desserts (other than cheesecakes)
- Dairy free desserts (eggless on request)
- Several varieties of brownies (stuffed with candy bars, topped with various shell).
- Sugar free desserts

Other: Use your imagination, if you like it, a dessert can be made from it. (For example: "I like reese's puffs cereal." And
The Reese's puffs crust chocolate/peanut butter cheesecake with chocolate ganache was born.)

 

Everything is made from scratch!  

I encourage you to use your imagination.  Help me be creative, and make your life a little better.  IF IT'S NOT ON THE LIST, THAT DOESN'T MEAN I CAN'T MAKE IT.

 


The perk delivery date is set after my surgery, but I should be able to get anything to you within one week of your donation.

 

I'd just like to say thank you for everyone that has helped me so far.  I just have a little bit farther to go, and I thank EVERYONE that reads, shares, donates, or even thinks about me for helping me out.

story:
Short Summary

My amazing girlfriend is going to Australia for a semester abroad and they do things a little different over there so her total time away will be nearly five months. Naturally we want to see each other during that period of time, but tickets to Australia are quite expensive. Not to mention, once I get there we'll probably want to eat food and do a few things that require monetary support. 

What We Need & What You Get

The money goes directly to ticket cost and travel expenses like food and transportation.

The Impact

We love each other, we hate going days without see one another, so five months would be pretty hard to take, especially being so far apart. We promise numerous cute couple selfies and posts about how much fun we're having.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute, but know someone who can? Send the link their way, every bit helps. Additionally United mileage donations would be apprecaited to Mileage plus account number DFS83594.

story:
Hi!  My name is Chrissy and I’m the owner and creator of Pie Chicks.

Pie Chicks is a new wholesale bakery on the island of Martha’s Vineyard, which is where I live.

I’ve been baking my whole life and whenever I bring a pie to a potluck or a party people say to me “You should do this for a living”.  So I’m going to.  And I'd love to have your help.

In order for this to really work I need equipment like mixers and refrigerators and bowls and spatulas and pans and stuff that helps me make really good pie.

And you can contribute to my success by being a part of my Pie chicks campaign.

Think of it as investing in your future happiness.

Purchasing two large commercial mixers, a walk in fridge, a refrigerator and a few chest freezers costs about $12,000.  I have found some really great used equipment and I’m hoping to be able to pay off a chunk of this initial capital investment so that my business can really flourish and I can stay focused on the important stuff—like baking really really good pies.

And when you contribute to my campaign you get pie, so it’s really a win win.  Unless you don’t like pie, but I don’t think I’ve ever met anyone who doesn’t like pie.  And for those of you who are gluten-free--I will happily substitute a Gluten-Free Crisp in place of any delivered pie.  And for all of my friends, family and fans in the Cleveland area:  I will be home for the holidays and will gladly bake and deliver pies to you then.  If you can wait that long!  I promise you--it's worth it.

And if you really really love pie (like I do) you can come to pie class or have a pie party at your home for all of your friends.  You can even get a pie named after you.  Think of all the pie possibilities!

Anything I reach over my goal will go towards helping me hire a pie helper for this summer season.  Because the world definitely needs more Pie Chicks.  Anything I raise under my goal will help me to pay for my equipment.

I’m pretty certain that pie can save the world.  I’ve written a little piece (piece, get it?) about Saving the World One Pie at a Time.  You can find it on my website at http://www.piechicks.com/save-the-world.html

My new business is really exciting for me because it lets me combine my education (I have a business degree from Ohio State--GO BUCKS!) and work experience (I spent 7 years at The FARM Institute as the Business Manager and then as the Development Director) and my passion which is baking.  So I’m thrilled to be at this point in my life where I’m ready to take a risk...and make lots of pie for all of you to enjoy!

I’d love your help in spreading the word and getting more pie out into the world.  Please use the easy share tools on Indiegogo and Facebook.  I appreciate your support and generosity.

Thanks Everyone!  I hope to see you all real soon.

Purchasing two large commercial mixers, a walk in fridge, a refrigerator and a few chest freezers costs about $12,000.  I have found some really great used equipment and I’m hoping to be able to pay off a chunk of this initial capital investment so that my business can really flourish and I can stay focused on the important stuff—like baking really really good pies.
And when you contribute to my campaign you get pie, so it’s really a win win.  Unless you don’t like pie, but I don’t think I’ve ever met anyone who doesn’t like pie.  And for those of you who are gluten-free--I will happily substitute a Gluten-Free Crisp in place of any delivered pie.  And for all of my friends, family and fans in the Cleveland area:  I will be home for the holidays and will gladly bake and deliver pies to you then.  If you can wait that long!  I promise you--it's worth it.
And if you really really love pie (like I do) you can come to pie class or have a pie party at your home for all of your friends.  You can even get a pie named after you.  Think of all the pie possibilities!
Anything I reach over my goal will go towards helping me hire a pie helper for this summer season.  Because the world definitely needs more Pie Chicks.  Anything I raise under my goal will help me to pay for my equipment.
I’m pretty certain that pie can save the world.  I’ve written a little piece (piece, get it?) about Saving the World One Pie at a Time.  You can find it on my website at http://www.piechicks.com/save-the-world.html
My new business is really exciting for me because it lets me combine my education (I have a business degree from Ohio State--GO BUCKS!) and work experience (I spent 7 years at The FARM Institute as the Business Manager and then as the Development Director) and my passion which is baking.  So I’m thrilled to be at this point in my life where I’m ready to take a risk...and make lots of pie for all of you to enjoy!
I’d love your help in spreading the word and getting more pie out into the world.  Please use the easy share tools on Indiegogo and Facebook.  I appreciate your support and generosity.
Thanks Everyone!  I hope to see you all real soon.

story:
What We Will Offer

Fun, Fitness, Education, Relaxation, and Unity. Our goal is to bring the community together through enriching leisure time experiences, while offering a localized family help center. A generalized description for 3 of our departments have been outlined, although, we plan to offer many more programs.

The Impact

The facility will offer safe, family friendly fun, with an educational twist. Through experience and entertainment, funds will be accumulated, and used for various programs which give back to the community.

  • Arts & Crafts Department: With art programs being eliminated from public schools due to budget cuts, and with overworked and underfinanced parents unable to provide their children with private art lessons, we face a future of adults without strong creativity, innovation and problem-solving skills. The arts promote, encourage and provide a safe, exploring experience for children to practice skills that are vital to the rest of their education. How can a child solve a complex scientific problem without the ability to think creatively and be innovative? The effect of art on children cannot be denied or ignored.
  • Food & Nutrition Department: Children love few things better than playing with food. Having permission to do it is even more exciting. Crafts with food are entertaining and yummy; edible crafts allow young kids to be creative with food in ways they never thought of. Craft time for kids can be fun and tasty with these edible arts and crafts projects. Kids will have a great time playing with their food and then eating their art. These projects can be fun at home or at school, and can even make good party activities.
  • Fitness & Outdoor Activities: Kids outdoor activities can be a great way to keep your children physically fit  and away from the video games. From scavenger hunts to chasing games and  building projects, there are plenty of ways to keep your children engaged when  they are outside. Playing outdoors can encourage children to become more active, a key point in battling childhood obesity. When children have activities to do outside that they enjoy doing, they are more likely to want to stay outside longer.

What We Need

We greatly appreciate anything that you/your company can offer. Although we prefer a financial donation, any of the items listed below or services are also accepted. The list includes what we need, but is not limited to the following:

  • Arts & Crafts Department: Markers, crayons, glue, scissors, paint, paint brushes, sponges, t-shirts, glitter, fabric paint, googly eyes, yarn, embroidry floss, beads, stickers, foam cut outs, foam sheets, wooded sticks, wooden shapes, buttons, cardstock, copy paper, construction paper, sharpie markers, pencils, glass containers, disposable containers, various holiday craft kits, chalk, envelopes, gift bags, material, boxes, magnets, ribbons, twine
  • Food & Nutrition Department: Water, juices, milk, coffee, tea, baked items, crackers, fruits, vegetables, cheeses, lunch meats, peanut butter, m&m's, peanuts, raisins, holiday candy, disposable cutlery, disposable plates, disposable cups, disposable bowls, disposable napkins, paper towels, decorating goods, lables, cereals, storage containers, glass jars, pretzels
  • Fitness & Outdoor Activities: Picnic tables, outdoor garbage cans, benches, swings, jungle gyms, slides, monkey bars, poles, balance beams, sidewalk chalk, bird feeders, water fountains, cement, bricks, tables for festivals, canopies for festivals
  • Indoor Facility: Construction of building, plumbing, electricity, toilets, sinks, cleaning supplies, tables, chairs

Other Ways You Can Help

We look forward to sharing many more joys with our community of families.

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family.
  • Post a link on social networks like Facebook and Twitter. Our Facebook page is: www.facebook.com/kitsapcommunitycelebrationcenter
  • Click onto our comments tab to give us feedback.
  • Contact us to donate any of items or services listed above.

story:
About Salvation Botanicals

We here at Salvation Botanicals believe in the amazing power of hemp. Many studies are showing the vast medical benefits of hemp and we are super excited to bring a range of healthy hemp teas to market. We have blends of tea that you will never have heard of, that taste fantastic and that also have medicinal properties, using various superfoods and herbal extracts.

Salvation Botanicals is located in sunny downtown Nanaimo BC, Canada. We also make luxury herbal organic dark chocolates, with crazy ingredients, like blue lotus and goji berry, that taste fabulous!

We are at that point in the business where we have to sell our tea in tea bags and for that we need a machine. The machine costs around $15,000 plus delivery costs. We also need printing materials and supplies.

If we reach our goal, we will be able to really penetrate the tea market in Canada and bring the natural health benefits of hemp ( combined with superfoods) to tea drinkers nationwide!

We have encouraging feedback from local grocery stores that will stock our teas and we can create a job or two here in Nanaimo when we get the machine running.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our hope is to bring the world of hemp to tea drinkers the world over. This means we have to buy a tea bagging machine that costs approximately $15,000, plus delivery, ($2,000), labelling supplies, and so on, for a total of $20,000.  We also need approximatley $5,000 for marketing, designs and planning for things like tea bag labels, box designs and outer bag design. We already have our warehouse, supply chain, sales and marketing plan and staff. 

We are able to offer to every diamond contributor a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Every person who contributes $1,000 to our hemp stem tea bagging machine, will receive a one day ski pass at Whister-Blackcomb and a FULL DAY SNOWBOARDING OR SKIING with Jeremy, our resident creative genius, creator of the teas and chocolates we make here, or a whale watching tour off the coast of Vancouver Island.

A DOUBLE DIAMOND contributor who contributes $5,000 will get a day heli-skiing  high above the treeline at Whistler-Blackcomb, in beautiful BC, Canada, or at a heli-ski operator nearer you, or a Whale watching weekend off the coast of Vancouver Island and join us for our launch party, set for MAY, 2013. 

If we don't raise all the necessary funds for this hemp tea initiative, we will still use all the money raised to buy that amazing machine.

 

What This Means

Hemp is now being recognised as a healthy superfood. Raw Hemp provides a broad spectrum of health benefits, including weight loss, increased and sustained energy, lowered cholesterol and blood pressure, reduced inflammation improvement in circulation, boosted immune system and natural blood sugar level control, among others. We believe that we can spread the word and increase the appeal of hemp to people around the word and that knowledge will help make the world a better, gentler place.

All contiributors will be able to enjoy all the flavours and different styles of teas that we make. Then you can tell your friends and family and spread the word on the many benefits of imbibing in these tasty teas.

By contributing, you give us the opportunity to serve you and recognise you for making the world of difference that hemp makes. We will send you your tea and include some bonus chocolates that we have just developed. These contain rare and unusual ingredients sourced from around the world too.

Once we are able to be self sufficient making and selling tea, we plan on developing a whole range of innovative hemp based concentrates and extracts that will be notable for raising the profile of hemp as a health choice in Canada.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand that some of you don't have much money to contribute. We are always looking for friends to be a part of our vision, who are excited to spread the word of how we can use hemp for our health. If you want to help, drop us a line, like us on facebook, or help us spread the word the word by TWEETing, reposting, email and share with people you know. We welcome all and thank you all for your interest
