story:
On December 19, 2012 the life of two small children (Aryana, 5 and Sam,3) and their compassionate parents (Hope and Ryan) changed forever. They were shipwrecked on the shores of Rosarito B.C, Mexico. They lost their savings and belongings to locals ransacking the wreck, but are thankfully safe from harm. 
Please, show some love to this beautiful family in their time of need. Contribute to showing her babies that with kindness and love, anything is possible. God bless!

"The boat was a 1977 Islander 26 (26') It did finally make it all the way to the shore after we jumped off. I haven't been able to get back to the site to see if it is still there. There is a brother by the name of Kevin McMahon that is coming from Nevada tomorrow to get us. He is on his way to the gathering so hopefully we will be in the arms of family soon. I am trying to give a truck to Helen Healing that is a 1990 Ford F-250 heavt duty with a fifth wheel hitch but she might need some help paying for the parking fees because I left it at the San Diego airport. I gave Voice beam a Honda a couple of weeks ago and Jeremie "Caution" Hennings a mini van a while back so I don't have much left to give. If Wolf Wandering can salvage the boat, it would be awesome for whoever gets it. It is a fiberglass hull, and was a fantastic boat. Nice deep keel. We got caught in a storm we didn't expect and then stuck in a huge kelp bed right after dark in 9 foot waves. I got on the radio to call for help and the batteries all went dead so we had to get close to shore and use flares. We saw cars lights flash at us. The anchor kept pulling up and we drifted closer to shore. The keel started to hit rocks and tip the boat all the way on its side and back to the other as it spun around in the waves like crazy. Stuff flying everywhere, water pouring in the hatch and little kids screaming bloody murder, terrified. At that point, my memory starts to get a little spotty, all flashes of crazy scenes. The boat is about 10 miles south of Rosarito beach. We were headed for Puerto Salina but were about 3 miles north when shit got real. Excuse the language. 
We were helped onto the rocks by some locals. Then had to jump back in to get to the shoreline. We spent the first night at the Rosarito bomberos Station, where they were kind and fed us and let us take showers. They even hung our wet clothes to dry, gave me back the cash they found in the pockets and helped Ryan get a couple of our packs off of the boat, which is all we have left. The boat was being ransacked by the locals the as we sat on the rocks wet and freezing with the children, waiting for the Navy to come. It was full of supplies enough for a family of six for a new life start, and all of our savings, birth certificates, etc. and this is a very poor country, so it was inevitable and we are not resentful in any way. The universe provides for all of us in the way it is supposed to. We have not been able to get back there.
Our plan was to go to the World Rainbow gathering outside of Palenque, Mexico, so all of our savings and possessions were in the boat. We had four of my children on the boat, but the two teens left the next day back to America. We do not have that option as my father, Rick Carrillo, has threatened me with getting CPS or the police involved if we go back, said the the guy at the fire department in Tijuana. 
We are still in Rosarito, but a kind brother, Kevin McMahon, has messaged to to say he will head out from Nevada tomorrow and give us a ride South. My beautiful sister in law has set us up an IndyGoGo and we are hoping to raise enough to get somewhere safe and work to pay back all of the help we receive. We could really use a tent, blankets and food. The children are ages 5 and 3. Letting the media know was a suggestion of a kind lady on the internet (which is our only means of communication) and she sent me the links to many news stations, but I was unable to contact them through there and I have no phone.
Once we get to a place to settle for a while, we have 2 acres in California we can try to sell and pay everyone back for their generosity. I didn't want to post this publicly because so many of the people we have given things to keep coming back for more and the property is all we have left. EVERYONE told us to get cheap insurance in the US and the good insurance when we got to Ensenada. So there is no real insurance, just liability. There was tons of food and supplies. We just wanted to move the kids to a free country and continue to do charity work. Never though a shit storm would come up so fast during cruising season. 
The crazy judgementality we have gotten from so many was the reason we left the US and has since convinced us that we were right to leave. People are so much more compassionate and hard working here, it is amazing. The people we found to stay with are American, and I believe this is why the weird chaotic energies in this place. I just hope Kevin gets here and helps us out of Rosarito. We have the boat papers and hope that Wolf Wandering is interested in salvage and claiming it for the Rainbow Family. 
I skimmed some of the messages from various folks, not in depth yet, but it all sounds like more people mad at us for trying to take the kids to a better life than armed guards in schools, in the police state of America. I really would like to avoid these energies for a while as I am still kinda reeling from the whole experience, as it was MY first sailing trip and most likely, the last.
Ryan is so DEEPLY sorry for the whole thing, I don't think he needs to be punished any more, I raged at him for days. He never intended to put us in danger, as EVERYONE who taught us and gave us advice said no worries, best sail ever. The burden of guilt we both feel is hard enough without all of the people ranting on and on about it. Both of our families turned on us and basically said we deserve worse than what happened. We were trying and we failed. Can't express mt sorrow over that. But not many care to hear that part when they can get gory details and talk crap about stupid people like us and think of all these harsh punishments for us. Yes, we were stupid. Yes we have learned a valuable lesson. No we will not give up. Any more info I can give you just ask and I will provide. Thanks for not being harsh. I appreciate it, truly. Loving all of my people with a heart full of gratitude, even the ones I do not wish to talk to at the moment. I will get to you in time. ♥ ♥ ♥"

They have survived through hard times, and they will again. They are such a resilient, happy family, with so much love between them! You'll be contributing to keeping them safe and healthy, so they can continue living a life of beauty and inspiring those around them to do the same.
If you can't donate, you can still help in a big way! Share with your friends, and get the word out! 
Make some noise! Tell all your friends on Facebook and Twitter, and encourage them to do the same! We can do this, folks!!
story_txt: On December 19, 2012 the life of two small children (Aryana, 5 and Sam,3) and their compassionate parents (Hope and Ryan) changed forever. They were shipwrecked on the shores of Rosarito B.C, Mexico. They lost their savings and belongings to locals ransacking the wreck, but are thankfully safe from harm. Please, show some love to this beautiful family in their time of need. Contribute to showing her babies that with kindness and love, anything is possible. God bless!"The boat was a 1977 Islander 26 (26') It did finally make it all the way to the shore after we jumped off. I haven't been able to get back to the site to see if it is still there. There is a brother by the name of Kevin McMahon that is coming from Nevada tomorrow to get us. He is on his way to the gathering so hopefully we will be in the arms of family soon. I am trying to give a truck to Helen Healing that is a 1990 Ford F-250 heavt duty with a fifth wheel hitch but she might need some help paying for the parking fees because I left it at the San Diego airport. I gave Voice beam a Honda a couple of weeks ago and Jeremie "Caution" Hennings a mini van a while back so I don't have much left to give. If Wolf Wandering can salvage the boat, it would be awesome for whoever gets it. It is a fiberglass hull, and was a fantastic boat. Nice deep keel. We got caught in a storm we didn't expect and then stuck in a huge kelp bed right after dark in 9 foot waves. I got on the radio to call for help and the batteries all went dead so we had to get close to shore and use flares. We saw cars lights flash at us. The anchor kept pulling up and we drifted closer to shore. The keel started to hit rocks and tip the boat all the way on its side and back to the other as it spun around in the waves like crazy. Stuff flying everywhere, water pouring in the hatch and little kids screaming bloody murder, terrified. At that point, my memory starts to get a little spotty, all flashes of crazy scenes. The boat is about 10 miles south of Rosarito beach. We were headed for Puerto Salina but were about 3 miles north when shit got real. Excuse the language. We were helped onto the rocks by some locals. Then had to jump back in to get to the shoreline. We spent the first night at the Rosarito bomberos Station, where they were kind and fed us and let us take showers. They even hung our wet clothes to dry, gave me back the cash they found in the pockets and helped Ryan get a couple of our packs off of the boat, which is all we have left. The boat was being ransacked by the locals the as we sat on the rocks wet and freezing with the children, waiting for the Navy to come. It was full of supplies enough for a family of six for a new life start, and all of our savings, birth certificates, etc. and this is a very poor country, so it was inevitable and we are not resentful in any way. The universe provides for all of us in the way it is supposed to. We have not been able to get back there.Our plan was to go to the World Rainbow gathering outside of Palenque, Mexico, so all of our savings and possessions were in the boat. We had four of my children on the boat, but the two teens left the next day back to America. We do not have that option as my father, Rick Carrillo, has threatened me with getting CPS or the police involved if we go back, said the the guy at the fire department in Tijuana. We are still in Rosarito, but a kind brother, Kevin McMahon, has messaged to to say he will head out from Nevada tomorrow and give us a ride South. My beautiful sister in law has set us up an IndyGoGo and we are hoping to raise enough to get somewhere safe and work to pay back all of the help we receive. We could really use a tent, blankets and food. The children are ages 5 and 3. Letting the media know was a suggestion of a kind lady on the internet (which is our only means of communication) and she sent me the links to many news stations, but I was unable to contact them through there and I have no phone.Once we get to a place to settle for a while, we have 2 acres in California we can try to sell and pay everyone back for their generosity. I didn't want to post this publicly because so many of the people we have given things to keep coming back for more and the property is all we have left. EVERYONE told us to get cheap insurance in the US and the good insurance when we got to Ensenada. So there is no real insurance, just liability. There was tons of food and supplies. We just wanted to move the kids to a free country and continue to do charity work. Never though a shit storm would come up so fast during cruising season. The crazy judgementality we have gotten from so many was the reason we left the US and has since convinced us that we were right to leave. People are so much more compassionate and hard working here, it is amazing. The people we found to stay with are American, and I believe this is why the weird chaotic energies in this place. I just hope Kevin gets here and helps us out of Rosarito. We have the boat papers and hope that Wolf Wandering is interested in salvage and claiming it for the Rainbow Family. I skimmed some of the messages from various folks, not in depth yet, but it all sounds like more people mad at us for trying to take the kids to a better life than armed guards in schools, in the police state of America. I really would like to avoid these energies for a while as I am still kinda reeling from the whole experience, as it was MY first sailing trip and most likely, the last.Ryan is so DEEPLY sorry for the whole thing, I don't think he needs to be punished any more, I raged at him for days. He never intended to put us in danger, as EVERYONE who taught us and gave us advice said no worries, best sail ever. The burden of guilt we both feel is hard enough without all of the people ranting on and on about it. Both of our families turned on us and basically said we deserve worse than what happened. We were trying and we failed. Can't express mt sorrow over that. But not many care to hear that part when they can get gory details and talk crap about stupid people like us and think of all these harsh punishments for us. Yes, we were stupid. Yes we have learned a valuable lesson. No we will not give up. Any more info I can give you just ask and I will provide. Thanks for not being harsh. I appreciate it, truly. Loving all of my people with a heart full of gratitude, even the ones I do not wish to talk to at the moment. I will get to you in time. ♥ ♥ ♥"They have survived through hard times, and they will again. They are such a resilient, happy family, with so much love between them! You'll be contributing to keeping them safe and healthy, so they can continue living a life of beauty and inspiring those around them to do the same.If you can't donate, you can still help in a big way! Share with your friends, and get the word out! Make some noise! Tell all your friends on Facebook and Twitter, and encourage them to do the same! We can do this, folks!!

story:
Three New Goods for Social Change from Matter Inc.,
Made with love in New Orleans, Louisiana

Three new products from the makers of BirdProject soap, which has donated 18K to date for restoration post BP spill & has been featured in: GOOD, Whole Living, People, on the Martha Stewart show, Design Milk, Climbur, Treehugger, InvadeNOLA, nola.com, & many other inspiring publications.

About me: I'm Tippy Tippens, founder of Matter Inc., Design for Social Change. Matter is based in the precious city of New Orleans and is a design studio dedicated to creating sustainable products that create meaningful connections for our most important social and environmental problems. I'm also excited to have just recently been honored with the inclusion in the GOOD 100 this year!

I'm thrilled to now share with you three new meaningful Matter products that give back. Please watch our 3 min. video above! All are sustainably made in New Orleans-but we need your help to make them! The funds raised will pay for the first batches of each, eco-happy packaging, & a few updates needed to our website for these new products!

This group of meaningful, sustainably made products are inspired by three different needs but all share one common trait: folding to transform. By backing here on Indiegogo, you receive early-bird-20% off-discounts - WOOT! Please see more about the three below, watch the video above, and let me know if you have any questions, I'm happy to help.

1. Dreams Matter, Notebooks are where dreams begin.

A sketchbook is a trusted confidant and a place where dreams begin. As you fill these notebooks with your dreams, you also help students stay in school via donations to the "I Have A Dream" Foundation.

These 5" x 7" notebooks have beautiful letterpress covers made by John Fitzgerald. The paper is amazing. It is incredibly smooth & made of 100% recycled content - French's paper has been creating sustainable papers since 1955. They are a sixth generation, family owned company that started in 1871. Their U.S. mill has been powered by hydroelectric since 1922, also giving surplus electricity to surrounding communities.

As you note your ideas you also help middle school and high school children stay in school and attend college via a percentage of proceeds donated to the I Have a Dream Foundation. The I Have a Dream Foundation has a unique program that provides mentors to children in under-resourced schools and helps them from elementary through high school as well as providing tuition assistance for college. This will be the first in a series of 'Dreams Matter' notebooks.

~

The letterpress covers share some of my favorite mantras of encouragement including: 'There is always today', 'Dreams Matter,' and a note from my mom written in a birthday card shortly after my move to New Orleans that I use as a reminder often.

From 'my momma said': "Free yourself from the past, keep only the parts that make you happy. Be light, a heavy spirit slows you. Be happy and kind, you will draw the same towards you. Be the kind of person that you admire and you will draw that too. First, love and know yourself. Enjoy and celebrate each new day, each new day is a birth of a new you. Take good care of yourself."

 

2. Rabbits for Reading

Rabbits for Reading is a child and adult sized flax linen napkin set. Once folded, a rabbit appears! This new reading toy builds upon the benefits of learning and play, fusing fun and reading.

This is a collaborative product, designed by Cécile Thalmann & Adel Kassem, two incredible designers living in Amsterdam. Cécile's grandmother used to play with her using this linen rabbit trick and Cécile has been sharing it with others ever since. It's such a delightful surpise and the transformation of the napkin sparks a child's imagination. The benefits of play for learning are many, it supercharges learning, relieves stess, and helps to sort new emotions. The rabbit also becomes a child's reading buddy, wandering with them through books and lands of imagination.

This project was inspired by learning the literacy rate in New Orleans, while not in the lowest nationwide, is at 44% (2013). Strength in literacy builds better communities, parents, health, and lowers crime.

A percentage of proceeds will be donated to S.T.A.I.R. and First Book. S.T.A.I.R. is a one-on-one tutoring group that helps children in danger of academic failure learn the love of reading and build their confidence, becoming academic leaders. First Book is nationwide and in Canada, connecting children & schools in need with free or low cost books. They leverage the work of S.T.A.I.R., teachers, and other groups teaching children to read.

 

 

3. A Warm Hug

Inspired by the needs brought by Hurricane Sandy, this new blanket forms a heart upon your chest once wrapped around you, essentially giving a warm hug. Soon available in multiple sizes, we are beginning with the smallest size for infants (30" x 30") and then will work our way to the larger sizes, hoping to introduce a throw-sized blanket here soon!

 

These blankets bring you warmth while also raising funding for rebuilding communities that are still affected by Hurricane Sandy. We will give a percentage of proceeds to Architecture for Humanity who rebuild communities affected by disasters around the world. What makes them different is their focus on the long term & true consideration of each unique community.

 

To create the baby blankets we are working with Liamolly's knitting co-op which shares a Stoll knitting machine with makers in New Orleans. These knitting machines are amazing & most commonly known for being used by Nike & Adidas to knit sneakers.  They also use very little electricity, the equivalent of a few light bulbs.

The baby blankets are knit with 100% Egyptian cotton, of beautiful colors made by a high quality mill, Filmar, founded in 1951 in Italy. They are the producers of beautiful colored yarn of the highest quality. At this point, most U.S. Mills have closed and moved across the seas that create the yarn needed for this machine. It requires yarn with long fibers so that it won't break during production. The long fibers requried also make an extremely high quality heirloom blanket, with plenty of gusto for long-life wear.

 


We need your help to finalize prototypes and create the first batch of each new product in time for Fall.

We need your help to make our funding and production goals in the next few weeks to have them ready for you by fall!

I'm excited to have found these incredible makers and to have researched the best materials to use for these latest Matter goods. Thank you for your help to produce packaging and first batches in time for back to school & the weather cooling, the perfect time for notebooks, blankets, & reading rabbits. Please help me spread the word!

Matter's Impact

Our beneficial impacts are many: healthier environment due to healthy manufacturing & materials, creating work locally, while making longlasting goods in the U.S., as well as raising donations for these amazing groups. I so appreciate your support in creating goods that truly matter.

Merci Beaucoup!

Please share with your friends & family & we're so appreciative of your help in making these new products by Fall, the perfect time for blankets & notebooks & it's right around the corner! This will also help to pay for the updates needed for our website for these new products. Also, please do let me know if you have any questions, I'm happy to help, and I look forward to hearing from you.

Sending all of my best & merci beaucoup, Tippy

Additonal rewards:

Check out our new awesome totes - I love and am slightly addicted to totes, for books, groceries, shopping, transporting, etc. These are super sturdy, made of recycled cotton, made in the U.S., and printed in New Orleans with eco inks by Kelly Scardina. I hope that you enjoy them as much as I do!


 

 

We are also including our super soft Matter Tees, they are printed in New Orleans with eco-inks on American Apparel tees, made in Los Angeles. In Uni-sex vee-necks, available in S, M, X, XL!

story:
Artisanal Wine for the Rest of You  

We are a small importing company who needs your help in supplying you and the rest of the country with our wines.

 "Adonna Wine Imports brings Italian wines of integrity and legacy. Nevermind they've covered the bases on small production, low yield, unique and pleasurable, but they discover wines that are so well made from conscientious growers. They're wines of place and story. " 

LIz Vilardi ~ Owner of The Blue Room & Belly Wine Bar ~ Cambridge, MA

 

  Who We Are & Why We Are Different  

We are hands on owner/operators who source, import, and distribute all of the small production Italian wines in our portfolio. Adonna Imports takes great efforts building lasting relationships not only with our producers but with our clientele as well. For us, providing the best service and support possible is an integral part of our philosophy. We have logged countless hours traveling and sourcing wines from all over Italy. Through our travels, we have developed close connections with our producers. The time and experiences shared with them has given us a perspective on wine that is truly invaluable. We focus on providing wines that are traditional, enjoyable, and reveal the character of the land and the talents of the people who produce them.   

 

Why we need your help   

We are a young company in the world of sourcing, importing and wine distribution. During our time in the business, we have encountered a unique problem: our wines have been met with such strong enthusiasm that we have are having a very difficult time supplying demand. While this is a great problem to have, it is a problem nonetheless. Not having enough wine to sell can create disappointment for current clients but can also stunt growth; this is where you come in.  Your contribution will allow us to strengthen our inventory by not only being able to purchase more wine but to be able to add new producers to our portfolio. All of this allows us to offer our wines in new markets. We are working toward providing our wines throughout New England…and, hopefully, one day nationally. Without enough inventory to supply the high demand for our wines, we cannot support an expansion into new markets...this allows just a small audience in the Boston-Metro area the opportunity to work with our portfolio of producers.

 

 Why you should back us  

 ~ To help broaden the audience for small production Italian wine   

~ To promote tradition and quality in wine production  

 ~ To help support owner-operated small businesses     

 

Risks and Challenges

The Challenge for us is straight forward: we need to add producers and inventory to our portfolio so that we can bring our wines to you and everyone else. Because we are small and have limited resources and are considered a "niche" business, traditional funding options just aren't in the cards for us. The demand for our wines seriously outweighs our supply and without additional funding, offering our wines in any new market isn't possible. We have proven in a very short time that we can succeed, and with your help opening up our portfolio to new markets should be no different.

 

How IndieGoGo Works   

To accomplish the goal, our hope is to raise $45,000 or more within 45 days. To encourage a broad range of backers, we’ve put together some amazing rewards to thank you for your support and generosity. This project is vital to our success as a company. "Artisanal Wine for the Rest of You" is only able to move forward if the goal is met.

 

Open up. To show our gratitude, we will send you your very own Adonna Imports wine key.

It’s in the Bag. Receive an Adonna Imports reusable 4 bottle wine tote.

A picture is worth a 1000 words. Get a limited edition copy of an Adonna Imports photo journal.

The Trifecta. A nice kit that includes an Adonna Imports wine key, wine tote, and photo journal.

Winemaker 101. Dine, learn, and enjoy an evening with a winemaker. You will be treated a to an  exclusive dinner in Boston hosted by the partners of Adonna Imports and one of our producers.

Soup to Nuts. This level of support entitles you and a guest to an incredible weekend stay and private dinner at the acclaimed Relais Chateaux property, The Charlotte Inn & The Terrace Restaurant on Martha’s Vineyard.

Get the Boot. Two lucky backers will be treated to a Whirlwind Tour of Italy with Adonna Imports as your personal guide all along the way.

Your Involvement   

You can help in more ways than one. You can select a level of support to pledge and help us reach our goal or share this video with others who are like-minded and would be willing to back our efforts. Of course, you can choose to do both by backing our project with a pledge and forwarding our IndieGoGo campaign to as many people as you wish.     

Thank you so much for your support! 
Jeannie, Eileen, & Fred of Adonna Imports

 

Credits:
Video Production: Matt Ferguson
Photography: Heather Mullins
For inquiries and photos, please contact: adonnaimports@rcn.com

story:
My wife and I are Jeepers, been Jeeping for about 8 years now and enjoy getting together with other Jeepers be it on the trails or meeting up at a Show & Shine or even just dinner and drinks. Due to the economy and health issues we have been forced to park our rig for the last year. We are starting to see a light at the end of the tunnel and would like to get Choptop Waggy back in operation. We are hoping your contibutions we help us do this. 

 

What we need to reach this goal for are new tires, shocks and major engine work. We will be doing most of the work ourselves so any money raised will be going for parts and any money left over from our set goal as well as any money over our goal will be donated to the Wheelers for the Wounded. Thank you for your time and any donations you may make.

http://www.wheelersforthewounded.com

story:
Short Summary

I am raising money to build a new baseball field for the children of El Gigante, Nicaragua.

  • I am Leo Harris.  I am 13 years old, live in suburban Chicago, and I play baseball for the Waterdogs.  


  • Just like me, the children of El Gigante love baseball but and have an old, rough field to play on.  
  • As part of my Bar Mitzvah social service project, I am raising money to build a new field that they can enjoy.  By improving the field, the children will get to play baseball safely and throughout the entire year.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am raising $10,000 to build the new baseball field.  The funds will go for the following improvements:



                  $2,500 for new infield dirt and outfield grass
                  $1,500 for a new outfield fence
                  $1,000 for construction of new, safe dugouts with roofs
                  $5,000 for construction of a secure fence around the entire ballpark,                                       new spectator stands, a concession stand, and a scoreboard.

The Impact

Every dollar will go to improving the baseball field for the children of El Gigante.

  • I have partnered with The Sweetwater Fund, directed by Kassidy Medford,  located in El Gigante to design and manage the baseball field renovations.
  • Sweetwater is a 501-C-3 non-profit organization, with locations in Nicaragua and the United States.  Their website can be found here.  www.sweetwater.org 
  • In 2011, my sister Ella raised more than $1,800 for her Bat Mitzvah to help build a suspension bridge to help the children of El Gigante get safely to school across a gourge.  The story is located here.  Ella's Story.  


How you can contribute:

Like in the major leagues, we have 'sponsorship' opportunities to raise the monies.  

  • If you contribute $25, your name will appear on a plaque at the baseball field
  • If you contribute $100, your name will appear on the outfield fence
  • If you contribute $1,000, your name will appear on the dugout (limit 2)
  • If you contribute $10,000, we will name the baseball field after you! (limit 1)

Thank you for your consideration and support!
Sincerly, Leo Harris

story:
Well me thinks its time to pull the plug on this ill concieved and badly executed attempt at proving there is a market for a specialty eSports bar in Toronto. There is one, i just failed to articulate our goals and tap into its social power. Our potential investor has spoken and it is negative so for those of you that contributed, I am reversing the monies back to you. For those that LIKED and SHARED it I thank you hardily and hope you stand by as I and my small but rabid team try and figure a way to do this properly. For now we are looking at going to several smaller guys and pitching it that way.

This type of bar has a future so i envision someone opening one eventually. It might not be exactly what I was going for but it would still be a big step in the direction eSports is going. Onward and upward.

Regards
Miqui

story:
What do science, religion, higher consciousness and common sense all have in common? They all teach that what you put out is what you get back, they just do it in different ways.

Do you subscribe to Karma? What about the Golden Rule? Newton's Third Law of Motion? How about "You reap what you sow"? If you said "yes" to one of these, you said yes to all of them because they are the same rule. This is a major discovery, because it is a singularity bewteen opposing ways of thinking. They may be the only law that science, religion, spirituality and common sense all agree on. Here at the SBYC we have taken it one step further by not only simplifying the concepts, we put this universally recognized law into an equation. We have taken it even further by developing a program that identifies what energy is positive, what is negative and proven method of shifting from one to the other. With this concept we can unify the people of the world and teach our the youth of the world this universal law. 


E x A = C [Energy x Action = Creation]

The question is what energy are you putting in to your life: positive or negative energy?


What you see above is called "The Shift Equation". I am Zo "The Peacemaker" Klimowicz, I created "The Process" to find peace in my life and I have created the SBYC Movement in order to share my message with others. I have successfully used this tool to heal my life and now I teach it to others so that they can live the life they've desired for years. I have taught "The Process" to over 700 people in the last 2 years. If we can agree that this is a law of the Universe then we have accomplished Step One. Step Two is doing something about it, and that is learning to actively "shift". We have found a way to use physics to explain the human condition. This tool, along with the other Soulwurx tools, abide by Universal Laws that teach us how to shift out of negative and into positive energy, thus changing our lives for the better.

My Campaign is important to me because it is my life's purpose to heal, create shift, and serve the world; regardless of peoples' spiritual or non-spiritual preferences. All types of people deserve love and happiness. This campaign is important to the World because there aren't many things that are this simple to understand while being this powerful.

I truly believe this is the formula to World Peace. I've seen it work for people from all walks of life, myself included. Like any formula, once it is perfected, tested and results are proven, the next natural step is marketing and mass distribution, this is the stage Soulwurx is in. The masses we are referring to are today's youth, the future of our world.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

For a full crew to put on a single event costs approximately $300 for gas, food, travel, electronic equipment, video, camera man etc. This is a very small budget for 4 people to put on a presentation, but it is enough to make a difference and get the job done!

When you donate, you are "paying it forward" and allowing us to go to a new location and spread our message, and you are getting the same education and training those individuals are getting. Its a win-win-win for the people we will be reaching, for our movement, and for yourself.

We are confident our goal will be met or exceeded since you are so awesome and our message is so simple and powerful! We will use any funds raised to go to as many locations as possible. So if we raise $3000, we can afford to present at 10 locations. $6000, 20 locations. $15,000, 50 schools/ Youth Centers/ Day Cares/ etc.

The Impact

When we can get 1 kid to stop and ask themselves "What is my energy at this moment?" at or before the moment that they create, it could literally mean the difference between life and death, since decisions form our lives. It could mean the difference between running with the wrong crowd or choosing better friends. It could mean the difference between committing a crime or not. It could mean the difference between a life of being lost in the prison system or a life of freedom. This is how important learning to shift is to you, us, and our world.

Everything amazing that man has ever created whether it was a rocket ship, a medical breakthrough or a new world record came from positive energy, basically from some form of Love. Every terrible thing man has ever created whether it was a small skirmish, a war or an atom bomb, has come from negative energy, basically some form of Fear.

This can be changed through awareness, education, tools, practice, etc. At the SBYC Movement we have created this video, written books, created tools, contacted schools and businesses, built the website, designed stickers, tee shirts and wristbands. All we need from you is a donation to share this with the world. We are willing to do the work if you are willing to support us in it.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to assist financially here are still ways you can help:

Ask your business or company if they can make a donation or hire us to do a presentation for your staff.


Share our site, links and facebook pages with others that may be able to assist, get behind us, or plug us into powerful people that can spread this mesage as well.

The most powerful way to support this movement is...SHIFT BEFORE YOU CREATE! Live this message and remind others of it as well. One more decision to shift today leads to one tomorrow. It inspires others to do the same. We are all part of this world, which means even ONE decision affects EVERYONE, whether you see it or not.

Many of us keep believing that world change is being taken care of by someone else, but in the end there is only you, me and us. Our generation has many messes to clean up, and it is up to us to create a new healthy foundation for future generations - its a big job! SBYC is a movement; so it requires movement, action, involvement, and of course, shift.

We have seen what magic and miracles happen when there is shift in our lives, we challenge you to experience it for yourself, and see just how a powerful creator you really are.

story:
Hi. I’m Alex 

We are a little haircare products company with BIG ideas. 

About 3 years ago, I set upon a journey to create a new type of brand that built its products around you. Inspired by the art and science of Cocktail Mixology; everything is custom blended to perfectly suit your individual needs.

From that seed of an idea, our brand was born. And thanks to the generous support of some amazing people, we were able to launch in July last year with a two-week popup shop. 

At that point I vowed to do everything in my power to make our brand a reality... 

We’ve achieved so much already. However, to keep the idea alive and to get our little company to the next level, we really do need your support. And that’s why we put together this campaign. With your help we can keep ‘concocting’ and keep innovating. 

We can’t do it without you....

OUR FIRST INNOVATION - WORLD'S FIRST 'SHAMPYOU'

The 'Tom Cruise' of the Haircare world has arrived. A range of luxury shampoos that you get to customise - Mixology SHAMPYOU. One size fits all shampoo is off the menu. You'll get to experience it as part of the supporter packages on offer here...

TESTIMONIALS - What people really think of our products...

Ambarina Hassan - Beauty Passionista

"The results are incredible – soft, shiny, silky hair. And both the shampoo and conditioner smell ah-maze-ing!"

Kate Price - Beauty and the Launch

"Concoction gave my hair phenomenal shine, volume and texture. My locks look and feel stronger, fuller and healthier." 

Beauty Geek - Sascha Taylor Curtis

"I’m a real fan of this range from Concoction, and I hope to see more additions to their range in the very near future."  

Blog Me Beautiful

"The products are really gorgeous and I've really enjoyed using them. The fragrances are amazing and the high-end products mean you need only a small amount to get a good lather going!"

Chloe Pierre Blog

"My hair felt great and my scalp definitely took well to the shampoo. The feeling of a fresh and breathable scalp was evident after two applications of the product during my weekly wash.”

Bella Blissett - YOU Magazine

"A week after using Concoction, my dry, bleached hair had bounce, root-lift and shine."

VOGUE - September 2013

"Perfect for frazzled, lacklustre hair."

Cosmopolitan - Cassie Powney

"It smelt great, lathered up nicely and definitely gave me a good curl day."

Get The Gloss - Expert Health and Beauty

"The ‘Tom Cruise’ of the haircare world has arrived; one size fits all shampoo is off the menu. The end result is a prescriptive, bespoke beauty experience and shiny, happy hair!"

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Please see the FAQ's guide which is located within the GALLERY tab at the top of this page. Scroll down to FILES and you will see it there. Please get in touch if you have any additional questions.

NO ANIMAL TESTING

Here at Concoction, none of our products are tested on Animals.   

DELIVERY & YOUR CHOICES

All the supporter packages above include express courier delivery to UK addresses. Just before your goods are dispatched, we'll be in touch to find out which fragrances and shots you have chosen.

INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING

We can ship to over 200 countries and we appreciate the support we receive from supporters all over the globe. We've shopped around for the best international shipping rates. Please see our International Shipping guide located within the GALLERY tab at the top of this page. Scroll down to FILES and you will see it there.

CONTACT US

You can contact us right here at the Mixology Lab. You can tweet us here @concoctions or email hello@concoction.me

Find us on FACEBOOK

We'd love to hear from you!

Thank you for supporting us!!!

story:
Short Summary 

My name is Jennifer Joi, I'm a fashion designer & aspiring business owner! I have a passion for children & making them feel special! I am the owner of Sweetie's Shop which is a small business where I make clothes & accessories for children especially little girls! Sweetie's Shop is named after 2 pod my biggest supporters my grandparents Joe & Ruth who affectionately call each other Sweetie! 

This campaign is important to me because I am chasing my dreams & with your support I know I can open the doors of Sweetie's Shop into a go to place for every little girl & little girls at heart! 

Your contributions will go to helping to turn my dream into a reality by making it possible  for me to have not only all the supplies I need but be able to rent a space where my creativity can flow!!! 

What I Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

I need $10,000 to make Sweetie's Shop a reality! To rent a space, furnish it & the supplies needed to make it successful! 

YOU DON'T JUST GIVE, YOU'LL GET IN RETURN!!! 

each donation of $25 or more will receive a thank you item! Every donation no matter how small will get a thank you & social media shout out!

If the entire amount of $10,000 is not reached your contribution will still be used to mourn dreams into reality, it will just take a little longer to get the doors open!!! 

$25 donation - Sweetie's Shop supporter tee

$50 donation - Sweetie'sbShop supporter hoodie

$75 donation - Sweetie's Shop supporter tee & hoodie 

$100 donation - Sweetie's Shop supporter custom tee &hoodie 

$500 donation - Sweetie's Shop supporter custom tee, hoodie & 25% off all purchases for a year

Donations of $1000 or more will be given VIP treatment at Sweetie's Shop & be given 40% off purchases for a year Or the option for a free party for 8 Girls! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

The aim of HOPE FOR HEIDI is to do exactly that - Give hope to a woman that has been put through hell through the negligence of certain medical professionals and various Hospitals/Clinics.

Heidi has one kidney.

What makes this story different from all the others?

Heidi lost a kidney in her early childhood,but it was never detected.After a medical professional detected kidney stones later in 2006,Heidi being a strong woman,took it as something to overcome as a part of her daily life,but then they saw the severity of the kidney issue,yet nothing was done.Nobody informed her of what needed to be done.

At this stage she had 98% functionality left on the remaining kidney.

It was clear the dead kidney needed to be removed or it will cause issues and damage the remaining kidney.Still nothing was done due to negligence and lack of communication.As the years progressed this caused inexplicaple pain and health issues.

The dead kidney was only removed in 2010 with certain Dr.'s still questioning the validity of the case and the existence of the issues. 

After all of this the Dr.'s made no attempts to save the remaining kidney.

(Dr.'s refused to remove it even after numerous professionals advised to get it removed.Before it was removed experimental treatment was doen to see if it could be revived)

Later on in 2012 a scan was done....10% functioanlity in the remaining kidney with a bleak outlook.

A creatine count over 700.

Very coldly and bluntly she was told that she is "too old to save" and they refused to do further tests or take blood for tests - the reason the Dr. gave? - "I know the outcome and know the case,no need to do anymore tests"

At this point she was told to "make friends" with someone in the Government or if she had a friend in Government employement to get her on their Medical Aid as it is the only hope she has (that would be FRAUD!)

She was broken..

Medical Professionals are telling her to give up or commit fraud at 49.

This is who Heidi is :

A loving single mother of 3..

A loving grandmother..

A person with unbreakable faith..

Through her constant pain Heidi refuses to sit at home - She is a full time nursery school teacher and works hard for her money.Unfortunaly it is not enough for private dyalysis or a qualifying and proper medical aid.

And even then she gives to others and shares what she has without hesitation.

This prompted her son to contact the Minister of Health and pushed for a resolution.

After Dr.'s threatening him with legal action if he goes public and calling the alligations heresay,he went to the local news papers.

After media coverage of the story,only one of the Hospitals involved in this story,offered to help and the Dr.'s that made unprofessional and cold remarks were rebuked for their indiscretions.The other Hospitals refuse to reply to any communication.

FINALLY,Heidi has since received help from the main hospital in question.They are going to be doing tests and WILL put her on the Dyalysis list if she needs treatment,AND if she can improve the functioanlity of her kidney,she might be elligable for a transplant!

So far new tests have shown a drop in her creatine levels and other hopefull signs - and these tests and remarks have been done/made by the same Dr.'s that told her to "get your affairs in order" and "you're too old too save".

She is busy trying to get fit again,as they long periods of rest and healing and hospital stays have left her unfit and in need of exersize

So today Heid is working hard to prove the Dr.'s wrong.

She is a wonderful human being and if you had to meet her,even with everything she is going through and has gone through,you NEVER see her without a smile on her face.

Ps. The profile Picture is of just ONE of the multiple scars she has due to operations and procedures doen through the years...

Help us give some HOPE to HEIDI 

Regards.

HOPE FOR HEIDI

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds we are trying to raise is to pay for anything Heidi might need:

Tests

Medication

Specialists

And of course - We want to try and kill the Debt Heidi had to make during the last couple of years -When she had to take leave,procedures etc.

All we can realy offer are "gifts" of gratitude and the knowledge that you are helping an amazing human being getting her life back and moving forward.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word and tell others about Heidi and her story!

Prayers are always welcome!

Medication
Specialists
And of course - We want to try and kill the Debt Heidi had to make during the last couple of years -When she had to take leave,procedures etc.
All we can realy offer are "gifts" of gratitude and the knowledge that you are helping an amazing human being getting her life back and moving forward.


 


Other Ways You Can Help

Prayers are always welcome!

story:
Our farm and our house are in jeopardy.  The farm has been in the family for one hundred years.  The house since 1932.  Five generations of the family have lived in this house.  Right now, we've got a one time expense that could make us lose all that. Our farm accounts for a third of our family's income, and almost all of our firewood for heating our 19th century home.   We also have a small family owned business, which you can see at www.wolframswonderouswares.com. which we have been running since 1979.  If you have been to a Renaissance Faire or an SCA event, you may have seen us.   We are hoping that many of the people who know us or have purchased our items over the years will take a moment and help us out in our time of need so we can keep our family going.


Right now myself, my husband and two children live in the house and count on the farm for a significant percentage of our livelihood.  We also have items up on ebay at http://www.ebay.com/sch/jolynn2008/m.html?item=261370456796&rt=nc&_trksid=p2047675.l2562  and sell items on our website  www.wolframswonderouswares.com   Please feel free to look and see what we do.  Also no donation is too small.  Ultimately we'd prefer to sell items to make this shortfall up, but we are at a point where we don't think it's possible, and we appreciate this helping hand up.  


For $10 you will have our eternal thanks and a handwritten note expressing our gratitude.  For $25 I will hand make a leather rose for you.  For $50, we will send you a mystery gift from our store stock.  For $125 I will make you a lovely leather pouch in brown or black.   Or you can have a sterling and garnet ring.  And for those of you who can, for $250 you will get three of these items (A rose, pouch and mystery gift).  And for $400 a dozen mixed color leather roses. Please consider helping us.  So many people are just one small problem away from catastrophe, and just think what a small amount from you might do for us.  Thank you very much for taking the time to look at our campaign.

story:
Save the Griffintown Horse Palace (details in English below)

La mission de la Fondation

La Fondation du Horse Palace de Griffintown est une organisation à but non lucratif qui a pour mandat:

  • de sauvegarder et de mettre en valeur le Horse Palace de Griffintown 
  • d'ouvrir celui-ci au public en vue de réintégrer le cheval dans la culture et l’histoire montréalaises
  • d’offrir aux Montréalais et aux touristes un endroit où il est possible d’admirer les chevaux et de prendre connaissance de leurs liens avec les traces du Montréal industriel et de l’histoire de la classe ouvrière montréalaise.

La Fondation du Horse Palace de Griffintown compte dans son conseil d'administration des spécialistes en histoire, en droit, en architecture et architecture de paysage et des passionnés du patrimoine bâti et des chevaux.

Une de ses dernières réalisations importantes consiste en la mise en valeur d'un terrain en friche sous forme d'un enclos permettant aux chevaux de profiter d'un espace plus vaste afin de se promener et de se reposer.

Avant: Vue du terrain avant du Horse Palace avant la construction de l'enclos en 2012

Après: Vue aujourd'hui avec l'enclos et son aménagement.

Le projet de reconstruction

Initialement, la Fondation désirait préserver les écuries actuelles et effectuer des travaux afin de sécuriser le bâtiment. Il s’avère cependant que le bâtiment n’a pas de fondations, et que sa charpente menace de s’écrouler.  Afin de pouvoir couler une fondation en béton adéquate, il a été décidé de procéder à une reconstruction de l'écurie plutôt qu'à sa restauration. Cette décision permettra notamment d'adapter le bâtiment aux normes en vigueur, ce qui le rendra plus sécuritaire et mieux adapté aux besoins des chevaux.

Bien que le bâtiment soit un témoin de l'histoire, dans le cas présent, c'est surtout l'usage continu depuis plus de 150 ans qui caractérise le site. La préservation du lieu, mais avant tout de sa vocation équestre, permettra de souligner le passé historique du quartier tout en le gardant vivant et ouvert aux visiteurs.
La Fondation a l'intention de réutiliser tous les éléments récupérables et de garder certaines sections intègres comme témoins uniques de l’assemblage en bois tenon et mortaise d'origine pré-industrielle. Afin de conserver intact l'aménagement en fond de cour typique du Horse Palace, exemple unique dans le cadre urbain de Montréal de la disposition des fermes à l'époque coloniale, les bâtiments reconstruits auront les mêmes volumes et emplacement que ceux qu'ils sont destinés à remplacer.

Objectif 2015

Le temps presse: l'écurie est en très mauvais état et des interventions temporaires empêchent son effondrement. L'objectif de cette grande campagne de financement est d'amasser les fonds suffisants pour reconstruire l'écurie à compter du printemps prochain. Si jamais, pour des raisons de sécurité, les chevaux devaient quitter le site pour cause de risque à la sécurité et ce pour plus de six mois, le droit acquis d'y avoir des chevaux serait perdu en vertu de la réglementation municipale; il ne serait plus jamais possible de garder le lieux vivant en y accueillant ces magnifiques bêtes. L'ensemble des coûts de reconstruction pour la nouvelle écurie a été évalué à environ 180 000$. D'autres sources de financement s’ajouteront à la levée de fond pour permettre d’atteindre l’objectif financier.

DÉTAIL BUDGÉTAIRE  

    180 000 $ (coût approximatif du projet de reconstruction de l'écurie)

-   100 000 $ (apport de certains promoteurs de Griffintown et donateurs privés)

-     35 000 $ (montant mis de côté pour la Fondation à la Fondation du Grand     Montréal)

-     45 000 $ (montant devant être amassé par la campagne Indiegogo)

Les contreparties présentées ici sont des façons de vous remercier pour votre aide envers la cause. Nous sommes certains que vous trouverez une contrepartie à la hauteur de votre générosité!


L'impact


La sauvegarde du Horse Palace grâce à ce projet de reconstruction aura plusieurs retombées positives dont: 

  • La mise en valeur d'un lieu unique au pays et chargé d'histoire.
  • L'offre unique aux résidents de Griffintown, aux Montréalais et aux touristes d'un contact privilégié avec les chevaux dans un cadre urbain.
  • La réalisation des objectifs du Programme Particulier d'Urbanisme (PPU) de Griffintown concernant la mise en valeur du site du Horse Palace et la constitution d'un Corridor culturel sur la rue Ottawa.


    D'autres façons d'aider

    • Faire passer le mot pour faire connaître le projet de sauvegarde du Horse Palace de Griffintown
    • Partager cette page Indiegogo dans vos réseaux, que cela soit par courriel, Facebook ou Twitter !
    **Venez célébrer avec nous la fin de la campagne le  2 octobre à compter de 17hres au Horse Palace! 75$ le billet, tous le profits iront à la reconstruction des écuries! https://www.facebook.com/events/1513733162195906/**
    _____________________________________________________________________________

    Save the Griffintown Horse Palace!

    Help us preserve one of the oldest working urban stables in North America!

    Our mission

    The Griffintown Horse Palace Foundation is a non-profit organization. Our mandate aims to:

    -  Preserve and restore the stables of the Griffintown Horse Palace

    -  Open the site to the public and reintegrate the horse into the culture and history of Montreal

    -  To offer Montrealers and tourists a space to connect with horses and discover Montreal’s industrial and working class history.

    The board of the Griffintown Horse Palace brings together members of diverse backgrounds such as history, law, architecture, landscape architecture, who all share a common passion for Montreal’s rich cultural heritage and for horses.

    One of the last achievements of the Foundation was the construction of a paddock for the horses of the Horse Palace on the neighboring abandoned plot of land. 

    Our project


    Originally, the Foundation was seeking to maintain the stables as they are now, and only secure the building. However, the building is not built on proper foundations and the roof is threatening to collapse any day. In order to build a concrete foundation for the stables, it has been decided that, instead of being restored, the building will be reconstructed and refurbished to better uphold the security standards and norms, and improve the well-being of the horses. 

    The building itself may be a witness to history, but it is actually the continuous use of the site for over 150 years, and especially the presence of the horses, that is best suited to maintain the neighbourhood’s heritage. 

    The Foundation is hoping to recycle materials, and even incorporate sections of the existing buildings, as samples of the unique pre-industrial construction technique in mortise and tenon joints. In order to preserve the layout of the Horse Palace, as the last remaining example in Montreal of that found ina typical colonial farm, the reconstructed buildings will be assembled in the same space and with the same dimensions as the existing constructions.

    Our objective

    The preservation of the Horse Palace is urgent! The stables are in a dire condition, and temporary fix-ups are currently preventing its collapse. Our objective, with this large-scale fundraising campaign, is to raise enough money to start rebuilding the stables by next spring. If the horses and their owner were to leave the site because of safety reasons for over six months, the vested right to host horses would be lost: the Horse Palace’s life would be extinguished with them.

    The total costs of rebuilding a new stable have been estimated at $180.000. Other funding programs should allow us to reach our goal.

    BUDGET DETAILS
    $180.000 (estimated cost of the reconstruction of the stables)
    - $100.000 (financial support of Griffintown real estate promoters and private donors)
    - $35.000 (amount on hold by the Fondation du Grand Montréal)
    - $45.000 (amount that we hope to raise with your help through the Indiegogo campaign)

    We are offering the perks listed to thank you for your generosity towards our cause!

    The Impact


    The preservation of the Horse Palace through its reconstruction will bring so much!

    -  The restoration of a historical site that is unique in Canada

    -  The integration of the urban horse within Griffintown, to the delight of Griffintown residents, Montrealers, and tourists 

    -  Reaching the objectives of the Griffintown SPP (Special Planning Programs)

    -   The development of the Horse Palace and the creation of a Cultural Corridor on Ottawa Street.


    Other ways to help

    -  Spread the word about this fundraising campaign to help save the Griffintown Horse Palace! 

    -  Share this Indiegogo page, through email, Facebook or Twitter!

    **Come celebrate with us the end of the campaign october 2nd at 5pm at the Horse Palace! 75$/ Ticket, all the funds that are raised go directly to the to the reconstruction of the stable! https://www.facebook.com/events/151373316219590...

story:
“Ever since I can remember there have been people suggesting that it was time for "someone" to gather together all the drum corps memorabilia that was floating around or being discarded, for proper preservation and possible establishment of a drum corps museum displaying the artifacts that are the history of our activity. Everyone making this suggestion was sincere and well-intentioned, but what was usually said was "somebody" should get moving on this project. Until now we didn't have that "somebody," but now we do...Dennis Cole. Dennis has been working, mostly off the radar of most of us, to begin the process of assembling a comprehensive collection of items related to anything and everything connected to the history of drum and bugle corps activity. I believe it is a project that most of us support, but as is the case with most anything in drum corps, we have seen too many people with big dreams come and go; so our trust is now something that has to be earned with an intelligently conceived plan and the credentials to move that plan to fruition. Dennis has demonstrated his long-term commitment, and he has poured a great deal of time and effort into development of plans, both short term and long term, that I believe will lead to the goal we would all like to see accomplished. What has been lacking previously is someone with the ability, the background, the experience, and the vision necessary to lead the way. I have met with Dennis and have had the opportunity for a number of in-depth conversations. I am convinced that Dennis is the right man at the right time with the right ideas. I urge everyone who is of like mind to offer your support.”

Dave Shaw,

Holy Name Cadets Drum and Bugle Corps, Member 1950-1958

Garfield Cadets Drum and Bugle Corps, Staff 1959-1962, 1970-1971

Troopers Drum and Bugle Corps, Staff 1965-1970

________________________________________________________________________

 

The Drum Corps Heritage Society, Inc. (DCHS) is the most comprehensive thematic repository of materials related to the history of the North American drum and bugle corps. The mission of the DCHS is to collect, preserve and provide access to these resources for scholars, educators, students, journalists, and the general public in an effort to broaden the awareness and understanding of the drum and bugle corps, its historical roots and evolution, and its impact in the larger history and cultural fabric of North American music.

In time, The DCHS Collection will constitute the largest individual holding of historical records related to the history of the North American drum and bugle corps activity. Our collections (all donated from private collectors) will hold distinct relations with all individual drum and bugle corps (junior, senior, alumni, all-age, combination and military corps); instrument and equipment manufacturing companies; corporate sponsors and promoters; drum corps associations; and competitive contest governance organizations, including (but not limited to): the United States military, The American Legion , The Veterans of Foreign Wars, The Catholic Youth Organization, The Boys Scouts of America, The Police Athletic League, Drum Corps International, Drum Corps Associates, Winter Guard International, Drum Corps World, The U.S. Open, The National Dream, Canadian Drum Corps Association, Ontario Drum Corps Association, World Drum Corps Hall of Fame, among others.

The DCHS is committed to providing public access to its collection through an online, digital repository. To do so, the DCHS has initiated this initial fundraising platform to generate enough funding to create the proper website and multimedia studio needed for collection management of and public access to the DCHS Collection. All revenue collected will be allocated for internal operations as related to the accredited standards for collection development, storage and preservation, and public access.

Keep in mind, your contributions and support will allow the DCHS to project towards its long-term goal of building a permanent ‘brick-and-mortar” museum and archives, alongside its traveling multimedia exhibits. Beyond the public display of its collections, the DCHS strives to broaden its educational mission by participating in professional conferences, and by conducting interdisciplinary oral history research centered on “Alan Lomax-style” personal interviews, conversations and the documentation of collective memory of past and present drum and bugle corps participants.

To achieve its goals, the Drum Corps Heritage Society is seeking financial contributions in the total amount of $15,000. Your contributions will be immediately put into action, as the DCHS seeks to launch its website with secure access to its collections by August 2013. Likewise, the DCHS is planning its first major public exhibition of its collection at the 2013 Drum Corps International (DCI) World Championships in Indianapolis, the second week of August (2013).

Your contributions will allow the DCHS to safely transport, store and display its collections professionally throughout DCI Championship Week. Once in Indianapolis, the DCHS can build upon its initial financial success through the sale of merchandise generated through this preliminary financial campaign.

 

The following details the DCHS Short-Term Financial Action Plan for utilizing contribution raised through this initial campaign:

$4,500             Administrative & Legal Start-up

 

$5,500             Online Digital Repository Equipment

Design & Launch DCHS Website with embedded digital archive

Multimedia Studio with Audio-Video Playback & Migration Equipment; Analogue & Digital Storage

 

$2,000             Preliminary Traveling Exhibition & Preservation Equipment

Archival Supplies: Archival Boxes & Folders, Document Storage, & Encapsulation Supplies

Environmental, Humidity & Temperature Controls: Conservation Supplies & Repair Tools

Specialty Storage: Miscellaneous Collectibles & Ephemera: Artifact Storage & Textile Supplies

Exhibition Cases: Poster Displays, Dress Forms & Hanging Racks

 

$3,000             Merchandise Start-up

 

Please take time to scroll through a few photographs which have been uploaded. This pictures detail the kinds of materials that have already been donated to the Drum Corps Heritage Society. Since June 2012, the DCHS has received 18 individual private donations, when combined total over 65 cubic feet of historical material. The DCHS Collection now has numerous audio & video materials, with original photographs that date back to 1939. Beyond the print and audio/video materials, the DCHS Collection contains a variety of 3-D objects and ephemera, including uniforms, instruments, flags, buttons, patches, pennants, dolls and trophies (among others).

story:
Remember Anon?

Have you ever felt like you just couldn't take it anymore? 

Anon, A.K.A Amy, wrote into Ask Moxie seeking advice. A divorced mother of three, Amy was suffering. Her ex-husband announced that, contrary to their divorce agreement, he would not be taking the kids for the summer. Her 6-year-old daughter was acting out, hurting from her dad's rejection. Amy couldn't get any breaks - her local support network wasn't stepping up, and she couldn't make enough money working to afford childcare for 2.5-year-old twins and an angry 6-year-old.

We can provide more than advice.

Many people responded to Amy's plea for advice saying that they wished they could help, that they wished she lived close enough that they could step in and provide her the break she needed. We may not be Amy's neighbors, but we can be her support network if we pull together. Let's provide Amy with money for one month of childcare.

What we can do:

We want to raise $2500 to allow Amy one month of childcare:

  • Average childcare cost for kids under age 3 in the Atlanta area is $1000/month. $2000 will cover one month of childcare for the 2.5 year old twins, with $500 for childcare for the 6-year-old.
  • Magda from Ask Moxie and Julia from Mom Meet Mom will reach out to the Care.com team to find age-appropriate child care that is best suited to Amy's needs.
  • Even small donations help - if 100 people donate $25 each, we can achieve our goal!

What you get:

Remember that post about responding to the tug? Imagine how motivated people will be to help, even in small ways, seeing the example we set. Plus, Julia will write you a thank-you note!

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has money to spare, and that's totally okay. There are other ways you can help!

  • Share the link to this campaign.
  • Be kind to the parents you know - reach out if you know someone is hurting.
  • Don't be afraid to ask for help if you need it!

story:
Noisebridge is an award winning educational 501(c)(3) non-profit, and one of the most renowned hacker workspaces in the world.  This summer we're updating and improving our infrastructure -- and we need your help to make that happen!

Established in 2007, Noisebridge has been a welcoming hacker workspace in the Mission District of San Francisco for both the local and national hacker community, as well as hosting hackers from all around the world.

Our philosophy is simple: Be Excellent to each other. 

Noisebridge lives up to this credo by providing the workspace, access to tools, mentoring, and education that changes peoples lives. 3D printing, coding, science, art, music, robotics, neurohacking, biohacking, and much much more.  

We provide free classes to hundreds of attendees per week and welcome everyone to come hack on whatever interests them.  Our hackerspace has become not only a techie hangout, but an invaluable community educational and networking hub -- not to mention a popular exit node on the Tor Network.

Six Years of Hacking, 0 Days off.

On July 1st, for the first time in 7 years, we closed Noisebridge to all visitors to make a new beginning -- to turn the crisis of potential city scrutiny into an opportunity to reinvigorate the entire hackerspace.

We discovered about 5 Noisebridges worth of cruft compressed into one Noisebridge.  Literal tons of E-waste turned into several trips to the dump, donations a-plenty to our E-waste recycler, and heaps left over for our hack shelves.

Meanwhile, our tireless electricians have been fixing up old wiring and installing some improvements too.  Certainly, this month of downtime brings us fully up to code and proves our long-term commitment to safety and good infrastructure.

But even more, the Reboot process gives Noisebridge a fresh start in many ways. It's like packing up Noisebridge so we can move into a brand new Noisebridge.

With the walls cleared away, we're letting light and art in:


Soon we'll repair our most beloved tools and devices, like the laser cutter, makerbots, and shop tools.


We're making improvements to our ability to host events (and even held one during all of this chaos -- thank you, DorkbotSF!), including a new audio/video workspace to continue our critically acclaimed monthly event, 5 Minutes of Fame.'


All remaining funds will be, as always, used for community and educational outreach programs benefiting the students and underprivileged in our local community. It is our mission to share the joy of inventing, discovering, and making with those who don't yet realize they can. We know they can.

Please contribute what you can, and let your friends know about what we are doing. Come by and see us and what we do. Thank you for your help and, by all means, be excellent to each other!

We Have the FAQs and We're Consensing on YES.

Q: What's the money specifically for?

A: Roughly $15k is dedicated to electrical and building refits that will keep the city of San Francisco from finding a reason to shut us down.  We're paying C-10 certified electricians to do most of the electrical work and taking care of everything else ourselves. We're getting the professional electrical work at a decent non-profit rate, and the peace of mind that comes from laying down a solid and safe infrastructure rubber-stamped by the city will be priceless.

The remaining money will be allocated variously to more outwardly awesome stuff, like replacing parts in our MakerBots, producing the reward levels we're promising, building a dedicated A/V area in our space, reinstating our famous Red Phone, fixing our laser cutter, and lots of other devious plans to take over our hackerspace.

Q: Where can I ask more questions?

A: Put a comment on this campaign and we'll put the answer here ASAP!

story:
My name is Paul Swaney, and I am one of the founders, and the President of Stadium Journey LLC. We run StadiumJourney.com, Stadium Journey Magazine, and other Stadium Journey publications such as our recent Pro Football Cookbook.

We formed Stadium Journey in July 2009, and our current website look and feel has been around since April, 2010. The website has served us well, but there are several functionality upgrades that we need to make to improve our resource for sports fans and stadium travelers.

We have been very successful in creating stadium-related content, with full reviews of nearly 2,000 different stadiums in 41 countries around the world. I personally eat, breathe, and sleep Stadium Journey. And we have more than 100 writers who do a fabulous job of collecting information for our readers, so that sports fans can make the most out of their next trip to a live sporting event.

This fundraising effort will result in a total overhaul of our Stadium Journey website, and take us to a new level with greater functionality and agility for us to make changes in the future.

With a successful campaign, we will be able to continue our efforts, and improve the user experience of StadiumJourney.com. 

What We Need & What You Get

We have tried for the past 5 years to "shoe-string" our efforts to make a website that is functional, useful, and easy for people to utilize. However, it is clear that we need to hire a professional design and development firm to really take us to the next level.

100% of the funding will go to the firm that we have selected. Specific upgrades will include:

-New user profiles with the ability to log your visits to various stadiums

-A points system whereby users will earn rewards based on their stadium travel activity. Points will be redeemable for free or discounted tickets, hotels, restaurants, and more!

-Better mobile optimization for users of Stadium Journey while in a stadium

Other user experience improvements including re-designed menu structure, condensed travel guides, and more!

As a contributor, you will be entitled to various Stadium Journey swag, including magazine subscriptions, our cookbook, t-shirts, sweatshirts, and coffee mugs. Most of all, you will be helping to make a good resource truly great, and help us reach our goal of being the preeminent destination for sports travelers.

If we don't reach our ultimate fundraising goal, we still plan to embark on the work described, but we'll have to prioritize based on what our budget provides.

The Impact

Attending a live sporting event can be expensive. The goal of our work is to help inform sports fans before they go to a game on how to make their trip to a game the best it can possibly be. We provide recommendations on where to sit, what to eat, what attractions to see, where to stay and where to go before or after the game.

We have a lot of fun doing this work, but we also take it very seriously. We need to have a website that allows us to share our resource in the best way possible, and these funds will allow us to do so.

    Risks & Challenges

    There are no guarantees in life, and the old adage from Field of Dreams of "if you build it, they will come," may or may not be true. We may do these upgrades, and find that there is no impact on our traffic. In the end, we are making these changes because we believe that a better website will result in more traffic. More traffic means more revenue. More revenue, means we can do our work even better, which ultimately means sports fans will have better information to improve their sports experiences.

    All I can tell you is that I have been personally committed to this endeavor for 5 years, and I will continue to tenaciously pursue the goal of being the best resource possible. I believe this is the next step in our evolution.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Any amount, even the minimum amount helps us reach our goal. But if you cannot contribute, it is also extremely helpful to help share this campaign with your family, friends, and social networks. Helping to get the word out is very much appreciated. Thanks for your time, help, and consideration!

story:
What is required is a flagship designer store to showcase our designer collection.
Suitable premises have been found in Paris open the store.
This is your chance to invest in our brand.
If the style of clothes and wristwatches I have designed are your style, then join me in my venture.
Various incentives are on offer:
There will be an annual fashion show which I will host and to which all investors will be invited. I look forward to welcoming you.

Many designers have written about the inspiration behind their designs or signature style, we believe that your style should enhance your personality, be practical, comfortable and most of all yours.
style is not only about what clothes you buy, but more so about how you wear them.
to be comfortable in your skin and your suit is to be confident and so we share with you our signature style,
make it your own.
Designer Group

New Collection 2015

Choose Your Suit.
only €50 and have a designer suit worth between €499-€1,999 in our flagship store when it opens.
All are made of the most luxurious material. Available in all sizes. All hand-made in Italy. Order yours now quoting the reference number and your size. www.latifyahiadesign.com/suits

New Collection 2015

Choose Your cufflinks.
only €20 and have a cufflinks worth between €299 to €1,799 in our Store when is open All yellow gold and white gold 18K and some with diamond.
all made in Italy and France. www.latifyahiadesign.com/cufflinks

New Collection 2015

Choose Your shoes
only €50 and have a shoes worth between €299 to €999 in our Store when is open (Most luxurious material) 100% leather all sizes available.
all handmade made in Italy and France. www.latifyahiadesign.com/shoes

New Collection 2015

Choose Your Coat.

only €50 and have a designer coat worth between €599-€2,999 in our flagship store when it opens.

All are made of 100% leather or 100% cashmere. Available in all sizes. All hand-made in Italy.
Order yours now quoting the reference number and your size.

www.latifyahiadesign.com/coats


New Collection 2015

Choose A Hand-Bag.
only €60 and have a hand-bag worth between €599-€1,999 in our flagship store when it opens.
All are made of the finest leather.
All are hand-made in Italy and France.
Order yours now quoting the reference number. www.latifyahiadesign.com/womens-bags


New Collection 2015

Choose Your Watch.
only €60 and have a watch worth between €599-€3,999 in our flagship store when it opens.
The watches are made of 18K yellow or white gold and are made in Switzerland.
Order your now quoting the reference number. www.latifyahiadesign.com/watches.
