story:
“Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food”

-Hippocrates 

Food and Photographs by Hannah Pearl Warner

My name is Hannah Pearl and I would like to attend the Natural Chef Culinary Program at Bauman College in Berkeley, CA.

Though my desire to become a Chef and Nutritional Consultant has become clearer in the past few years, I've long had a flare for cooking and creating healthy, beautiful recipes. I draw enormous joy from preparing meals for other people, being certain to engage all senses in their presentation. First and foremost: we eat with our eyes! I am incredibly passionate about building a career, and am going to do all that I can to make it happen. I have the talent, the passion, a vision, and a plan! This campaign is a way of reaching out in hope that, with some support, that vision can become a reality. 

My Journey To Clean Eating 

In 2008, after years of various, painful symptoms, doctor's visits, and exploratory surgery I was diagnosed with an autoimmune disorder of the small intestine called Celiac Disease.  In Layman’s Terms: No gluten. In 2008 going gluten-free wasn’t particularly popular ("what's gluten?"); this forced me to become creative with my cooking. What a blessing in disguise!

Removing gluten from my diet helped significantly, but I still experienced constant pain throughout my body, and a lot of digestive distress. I was eventually diagnosed with Fibromyalgia, a sort of umbrella term of a chronic pain disorder. Now, don't get me wrong, I do think that western medicine can be an amazing tool. But, pain medications don't fix things, they mask them, and I was tired of that and wanted out. It was time for me to search for a different approach. 

Fast forward through lots of ups and downs...

Today

“A wise man should consider that health is the greatest of human blessings, and learn how by his own thought to derive benefit from his illnesses.”  - Hippocrates 

Through discovering my own food sensitivities, and experimenting with my diet I am off of all prescription pain medicine. I treat inflammation by removing dairy, alcohol, sugar and gluten from my diet most of the time. I used herbs and spices like turmeric, ginger and cinnamon to get myself off of painkillers. It’s a constant journey toward health and a healthy lifestyle and I’m enjoying figuring it out —this roller coaster inspired me and instilled a deep desire to provide support to other people with chronic conditions. I want to be a Therapeutic Chef. 

Additionally, I would love to combine my past experience working with children, and study in early childhood development, to work on general nutrition as well as specialized nutrition for children with developmental delays. Specifically in the public schooling system. I have also worked with many teen and young womens groups and programs and would like to offer my knowledge of nutrition and support for helping implement good diet and habits as a part of those groups. I feel that is an invaluable skill to be given as a young person and specifically a young woman. 

I believe in a holistic approach to health, and seek out help from various kinds of healers, but believe that the root of the root is our diets.  It seems only natural that if something is wrong, the first place to look is what is going in our tanks. What are you using to fuel yourself?  I believe in bioindividuality, that there is no one size fits all for human beings. Each of our bodies has different nutritional needs. Bauman will help me learn to identify and nourish the variable needs of any individual. 


The School 

Bauman College emphasizes local, organic, seasonal food. The program is

 5 months - plus a 6-week independent Culinary Externship. 

Natural Chef Curriculum:

  • Culinary Nutrition and Kitchen Basics
  • Food Foundations
  • World Cuisine
  • Midterm
  • Farm to Table
  • Therapeutic Applications
  • Client Services
  • Culinary Showcase
  • Final Presentations
  • Culinary In-House Skill Hours
  • Culinary Externship


" The Natural Chef Training Program is committed to the development of nutrition-based, therapeutic chefs who are artists in food preparation and presentation. Coursework emphasizes nutritional and therapeutic cooking as well as a mastery of all necessary kitchen skills, including knife skills and ServSafe® requirements for safety and sanitation. In addition to culinary skills, instruction in business development, marketing, and large scale food production will help prepare students for a wide variety of careers upon graduation.

In-house Culinary Skill Hours further hone students' culinary prowess, while an independent Culinary Externship allows students to have hands-on experience in the area of their choice: as a personal chef or caterer, in a natural food restaurant, for a community kitchen, at a retreat center, in a cooking class, and more."

http://www.baumancollege.org/programs/natural-chef


What I Need & What You Get

Here's the break down:

  • The remainder of my tuition is $10,000. If I reach more than expected (dare to dream!) any extra would go to school related costs such as chefs uniforms, supplies, food for presentations and commute.
  • Most if not all "Perks" are home or hand made by me and can be specialized to fit your particular dietary needs, desires or restrictions. 
  • If I don't raise the full 10k I will still move forward in enrollment and continue to find ways to fund the rest of the tuition. I am driven to make this happen!

The Impact 

  • I will gain confidence in not only my abilities as a chef, but as someone with the tools to help heal and support a wide range of clients.
  • Natural Chefs are in great demand as our society realizes and needs guidance toward healthy food, nourishment and lifestyle. 
  • I will become skilled in technical culinary practice. 
  • This program is the launching pad for a future using food as a therapeutic source as well as the precursor to an education in nutritional consulting. 
  • This program will provide me with the tools to build a health-centered career. 



Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some of you can’t contribute. Thank you for taking the time to read anyway, and if you feel so inspired here are some other ways to help:

  • By getting the word out and making some noise about my campaign via email, facebook, twitter, instagram or word of mouth. 
  • Take a look at my tumblr account which features regular pictures of my food, recipes and healing properties of food.  hpearly.tumblr.com
  • By Sending good vibes! Seriously, let's put to use the power of positive thinking! :)
  • Making me a cup of coffee ;)
  • REMEMBER folks... use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
For some of us, Tiffany is just another geocaching lady who comes and goes to various events around the area.

For others, she is a true friend, reliable beyond comparison, and always willing to do whatever it takes to help others.

Recently, after receiving a gigantic water utility bill, she prodded her landlord to examine if there was a water leak nearby.  The landlord never hired anyone to look into the matter.  Tiffany ended up hiring a professional to take a look and fix the problem, if any.

Bad news.  The leak was fairly heavy.

The landlord, fair or unfair, is not required to foot any of the bill.  Having sought relief from the city's utility department, they lowered Tiffany's responsibility to -- $700.

$700 is a lot of money to fork out at once.  Not only does she work her hind end off, but she's also got two teenage boys to take care of.  Earning that sort of money quickly is going to be extremely difficult.

I'm sure some of you are thinking similar things have happened to others -- or even you -- in the past.  No one helped you out.  Besides, it's just helping someone out with a common issue that other folks deal with.  "Ah, c'mon.  It's just the water bill.  She'll pay it and life will be just fine."

I suppose it's the unfairness of the situation that drove me to put this together.  She shouldn't have to put up with this sort of thing.  None of this was her fault.  She was thrust into this situation.

I know we can help out.  I don't think it's too much to ask.  Even little bits ought to add up to our relatively small goal.  Instead of collecting money directly myself, it's easier to gather everything this way.  If you're worried about what charges might be incurred on funds raised, I'm covering that, so don't worry about it.  She will get the full amount raised, whether it's $700 or $200.

If you know Tiffany like I do, there would be no question in your mind as to whether or not you can help her out, just as she's helped out a ton of other folks.  

So please...if you can, just throw a bone her way.  She deserves something good in her life, and she deserves to know people have her back the same way she has ours.

story:
PHASE 1 CONTINUED...SO FAR WE HAVE RAISED $1762 ONLINE...help us reach $25,000

$1 from 1 million people

"GIVE 1NE, GET 1NE"
By donating just $1 and getting someone else to do the same it will help us reach our goal of raising $1,000,000 to help with relief efforts in the Philippines after Typhoon Haiyan.

GIVE 1NE: Phase 1- $25,000

Our goal of $1,000,000 will be implemented in Phases. Phase 1 aims to collect $25,000.

This $25,000 will be allocated to registered Canadian Non Profit Organizations and will also include donations to smaller groups and organizations that need funding to continue their own relief efforts, locally and internationally.

1. $5000 to Global Medic (Focusing on water purification in affected regions)
2. $5000 to UNICEF - (Life-saving essentials and emergency supplies to children affected by the typhoon)
3. $5000 to Doctors Without Borders (Frontline medical services to survivors)
4. $5000 to Canadian Red Cross (Assisting in all aspects of relief efforts after Typhoon Haiyan)
5. $5000 - will be split 50/50 to Ancop and Gawad KalingaFilipino/Canadian Registered Charities that help provide shelter and other assistance and relief efforts to many areas in the Philippines.

HOW YOU CAN HELP...It's really simple :)

Donate $1

Get someone else to do the same

GIVE 1, GET 1

Don't have a dollar right now?? That's OK!!!

SPREAD THE WORD ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN

follow us on twitter, instagram and facebook

#GIVE1NE

Important Things to Know!

What is Give1ne Operation Help Philippines??

Give1ne Operation Help Philippines is a global fundraising campaign that aims to raise $1 from 1 million people worldwide to help with immediate and ongoing relief efforts in the most affected areas of the Philippines following Super Typhoon Haiyan.


How can I donate to Give1ne? Will my donation be matched by the Canadian Government?

You can donate online through www.give1ne.com or visit one of our proud supporting businesses to donate in person. Give1ne is an online crowdfunding campaign that aims to reach millions of people worldwide, we are using a Global Platform (INDIEGOGO.COM) where we can accept donations by credit card and Paypal;

The Canadian government’s deadline for matching contributions ends December 23rd; Any donations made by credit card will take up to 15 days from the end of the campaign to process all funds raised through INDIEGOGO.com; Therefore, ONLY cash donations and donations received through paypal will be available for the matching program as we may not have access to the funds donated by credit card in time for the government matching program (Dec. 23rd).

Give1ne encourage supporters who want to take advantage of government matching program by donating directly to the individual registered Canadian non for profit organizations but still hope that you support our movement by donating $1 and getting another to do the same.


Give1ne also has proud trusted supporting businesses where people can visit to inquire about the campaign and donate in person.

*Supporting businesses list coming soon!


Why are there different phases for Give1ne? What does this mean?

Give1ne is an ongoing campaign that aims to reach 1 million people and we understand that this will take time. By implementing Give1ne in phases it will help us to allocate money as necessary as we reach our goals without waiting until we have reached $1 million. Right now we are in Phase 1 of the Give1ne Operation Help Philippines Campaign. This goal in Phase 1 can be increased at anytime; The different phases also address the different stages we will be implementing this campaign, Local, National and Global.


Where will my $1 go?

Your $1 will be allocated to help provide, food, water, emergency supplies, medication, shelter, and other basic needs. In Phase 1 of Give1ne the $25000 will be allocated as follows:

$5000 to 4 very well known registered Canadian non profit organizations, Red Cross, UNICEF, Global Medic and Doctors Without Borders. The last $5000 will be divided 50/50 between Ancop and Gawad Kalinga; 2 of the biggest and well known registered Canadian-Filipino non for profit charities that directly aim to help Philippines relief efforts and Philippines in general. Phase 2- National Initiative, and Phase 3- Global Initiative will be allocated in the same manner which covers food, water, medication, shelter, emergency supplies and other basic needs however, may not necessarily be to the exact same charities.


Is Give1ne a registered charity?

Give1ne is an online global crowdfunding campaign. We aim to become a registered non for profit organization, this process can take up to 15 months.

Give1ne aims to raise funds for Philippines as soon as possible and we are aware that more people and individuals would be more willing to donate to registered organizations; However, we recognize that applying to become a registered non for profit organization takes time and this campaign's purpose is to raise funds within a certain time period in order to ensure that relief is sent to Philippines sooner than later.


Can I donate more than $1?

Donations greater than $1 are more than welcome and greatly appreciated. We are not a registered non for profit organization. Tax receipts for donations are only provided by registered non profit organization


**Give1ne aims to have the highest level of transparency throughout this campaign so we will be documenting our progress and keep the public up to date.  Furthermore, the website will allow supporters to stay up to date and keep them involved with the campaign as it progresses.

story:
Hello my name is Lalita A. and I am in need of assistance from the community to help save my childhood home from foreclosure. My parents willed the family home to me upon their death so that my daughter and I would have a home to come back to if I fall on hard times.

My mother passed away in 2008 and my dad in 2013. In reading of his will I was named executor of his estate and owner of the family home. My parents took out extra insurance policy that would pay off the mortgage upon their death. Well after my father passed I filed the insurance claim only to find out that their new mortgage lender WF cancelled their insurance without my parents knowledge and now they want to take my family home and the land that has been in my family for over 5 generations.

I have tried working with the mortgage company but they refuse to work with me saying I need to buyout my parents mortgage and start over. I need your help to stop the foreclosure process and keep my child hold home.

If you have it to give please give what you can and if you have a desire to give but do not have it then please pass this message along to others who may be able to help.


Sincerley,


Lalita A.

story:
THE PROJECT

Our goal is to increase access to locally grown fresh food, farm culture, and provide intergenerational agricultural education in a neighborhood challenged with providing fresh, local food for its residents. We are grateful for all the support shown  to our small scale food justice project, and are embarking on growing our impact and service to the community by building our infrastructure and strengthening our resources! 

Year Long Market Stall – We want to make a difference in our community every single day! Help us winterize our market selling area by building new wooden floors, adding thermal plastic enclosures, and including a solar generator that drives our floor heaters. With these additions, our market stall will stay open, and serve customers later into the winter season.

Dimensions: 40ft x 16ft

Total Cost: $10,000

Communication Station – We want to make it as easy as possible for members of our community to learn about market and farm programs that benefit our community and get involved! This new communication center will feature a signup station for customers to learn about the market and farm programs, signup for weekly baskets, create their own smoothies, and purchase promotional items. This will also be the place where healthbuccs  and ebt transactions can be processed. Power will be provided by a solar mini generator.

Dimensions: 12ft x 12ft

Total Cost: $5,000

Food Service Area – One of our favorite parts about gardening is having a chance to enjoy all we’ve grown! This food service area will be the go-to spot for customers to enjoy fresh snacks, socialize with neighbors over a hot cup of herb tea, watch cooking demos, and enjoy other market offerings. This area will be café style, featuring wooden stools and picnic tables for visitors, plus two compartment self-contained sinks (with hot and cold water), that will help us host communal dinner fundraisers in the market.

Dimensions: 20ft x 16ft

Total Cost: $5,000

Outdoor Kitchen Island  – While providing access to fresh fruits, vegetables, and herbs is one of our main goals, we also work with community residents to teach practical ways of preparing healthy produce, and host breadbaking workshops with our clay oven. This kitchen island and counter space will  allow us to expand our bread baking and culinary skill demos. The outdoor kitchen island consists of food prep and grilling areas, storage cupboards, countertops, and a ramp for food to move to and from the storage area.

Dimensions: 10ft x 10ft

Total Cost: $5,000

Who We Are & What We Do

Background: About Us

The Hattie Carthan Garden, Farm, and Community Farmers Market is one of the largest, and longest-running projects led by people of color in NYC. Our garden, urban farm, and two markets are located in Bedford Stuyvesant, Brooklyn – a neighborhood that typically doesn’t have easy access to fresh fruits and vegetables. In the 1970’s, we established our first garden at Lafayette and Marcy Avenue, as a place where low-income residents could have access to green space, expand their knowledge of plants, and grow fresh food in Brooklyn. The garden has remained a multigenerational, multicultural public space ever since.

Since 2003, under the visioning of urban farmer and garden V.P Yonnette Fleming, the Hattie Carthan Community Garden has reinvented itself by combining the old-fashioned community gardening approach with urban agriculture and two community-based markets. The garden now operates a working educational herb farm, a children’s learning garden, two hoop houses, two chicken coops, and three composting systems. Our advocacy and food justice programs help educate a new group of food leaders, while empowering youths and others working within the food system. 

Since 2009, the markets have distributed over 40,000 pounds of fresh, local food to community residents at low, affordable prices. All of this food has been sourced by local farmers operating within 150 miles of the garden.

Background: About Bedford Stuyvesant, Brooklyn

Bedford Stuyvesant is a densely populated and diverse neighborhood in Brooklyn. Like most urban neighborhoods, access to fresh produce is limited, and many live below the poverty line. Although they face challenges, city communities play a huge part in tackling the problems that have long plagued them.

Project History: Accomplishments to Date

·  2009 – Dug by hand, designed community market from abandoned lot

·   Distributed 8,344 pounds of locally grown food  in market

·  Added 45 pullets to farm, introduced animal husbandry studies in youth corps curriculum

·  2011 - Dug by Hand, revitalized abandoned lot converting it into working herb farm

·  Created herbal apothecary on herb farm to help neighbors and gardeners understand preventive health

·  2012 – Recruited, trained, mentored and employed 18 neighborhood youths to learn about growing food and earn stipends while working in our two markets.

·  2013 - Managed 6 tons of community waste diverting organic waste from the landfill.

·  Provided 20 free youth demonstrations to market shoppers in 2 community based markets

Where Your Money Will Go

We are very proud of all we have accomplished so far, BUT it will take a strong network of supporters and resources to help us reach our full potential, and truly make an impact!

·  Market Stall (so we can stay open ALL year!): $10,000

·  Communication Station: $5,000

·  Food Service Area (with outdoor sinks): $5,000

·  Kitchen Island & Arbor: $5,000

Total: $25,000 

Our Community: Our Partners & Supporters 

We are grateful to our supporters who have made all of this possible:

Just Food, Greenthumb NYC, Grow NYC, Green Guerillas, Councilman Al Vann, Mangolia Tree and Earth Center, Citizens Committee for NYC, Noyes Foundation, William and Mary Greve Foundation, Brooklyn community foundation, Partnership for Parks, Con Edison, NY Cares, DOHMH, Why Hunger, Sacharuna Foundation, Once Upon a Time Foundation, our volunteers, our market shoppers, basket program members, and you‼

FAQ

Have a question? Don’t hesitate to reach out! E-mail hattiecarthancommunitymarket.com, or yonfelming@yahoo.com. For more information about who we are, what we do, and our mission, check out our website! Or connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.

Don’t forget to share with friends, family, and anyone else who you think might want to donate, too!

story:
Presentación

Somos dos chicos de Zaragoza que trabajamos en una empresa informática. Para este año tenemos un reto importante que es participar en la carrera benéfica más importante del mundo (Mongol Rally). 

Este rally consiste en hacer el recorrido Zaragoza - Ulán Bátor (Mongolia) en un coche que está a punto de romperse. Nosotros lo vamos a hacer en un Seat Ibiza del ´91.

Aparte de la aventura, queremos hacer algo que se note, dejar nuestro granito de arena para que alguien tenga una vida mejor. Por este motivo, hemos elegido ayudar a unos niños de Kenya. 

Vamos a recaudar dinero para un orfanato que aloja a unos 150 niños y que necesitan de todo: comida, camas, ropa, material escolar, etc. 

Sabemos que no vamos a poder construirles unas instalaciones modernas e higiénicas pero por lo menos intentaremos llenarles un poco la tripica.


¿Qué haremos con el dinero?

Nuestra idea principal era comprarles comida y leche en polvo, pero, hablando con la directora del orfanato, hemos decidido que dentro de nuestras limitaciones, lo mejor sería poder comprarles una vaca que les dé leche día a día. 

Y ¡sí!, nos ha comentado que tienen recursos para mantener una vaca. De hecho, nos ha enviado información con diferentes razas adaptadas al clima de Kenya. 

Ésta, por ejemplo, (http://www.livestockkenya.com/index.php/cattle/300-the-best-tropical-dairy-cows ) da más de 62 litros de leche al día. Esto significa más de 400 ml de leche para cada niño al día.

En el caso de no poder recaudar lo necesario para comprar una vaca, vamos a volver a la primera idea que tuvimos, comprarles leche en polvo y otro tipo de comida (arroz, maíz, judías, etc.). 

¡Tenemos que conseguirlo!


Somos humanos

Sabemos que no es fácil conseguir esta cantidad de dinero, pero también sabemos que gastamos muchísimo en cosas que no necesitamos. Compramos comida y la tiramos, gastamos en ropa que casi ni utilizamos, pagamos 8€ para un gintonic y 15 para una pizza. ¡Somos así!


¿Sabes que si conseguimos recaudar estos 3000€, 150 niños tendrán un vaso de leche cada mañana durante años? Tómate 5 segundos y piénsalo... ¡no es poca cosa!

No, en serio, piénsalo...


    Ayuda con lo que puedas

    No queremos que alguno de vosotros pase hambre por haber hecho un esfuerzo más grande de lo que le permita el bolsillo. Por eso, hemos creado varios tipos de ayudas, para que elijas la que mejor te viene tanto para el bolsillo como para tu estado espiritual.

    En la parte derecha tienes varias opciones para colaborar con nosotros y llevar a cabo este proyecto. Lo bueno es que te puedes llevar cosas muy chulas. jeje

    ¡Muuuuuchas gracias por todo!!!

story:
Kapital Inn is a boutique guesthouse located on the penthouse floor of an elegant 19th century building, in the heart of one of Eastern Europe’s most beautiful cities, Budapest.


It is designed to be your home away from home, with every amenity to make your stay as comfortable as possible. With:

Why People Are Choosing Kapital Inn

•  Rated as the No. 1 B&B in Budapest on Tripadvisor for 6 years running
•  Created and run by a Hungarian trained chef and former executive of a 5-star hotel
•  The entire inn is tastefully decorated with modern and sophisticated interiors
•  24/7 on-site services/advice to meet all our guests sightseeing and personal needs
•  Kapital Inn is an exceptionally comfortable home away from home


"I could go on and on about his attention to detail with each & every guest but suffice it to say, staying at Kapital Inn was the best way to end our wonderful trip to Eastern Europe." – Jane M

"Albert proved to be an excellent host, providing us with suggestions as to what to see and do daily. He even did our laundry at no extra charge on our last day so that we could start our river cruise with clean duds. Awesome!" – Diane K

"While we stayed in some great places during this European vacation, we especially enjoyed Kapital Inn. When you stay here, you are treated like family!" – Larisa K

"The rooms are comfortable, spacious and modern. You can walk to many of the main attractions in Pest and easily connect to public transportation for pretty much anything else." – Steve R

"The owner, Albert, is the best host ever. He gives tips and tricks to avoid tourist traps, he tells funny stories, and he makes great omelettes. He made me and my friend feel like we were staying at a friend's place but with the service of a 5-star-hotel." – Emily G

Read more Tripadvisor reviews.



Albert was born in central Hungary where he studied culinary arts and became a trained chef. After compulsory military service, with a 110 Pounds in his pocket he left Budapest to chase his dreams. He studied English in London, and following a 6-year college detour in the US, he returned to Budapest to work as an executive for a 5-star hotel, while creating Kapital Inn. He thinks you too will enjoy the result. @albert



Kapital Inn is centrally located, and you can easily make your way to many of the beautiful sights by foot or by tram. Budapest is a picturesque city with the majestic Danube River separating the hills of Buda, from the cosmopolitan Pest. Our city is a combination of old and new Europe with eclectic architecture, and an abundance of café, art and entertainment choices, like the opulent Hungarian State Opera house, and the unique Szechenyi thermal baths to name but a few.


For more about Budapest, visit the Funzine website.


Here's a breakdown of the perks you can choose from when you support our campaign. You can select your perk from the sidebar at the top-right of this page.



Terms and conditions: All perk voucher codes are non-transferable and
reservations are subject to room availability. Bookings have to be made at least three months in advance, and must include your voucher code. Perks include all standard B&B amenities as well as breakfast. Our rooms sleep two people only with the exception of the suite, which has two rooms and sleeps four. All aspects of our perks are redeemable within Budapest only. Perks do not include travel or any other costs associated with your trip. Your perks have to be redeemed by December 2015, after which it expires.



We have been working on our expansion project for the past year and we've come a long way. But now we need your help. Your support will allow us to improve our services and increase the number of rooms available at the inn.

We have acquired the neighbouring apartment and are currently about halfway through renovating the new breakfast kitchen. We need another $19 000 US dollars to finish this phase of the project and to also start the next, in which we will be transforming the remainder of the space into an office and a king suite.

So why should you support us?

·  To share and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
·  You enjoy discovering different cultures and exploring unique destinations.
·  You love travelling and have high expectations on service delivery from
   the places you visit.


It doesn’t matter if you cannot contribute financially, you can still help by spreading the word and making some noise. Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your family and friends all about our campaign.

@kapitalinn


kapitalinn.com

story:
Short Summary: I am trying to help this family save their home. My name is Sarah. I am a mother of one young daughter, a wife and a friend to this family. I am trying to help this dear family keep their family home and not become homeless. This is very important to me because there's 3 small children involved! With your help we can help this family keep their home and keep the children safe! This family is on the verge of being homeless! The family has a 6 year old, 8 year old and a 11 year old.

The Story: Their father was diagnosed with CANCER and was and still unable to work. His disability has finally kicked in but the damage has already been done and without help they will never catch up. The family has already lost their family van to the bank so they have to walk everywhere. They had to walk to school in the extreme cold, rain and snow. Thank god warmer weather is almost here! I am trying to help them get caught up on their rent. They pay $850 a month and are 4 months behind. A family friend paid $1000 directly to the landlord leaving a balance of $2400. Once they get caught up they will be able to maintain it, but if they don't get caught up they will be homeless with 3 young children! The next stage would be to help them get a used vehicle for the family but the rent is more important at this time.  Please if you can donate anything to this family even if its just $1 please do. If you can not donate then please spread the word to others. Thank you for your time to read this.

What we need to raise is a minimum of $2400

We need to raise $2400 to pay all of the families back rent. I wish I had some perks to offer but I don't. I know the perk I get is helping this family! The Impact: This campaign is very important to me because there's 3 small children involved that could soon be homeless and they don't deserve that. Other Ways You Can Help: If you can't donate then help by spreading the word and make some noise about my campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

FOR THOSE THAT THINK THIS IS A SCAM YOU CAN CONTACT THE FOLLOWING AND USE THE FOLLOWING CASE# TO VERIFY THE ACCURACY OF THIS:

MCLEAN COUNTY CIRCUIT CLERK

309-888-5301

CASE# 2014LM000222

YOU CAN ALSO SEE IT HERE:

http://webapp.mcleancountyil.gov/webapps/PublicAccess/TwoWeekDocketCivil.htm

story:
Éste es un proyecto hecho con el corazón

La asociación de familias numerosas Zona Norte (FAN'S) fue creada en el 2005 para ayudar a familias en riesgo de exclusión social, por falta de recursos económicos.

Hace dos años, quedó registrada en la Comunidad de Madrid como asociación que favorecía a colectivos con problemas económicos. A partir de ese momento empezó a tener más presencia dentro de la sociedad, a ampliar su campo de actuación a familias no numerosas, pero con problemas parecidos. También empezó a proveer de alimentos en buen estado a dichas familias, y aquí es donde entra la petición que hacemos mediante indiegogo. Hasta hace unos días repartíamos entre 2000kg - 3000kg de comida mensualmente, mediante furgonetas que nos prestaban algunos benefactores de la asociación, pero dichos benefactores, se han ido reduciendo conforme aumentaba el número de familias a las que atendemos.

Los que trabajamos en ésta asociación, lo hacemos de forma voluntaria, es decir, sin sueldo, pero aún así, no es suficiente para poder ahorrar algo de dinero de lo que algunos benefactores regalan a  la asociación.

Si conseguimos comprar la camioneta mediante ésta campaña, podremos duplicar nuestra labor y llegar a más familias con problemas.

Qué necesitamos y qué obtienes si nos ayudas

Lo que se necesita en un principio son 10000€, para comprar una camioneta de entre 12 y 17 m3, pero si se quedase corta la cifra, compraríamos una furgoneta un poco más pequeña.

En caso de superar la cifra de los 10000€, ese dinero se convertiría inmediatamente en fruta, verdura o alimentos no perecederos para las familias a las que atendemos.

La "recompensa" que podemos ofrecerte por ayudarnos es así de sencilla:Tendrás la seguridad de que la ayuda que nos prestes, por pequeña que sea irá directamente a ayudar a todas éstas familias y su agradecimiento por ello.

También existen otras formas de ayudarnos en éste proyecto

Puedes hacer que ésta campaña llegue a más personas, compartiéndola en redes sociales, por email, el boca a boca, lo que se te ocurra.

Nuestra web, donde podrás ver algunos de nuestros proyectos es: www.afanzonanorte.com

story:
What is Shindiggit?

Hello, my name is Sean Vierth, and I am a 22 year old socialpreneur located in San Diego. I was raised by my grandparents, and they always instilled one strong trait into my thought process. If I was able, help others less fortunate than myself. I was recently humbled when a dear friend's father passed away, and he had a goal in life. Help 1,000,000 people before he died. This resonated so strongly with me that I immediately moved to action and started brainstorming what I know best, and how I could reach that goal for him.

And that's when the "Party to Save Lives" campaign was born. Imagine a marketplace of unique party & entertainment products, with globally participating businesses, where funds raised go to charity. This marketplace would have a percentage of funds go to charity, while also helping small businesses all over the world gain exposure, and become more successful. I have the idea, and I know once this is an established business it will be very successful, and generate a huge impact on many of the less fortunate all around the world. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to consider helping me with this campaign. I have a goal of helping 1,000,000 people, and I will not stop until I reach that goal! And I cannot express enough how thankful I am for the support.

What We Need & What You Get

For a business like this to not only be successful, but also make a significant impact, I will need an estimated $25,000. There is a special formula of marketing and structure needed, that can make a cause go viral. Capturing 1% of the market will lead to 2 Million in revenue, which will help thousands of people worldwide. $25,000 is on the lower spectrum of budgets, but our team is very passionate about what we are doing and will make sure we make it count.

For every contribution, you'll receive a fun mystery gift from the Shindiggit team, as well as an account with Shindiggit where you will see fun insights on the company, built in discounts for being a founding contributor, and most importantly, recognition for making this dream possible and truly making an impact on thousands of lives. (And some really fun products!) We also would love to hear what charities you recommend we donate to!

If we do not meet our financial goal, all of the funds we receive will go towards that goal. First will be business structure, and then all of the supplies we need to get Shindiggit up and running. From there, marketing will be very important so people can learn about our movement. 

The Impact

If (and when) we can truly get Shindiggit up and running, the repercussions will lead to hundreds of thousands raised for various charities all over the world. The current marketplace for this niche of products is entirely capitalized for profits, and nothing is given back to the community. 

I will not fail at my goal, but I just do not have any funding available to fuel my idea. If you help me reach this goal, I will make sure we make a serious impact. 1 Dollar can help feed a child. Imagine generating hundreds of thousands of dollars towards that cause. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to share what we're doing over here at Shindiggit with others, or like us on facebook at http://www.facebook.com/shindiggit. And feel free to check us out at shindiggit.com!

If you believe in what I am doing, please feel free to share my campaign using the indiegogo share tools!

Thank you again for taking the time to read this campaign!
